original: @254a * // rgya gar skad du /
analyzed: @254a * // rgya gar skad du /
translated: In Sanskrit:

original: pinda ni brtan ni rde sha b'arti k'a /
analyzed: pinda ni brtan ni rde sha b'arti k'a /
translated: Pin·∏çanirde≈õa-vartika

original: bod skad du /
analyzed: bod skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:

original: ldog pa bsdus pa bstan pa'i rnam 'grel /
analyzed: ldog pa bsdus pa bstan pa'i rnam 'grel /
translated: A Commentary on the Presentation of the Summary of the Reversal

original: bcom ldan 'das gsung gi dbang phyug dpal 'jam pa'i mgon la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gsung gi dbang phyug dpal 'jam pa'i mgon la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the glorious Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´, the lord of speech.

original: gang zhig nyon mongs che sogs las //
analyzed: gang zhig nyon mongs che sogs las //
translated: He who is definitely liberated from great afflictions and so forth,

original: nges grol yon tan bdag nyid can //
analyzed: nges grol yon tan bdag nyid can //
translated: The embodiment of good qualities,

original: chos kyi mnga' bdag rab tu gtsang //
analyzed: chos kyi mnga' bdag rab tu gtsang //
translated: The lord of the Dharma, completely pure,

original: snying rje byams pas skyob mdzad pa //
analyzed: snying rje byams pas skyob mdzad pa //
translated: Protected by compassion and love,

original: de la rtag gus bla ma la'ang //
analyzed: de la rtag gus bla ma la'ang //
translated: To him, the guru, I am always devoted.

original: rab rmongs mun pa gzhom pa'i phyir //
analyzed: rab rmongs mun pa gzhom pa'i phyir //
translated: In order to destroy the darkness of complete delusion,

original: ldog pa bsdus pa 'di dgrol bya //
analyzed: ldog pa bsdus pa 'di dgrol bya //
translated: I will explain this Summary of the Reversal.

original: 'dir bstan bcos rtsom par mdzad pas dang por phyag 'tshal ba rtsom pa ni ya rabs kyi lugs dang mthun pa dang / don grub par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dir bstan bcos rtsom par mdzad pas dang por phyag 'tshal ba rtsom pa ni ya rabs kyi lugs dang mthun pa dang / don grub par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Here, the author of the treatise first pays homage in order to compose in accordance with the way of the noble ones and to accomplish the purpose.

original: de yang gang la phyag 'tshal ba ni //
analyzed: de yang gang la phyag 'tshal ba ni //
translated: Moreover, to whom is homage paid?

original: 'jam pa'i dpal mgon te /
analyzed: 'jam pa'i dpal mgon te /
translated: To Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´, the protector.

original: gang gi phyir gang dang de ni rtag tu 'brel pa yin pa de'i phyir de bstan to //
analyzed: gang gi phyir gang dang de ni rtag tu 'brel pa yin pa de'i phyir de bstan to //
translated: Because it is always connected with that, therefore it is taught.

original: rtag tu 'brel pa yang bstan pa rtag tu ni ma yin mod kyi bshad pa rtag tu yin no //
analyzed: rtag tu 'brel pa yang bstan pa rtag tu ni ma yin mod kyi bshad pa rtag tu yin no //
translated: And it is always connected, although it is not always taught, it is taught always.

original: phyag 'tshal te zhes bya ba ni bstan par 'dod ces bya ba dang 'brel te /
analyzed: phyag 'tshal te zhes bya ba ni bstan par 'dod ces bya ba dang 'brel te /
translated: Having bowed is connected with having wished to teach.

original: 'di ltar de zhes bya ba ni 'dir 'brel ba'i don te /
analyzed: 'di ltar de zhes bya ba ni 'dir 'brel ba'i don te /
translated: Thus, in this way has the meaning of connection here.

original: bar chad spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bar chad spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is free from obstacles.

original: de yang gang bstan par 'dod na dgag pa nyung zad bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: de yang gang bstan par 'dod na dgag pa nyung zad bsdus pa'o //
translated: And what is wished to be taught is the brief collection of negations.

original: gang las she na /
analyzed: gang las she na /
translated: From what?

original: dgag pa'i bya brag rgya cher bshad pa las so //
analyzed: dgag pa'i bya brag rgya cher bshad pa las so //
translated: From the extensive explanation of the varieties of negation.

original: gang gi phyir na dman pa'i don du ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir na dman pa'i don du ste /
translated: For what purpose? For the sake of the inferior.

original: dman @254b pa ni blo dman pa shes rab mi gsal ba dang / mos pa dman pa le lo can te de dag gi don ched du'o //
analyzed: dman @254b pa ni blo dman pa shes rab mi gsal ba dang / mos pa dman pa le lo can te de dag gi don ched du'o //
translated: The inferior are those of inferior intellect, those of unclear wisdom, those of inferior aspiration, the lazy; it is for their sake.

original: de'i phyir sgra dang bstan bcos kyi mkhan po p'a ni ni la sogs pa mdo mdzad pa dang / ratna ma ti la sogs pas rgyas par mdzad pa dag las don 'di rgya cher bshad kyang bsdus pas 'di zlos bar 'gyur ba'i nyes pa med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir sgra dang bstan bcos kyi mkhan po p'a ni ni la sogs pa mdo mdzad pa dang / ratna ma ti la sogs pas rgyas par mdzad pa dag las don 'di rgya cher bshad kyang bsdus pas 'di zlos bar 'gyur ba'i nyes pa med do //
translated: Therefore, although this matter is explained in detail in the treatises composed by the authors of the treatises and the commentaries, such as Panini, and in the commentaries composed by Ratnamati and others, there is no fault of redundancy in repeating them here.

original: rnam pa gcig tu mkhan po 'di dag mkhas pa'i mthar gyur pas de dag gi gzhung las bsdus pas gang dag dad pas rjes su 'brang ba dag 'jug pa'i yan lag tu 'gyur pa'i phyir yang smos so //
analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu mkhan po 'di dag mkhas pa'i mthar gyur pas de dag gi gzhung las bsdus pas gang dag dad pas rjes su 'brang ba dag 'jug pa'i yan lag tu 'gyur pa'i phyir yang smos so //
translated: In one way, these authors are at the pinnacle of scholars, so it is also mentioned in their texts in order to be a branch of engagement for those who follow with faith.

original: gzhan yang dgos pa ston pa'i tshig 'di dag kyang 'jug pa'i yan lag yin pa'i phyir bstan pa don yod pa nyid du'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang dgos pa ston pa'i tshig 'di dag kyang 'jug pa'i yan lag yin pa'i phyir bstan pa don yod pa nyid du'o //
translated: Moreover, these words that show the purpose are also taught as a branch of engagement, so that the teaching is not pointless.

original: 'dir yang don ni dgos pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang don ni dgos pa'o //
translated: Here, the purpose is the goal.

original: dman pa ni dgos pa'i gzhi'o //üîΩdon ni 'dod pa'i don yin la /üîΩdon khong du chud pa ni dgos pa yin //
analyzed: dman pa ni dgos pa'i gzhi'o // don ni 'dod pa'i don yin la / don khong du chud pa ni dgos pa yin //
translated: The inferior is the basis of the goal.üîΩThe purpose is the desired goal.üîΩUnderstanding the purpose is the goal.

original: don grub pa ni dgos pa'i yang dgos pa yin te /
analyzed: don grub pa ni dgos pa'i yang dgos pa yin te /
translated: Accomplishing the purpose is the ultimate goal.

original: der nus pa zhi 'brel pa yin no //
analyzed: der nus pa zhi 'brel pa yin no //
translated: The power of the antidote is the power of the antidote to the afflictions.üîΩ

original: sgra'o cog brjod pa'i dgos pa ni don ma rtogs pa dang / log par rtogs pa dang / the tshom du gyur par rnams bsal ba dang / don ji lta ba bzhin khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: sgra'o cog brjod pa'i dgos pa ni don ma rtogs pa dang / log par rtogs pa dang / the tshom du gyur par rnams bsal ba dang / don ji lta ba bzhin khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir te /
translated: The purpose of all verbal expression is to eliminate the non-understanding, the misunderstanding, and the doubt of the meaning, and to cause the understanding of the meaning as it is.

original: 'di yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: 'di yang de bzhin no //
translated: This is also so.

original: sad pa la sogs pa'i don du don log par ston pa ni gzhung las mi srid do //
analyzed: sad pa la sogs pa'i don du don log par ston pa ni gzhung las mi srid do //
translated: The non-teaching of the meaning in the texts is not possible for the purpose of awakening, etc.

original: da ni mdor bshad par 'dod pas gzhi bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni mdor bshad par 'dod pas gzhi bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, the author, desiring to explain the treatise in brief, in order to show the basis, says:

original: mkhan pos bstan pa'i mdo dag las //
analyzed: mkhan pos bstan pa'i mdo dag las //
translated: In the sutras taught by the teacher,

original: dgag pa'i bye brag mang bshad kyang //
analyzed: dgag pa'i bye brag mang bshad kyang //
translated: Although many specific negations are explained,üîΩThe explanations of the complete collections

original: kun nas bsdu ba bshad pa dag / ces bya ba smos so //
analyzed: kun nas bsdu ba bshad pa dag / ces bya ba smos so //
translated: are as follows.

original: de dag las bsdu ba ni //
analyzed: de dag las bsdu ba ni //
translated: Among them, the collection isüîΩThe collection of the sutras in categories,üîΩThe dependence of the specific collections,

original: rnam grangs mdo ru bsdu ba dang // bsdus pa'i bye brag ltos pa dang // rab tu gsal bar brjod pa bzhi //
analyzed: rnam grangs mdo ru bsdu ba dang // bsdus pa'i bye brag ltos pa dang // rab tu gsal bar brjod pa bzhi //
translated: And the four clear expressions.

original: 'di dag tsam du shes par bya //
analyzed: 'di dag tsam du shes par bya //
translated: One should know just these.

original: zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: This is so.

original: de la dgag pa'i rnam grangs ji snyed pa yang de par dgag pa dang / ma yin par dgag pa'i bar du bsdu ba ni dang po'o //
analyzed: de la dgag pa'i rnam grangs ji snyed pa yang de par dgag pa dang / ma yin par dgag pa'i bar du bsdu ba ni dang po'o //
translated: The first is the inclusion of all the varieties of negation within the two, the exclusion negation and the non-affirming negation.

original: med pa dang ma yin pa'i khyad par gyi bye brag dang / ma yin par dgag pa'i bye brag nyid bstan pa ni gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: med pa dang ma yin pa'i khyad par gyi bye brag dang / ma yin par dgag pa'i bye brag nyid bstan pa ni gnyis pa'o //
translated: The second is the teaching of the difference of the non-existence and the non-affirming negation.

original: dgag pa gang gi dbang du bstan pa ni ltos pa yin te gsum pa'o //
analyzed: dgag pa gang gi dbang du bstan pa ni ltos pa yin te gsum pa'o //
translated: The third is the dependence on the negation in question.

original: bye brag rab tu gsal bar brjod pa ni bzhi pa ste /
analyzed: bye brag rab tu gsal bar brjod pa ni bzhi pa ste /
translated: The fourth is the clear expression of the difference.

original: mdor bsdu ba ni 'di dag tsam du zad do zhes so //
analyzed: mdor bsdu ba ni 'di dag tsam du zad do zhes so //
translated: This is the sum total of the brief summary.

original: de la dang por rnam grangs mdo ru bsdus pa la brtsams nas /
analyzed: de la dang por rnam grangs mdo ru bsdus pa la brtsams nas /
translated: Now, first of all, beginning with the summary in brief of the varieties,

original: @255a * // med dang gzhan dang 'dra ba dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: @255a * // med dang gzhan dang 'dra ba dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, ‚Äúnon-existence, otherness, similarity, etc.‚Äù

original: de la med par dgag pa ni med pa tsam go bar byed pa yin te //
analyzed: de la med par dgag pa ni med pa tsam go bar byed pa yin te //
translated: Therein, the exclusion negation is the cause of understanding mere non-existence.

original: dper na blun po dag brag rdzong la ba ni gling tshol ba dag la mkhas pa dag gis ban glang med do zhes brjod pa lta bu'o//
analyzed: dper na blun po dag brag rdzong la ba ni gling tshol ba dag la mkhas pa dag gis ban glang med do zhes brjod pa lta bu'o//
translated: For example, when fools search for a place to build a fortress, the wise say, ‚ÄúThere is no elephant.‚Äù

original: gzhan ba zhes bya ba ni go bar bya ba dgag par bya ba las gzhan yin pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan ba zhes bya ba ni go bar bya ba dgag par bya ba las gzhan yin pa ste /
translated: ‚Äú Other‚Äù means something other than what is to be understood or refuted.

original: 'di ltar dper na la la dag skam sa tshol bar 'dod pa na gang zhig gis chu med pa zhes bya bas ston pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar dper na la la dag skam sa tshol bar 'dod pa na gang zhig gis chu med pa zhes bya bas ston pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, when some want to find dry land, others say, ‚ÄúThere is no water.‚Äù

original: 'dra ba zhes bya ba ni 'dra zhing mtshungs pa bkag nas mi 'dra bar ston pa ste /
analyzed: 'dra ba zhes bya ba ni 'dra zhing mtshungs pa bkag nas mi 'dra bar ston pa ste /
translated: ‚Äú Similar‚Äù means teaching something dissimilar by negating similarity or sameness.

original: dper na mi dang 'dra ba ma yin pa ni mi ma yin pa zhes bya ba dang / rig byed ltar rig par byed pa ma yin pa ni rig byed ma yin pa zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na mi dang 'dra ba ma yin pa ni mi ma yin pa zhes bya ba dang / rig byed ltar rig par byed pa ma yin pa ni rig byed ma yin pa zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, ‚Äúnot similar to a human‚Äù means ‚Äúnot a human,‚Äù and ‚Äúnot causing awareness like a Vedic ritual‚Äù means ‚Äúnot a Vedic ritual.‚Äù

original: dman pa zhes bya ba ni yon tan bkag nas dman par ston pa ste /
analyzed: dman pa zhes bya ba ni yon tan bkag nas dman par ston pa ste /
translated: ‚Äú Inferior‚Äù means teaching something inferior by negating qualities.

original: dper na yon tan can gyi bla ma med pa la bla ma med pa zhes pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na yon tan can gyi bla ma med pa la bla ma med pa zhes pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, ‚Äúwithout a qualified guru‚Äù means ‚Äúwithout a guru.‚Äù

original: zhum pa zhes bya ba ni dgag par bya ba rnam par spros pa bkag nas gzhi nyid zhum pa'i ngo bor ston pa ste /
analyzed: zhum pa zhes bya ba ni dgag par bya ba rnam par spros pa bkag nas gzhi nyid zhum pa'i ngo bor ston pa ste /
translated: The term diminished indicates that, having refuted the proliferation of the object of negation, the basis itself is shown to be of the nature of diminution.

original: dper na yul la rgyas par mi dmigs pa'i rnam par shes pa la bsams te /
analyzed: dper na yul la rgyas par mi dmigs pa'i rnam par shes pa la bsams te /
translated: For example, it is like thinking of consciousness that does not observe an object extensively

original: sems med pa'i gnyid ces bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: sems med pa'i gnyid ces bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: and calling it sleep without thought.

original: zhen pa zhes bya ba ni byed pa'i bdag nyid kyi nus pa bkag nas nus pa zhen par ston pa ste /
analyzed: zhen pa zhes bya ba ni byed pa'i bdag nyid kyi nus pa bkag nas nus pa zhen par ston pa ste /
translated: The term attached indicates that, having refuted the capacity of the agent, the capacity is shown to be attached.

original: dper na skyes bu drag tu mi 'gro ba dag la mi 'gro ba zhes brjod pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na skyes bu drag tu mi 'gro ba dag la mi 'gro ba zhes brjod pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like calling someone who does not go very fast a non-goer.

original: phra ba zhes bya ba ni dngos po'i rgyun rags pa dgag pa dag ste /
analyzed: phra ba zhes bya ba ni dngos po'i rgyun rags pa dgag pa dag ste /
translated: The term subtle indicates the cessation of coarse continuums of entities.

original: dper na 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa zhes bya ba lta bu 'du shes phra ba la bsams te brjod pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa zhes bya ba lta bu 'du shes phra ba la bsams te brjod pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like calling the meditative attainment of non-perception subtle perception, thinking of subtle perception.

original: nyung ba zhes bya ba ni rang 'dod pa'i don du 'gyur ba'i rnam grangs dag la mang ba dgag pa ste /
analyzed: nyung ba zhes bya ba ni rang 'dod pa'i don du 'gyur ba'i rnam grangs dag la mang ba dgag pa ste /
translated: The term few indicates the cessation of many synonyms that are meaningful for oneself.

original: dper na skyes bu rkang 'gros nyung ba dag la rkang 'gros med pa zhes brjod pas shes par bya ba nyung ba nyid yin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na skyes bu rkang 'gros nyung ba dag la rkang 'gros med pa zhes brjod pas shes par bya ba nyung ba nyid yin pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, when it is said that a person has no feet, it is understood that he has few feet.

original: myur ba zhes bya ba ni ji srid kyi rgyun ring ba bkag nas dus yun thung ba stan pa yin te /
analyzed: myur ba zhes bya ba ni ji srid kyi rgyun ring ba bkag nas dus yun thung ba stan pa yin te /
translated: Swift is the opposite of long-lasting, and it shows a short period of time.

original: dper na skyes bu gang zhig gnas gang zhig tu yun ring du ma 'dug pa dag la la der ma 'dug par brjod pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na skyes bu gang zhig gnas gang zhig tu yun ring du ma 'dug pa dag la la der ma 'dug par brjod pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, when it is said that a person does not stay long in a place, it is understood that he stays there for a short time.

original: chung ba zhes bya ba ni dngos po'i rnag bzhin rgya che ba bkag nas chung ba'i ngo bo nyid ston pa ste /
analyzed: chung ba zhes bya ba ni dngos po'i rnag bzhin rgya che ba bkag nas chung ba'i ngo bo nyid ston pa ste /
translated: Small is the opposite of a large entity, and it shows a small nature.

original: dper na skyes bu gzugs chung ba dag tu shes par bya ba la @255b gzugs med ces bya bas brjod pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na skyes bu gzugs chung ba dag tu shes par bya ba la @255b gzugs med ces bya bas brjod pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, when it is said that a person has no form, it is understood that he has little form.

original: lhag ma med pa zhes bya ba ni gang bsams pa'i don las lhag par gyur pa bkag nas rnag gi 'dod pa 'ba' zhig tsam ston pa ste /
analyzed: lhag ma med pa zhes bya ba ni gang bsams pa'i don las lhag par gyur pa bkag nas rnag gi 'dod pa 'ba' zhig tsam ston pa ste /
translated: Without remainder is the opposite of what is beyond the intended meaning, and it shows only the desire of the speaker.

original: dper na de phan chad grangs kyi gnas gzhan med pa la grangs med pa zhes bya ba dang / gang zhig gis 'dod par bya ba blang ba la sogs pa'i phyir dris pa dang / gzhan dag gis de la gang dris pa de dag med do zhes brjod na /
analyzed: dper na de phan chad grangs kyi gnas gzhan med pa la grangs med pa zhes bya ba dang / gang zhig gis 'dod par bya ba blang ba la sogs pa'i phyir dris pa dang / gzhan dag gis de la gang dris pa de dag med do zhes brjod na /
translated: For example, when there is no other place for enumeration beyond that, it is called innumerable, or when one asks in order to accept what is to be desired and so on, and others reply that what is asked is nonexistent,

original: der rang gi 'dod pa dag ni med par khas mi len gyi //
analyzed: der rang gi 'dod pa dag ni med par khas mi len gyi //
translated: therein one does not accept that one's desires are nonexistent.

original: de las lhag par gyur pa'i 'dod pa dag med par sgrub pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: de las lhag par gyur pa'i 'dod pa dag med par sgrub pa lta bu'o //
translated: It is like establishing that there are no desires beyond that.

original: mtha' dag ma yin pa ni kun du khyab par gyur pa dag bkag nas dngos po 'ga' zhig ni 'gegs par mi byed pa dag ste /
analyzed: mtha' dag ma yin pa ni kun du khyab par gyur pa dag bkag nas dngos po 'ga' zhig ni 'gegs par mi byed pa dag ste /
translated: Not all is when, having refuted pervasives, one does not refute some things.

original: dper na rgyu mtha' dag ni 'bras bu la nges pa med pa yin no zhes brjod na /
analyzed: dper na rgyu mtha' dag ni 'bras bu la nges pa med pa yin no zhes brjod na /
translated: For example, when it is said that all causes are uncertain with regard to their effects,

original: rgyu 'ga' ni nges par gyur kyang 'gegs par mi byed pa dang / gang yang rnam pa thams cad kyi thams cad la gang yang rung ba'i khyad par dag bkag par byas pas 'ga' 'ga' dag la mi 'gog pa ste de lta bu dag go //
analyzed: rgyu 'ga' ni nges par gyur kyang 'gegs par mi byed pa dang / gang yang rnam pa thams cad kyi thams cad la gang yang rung ba'i khyad par dag bkag par byas pas 'ga' 'ga' dag la mi 'gog pa ste de lta bu dag go //
translated: Some causes are certain, but do not block; and some are blocked in all cases, but do not block some.

original: mi mthun pa zhes ba ni rgyun lhan cig gnas par gyur na gang zhig la gnas pa'i mthu med pa yin te /
analyzed: mi mthun pa zhes ba ni rgyun lhan cig gnas par gyur na gang zhig la gnas pa'i mthu med pa yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúOpposites‚Äù are those that do not coexist in a continuum, because they lack the power to coexist.

original: de bstan par bya ba'i phyir de'i gnyen po dgag par bya ba ston pa ste /
analyzed: de bstan par bya ba'i phyir de'i gnyen po dgag par bya ba ston pa ste /
translated: In order to demonstrate that, the opponent‚Äôs position is presented as the object of negation.

original: dper na snang ba'i 'od dang rgyun lhan cig par mi gnas pa mun pa dang / de bzhin du rig pa dang / ma rig pa dang / shes rab dang / som nyid dang / ye shes dang // nyon mongs pa dang / btang snyoms dang /
analyzed: dper na snang ba'i 'od dang rgyun lhan cig par mi gnas pa mun pa dang / de bzhin du rig pa dang / ma rig pa dang / shes rab dang / som nyid dang / ye shes dang // nyon mongs pa dang / btang snyoms dang /
translated: For example, light and darkness do not coexist in a continuum, and likewise, knowledge and ignorance, wisdom and doubt, and afflictions and equanimity.

original: 'dod pa dang / byams pa dang / rnam par 'tshe ba la sogs pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa dang / byams pa dang / rnam par 'tshe ba la sogs pa lta bu ste /
translated: Also, desire and love, and desire and malice, and so on.

original: mun pa go bar bya ba la snang ba ma yin pa zhes bya bas brjod pa la sogs pa dag go //
analyzed: mun pa go bar bya ba la snang ba ma yin pa zhes bya bas brjod pa la sogs pa dag go //
translated: The expression ‚Äúnon-light‚Äù is used to designate the darkness that is the counter-agent of light.

original: gnyen po zhes bya ba ni lhan cig gnas na gang gis nus pa 'phrog par byed pa ste /
analyzed: gnyen po zhes bya ba ni lhan cig gnas na gang gis nus pa 'phrog par byed pa ste /
translated: The expression ‚Äúcounter-agent‚Äù is used to designate that which, when present, destroys the power of another.

original: snang ba dang mun pa la sogs pa brjod pa ji lta ba'o //
analyzed: snang ba dang mun pa la sogs pa brjod pa ji lta ba'o //
translated: This is the case, for example, with light and darkness.

original: 'di gnyis kyi bye brag ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'di gnyis kyi bye brag ci zhe na /
translated: What is the difference between these two?

original: mi mthun pa ni rgyun la gnod pa'i nus pa med la /
analyzed: mi mthun pa ni rgyun la gnod pa'i nus pa med la /
translated: The non-counter-agent does not have the power to destroy the stream of the other.

original: gnyen po ni nus pa yod pa ste /
analyzed: gnyen po ni nus pa yod pa ste /
translated: The counter-agent does have this power.

original: 'di ltar mun pa dang snang ba phrad pa na mun pa ni snang ba nyid mthu nyams na de'i yul du 'ong gi / snang ba ji srid pa de srid du de'i yul gnod par mi byad do //
analyzed: 'di ltar mun pa dang snang ba phrad pa na mun pa ni snang ba nyid mthu nyams na de'i yul du 'ong gi / snang ba ji srid pa de srid du de'i yul gnod par mi byad do //
translated: In fact, when light and darkness are in contact, the light destroys the power of the darkness and the darkness is no longer able to manifest in its own domain. But as long as the light is not present, the darkness manifests in its own domain.

original: snang ba ni mun pa cher gnas kyang de'i yul mthar gyis gnod pa byed de /üîΩde bzhin @256a * //
analyzed: snang ba ni mun pa cher gnas kyang de'i yul mthar gyis gnod pa byed de / de bzhin @256a * //
translated: The light, even when it is very small, destroys the domain of the darkness little by little.üîΩThe same for ignorance and knowledge, etc.

original: du ma rig pa dang rig pa la sogs pa brjod pa rnams la yang sbyar bar bya ste 'di gnyis ni bya brag go //
analyzed: du ma rig pa dang rig pa la sogs pa brjod pa rnams la yang sbyar bar bya ste 'di gnyis ni bya brag go //
translated: This is the difference between the non-counter-agent and the counter-agent.

original: de'i phyir gnyen po dgag pa zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar bstan par bya ba byams pa go bar bya ba la zhe sdang med pa zhes bya ba dang / snang ba ston na mun pa med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir gnyen po dgag pa zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar bstan par bya ba byams pa go bar bya ba la zhe sdang med pa zhes bya ba dang / snang ba ston na mun pa med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston pa lta bu'o //
translated: Therefore, the term ‚Äúantidote‚Äù is taught in this way: just as it is taught that ‚Äúnon-aversion‚Äù is to be understood as love, and ‚Äúnon-darkness‚Äù is to be understood as the illumination of light.

original: bral ba zhes bya ba ni med pas mtshon nas yod pa go bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: bral ba zhes bya ba ni med pas mtshon nas yod pa go bar byed pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúSeparation‚Äù is understood as existence through the illustration of non-existence.

original: gang zhig la gang zhig yod pa las dad las bral te mi ldan na bral ba'i thob pa gang yin pa go bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: gang zhig la gang zhig yod pa las dad las bral te mi ldan na bral ba'i thob pa gang yin pa go bar byed pa ste /
translated: It is understood that the attainment of separation is from the existence of something that is separated from something else, and is not possessed.

original: 'di ltar mya ngan dang bral te mi ldan pa'i dngos po ngo bo nyid la mya ngan med pa zhe 'am /
analyzed: 'di ltar mya ngan dang bral te mi ldan pa'i dngos po ngo bo nyid la mya ngan med pa zhe 'am /
translated: For example, it is understood that the nature of a thing that is separated from sorrow is not sorrow.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba dang / 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du skyes bu gos dang bral te mi ldan pa la gos med pa zhes bya ba dang / rgyun dang bral ba'i phyir log pa la rgyun las log pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba dang / 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du skyes bu gos dang bral te mi ldan pa la gos med pa zhes bya ba dang / rgyun dang bral ba'i phyir log pa la rgyun las log pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: The term reversal is a synonym for separation from continuity, and so on.

original: de dag ni rnam grangs bco lnga yin pas /üîΩrnam grangs bco lngar bshad pa yin //
analyzed: de dag ni rnam grangs bco lnga yin pas / rnam grangs bco lngar bshad pa yin //
translated: These are the fifteen synonyms.

original: zhes bya ba la thug gi bar du bsnyad pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la thug gi bar du bsnyad pa yin no //
translated: The text continues up to the line: These are explained as the fifteen synonyms.

original: da ni de dag gi bsdu ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni de dag gi bsdu ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate their inclusion, it says:

original: de las cung zad bsdu ba ni /
analyzed: de las cung zad bsdu ba ni /
translated: A brief inclusion of those is

original: brgyad nas gnyis kyi bar du ste //üîΩzhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: brgyad nas gnyis kyi bar du ste // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: from eight up to two.

original: bar du zhes bya ba ni bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: bar du zhes bya ba ni bsdu ba'o //
translated: Here, the term up to means inclusion.

original: ste zhes bya ba lhag ma'o //
analyzed: ste zhes bya ba lhag ma'o //
translated: The term up to is a remainder.

original: de las dang po brgyad du bsdu ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de las dang po brgyad du bsdu ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the first inclusion of eight, it says:

original: zhum dang zhan pa dman par te //
analyzed: zhum dang zhan pa dman par te //
translated: Depressed, weak, inferior,

original: phra ba la sogs drug gcig tu //
analyzed: phra ba la sogs drug gcig tu //
translated: subtle, and so on, are one.

original: zhes smos te /
analyzed: zhes smos te /
translated: This is what is meant.üîΩüîΩ

original: bsdu zhes bya ba tshig lhag ma'o //
analyzed: bsdu zhes bya ba tshig lhag ma'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúand so on‚Äù is a remainder.

original: de las ji ltar bsdu zhe na /
analyzed: de las ji ltar bsdu zhe na /
translated: How are they included?

original: zhum pa yang kun du spros pa bkag nas gzhi nyid kun du zhum par ston la /
analyzed: zhum pa yang kun du spros pa bkag nas gzhi nyid kun du zhum par ston la /
translated: Depression is taught to be a depression of the basis, having blocked the proliferation of depression.

original: zhan pa yang nus pa drag pos bkag nas nus pa zhan par ston te /
analyzed: zhan pa yang nus pa drag pos bkag nas nus pa zhan par ston te /
translated: Weakness is taught to be a weakness of ability, having blocked strong ability.

original: dman pa yang yon tan 'gegs pa yin pas de'i phyir yon tan gyi phyogs dgag par gsum ka 'du'o //
analyzed: dman pa yang yon tan 'gegs pa yin pas de'i phyir yon tan gyi phyogs dgag par gsum ka 'du'o //
translated: Inferiority is also a blocking of good qualities. Therefore, the three are included in the blocking of the side of good qualities.

original: phra ba la sogs pa yang chung bar bsdu ste /
analyzed: phra ba la sogs pa yang chung bar bsdu ste /
translated: The subtle and so on are also included in the small.

original: 'di ltar phra bar ston pa dang / nyung bar ston pa dang / yun thung bar ston pa dang / chung bar ston pa dang / lhag pa med par ston pa dang / mtha' dag ma yin par ston pa rnams kyang che ba'am rigs pa'i phyogs dgag par mtshungs te /
analyzed: 'di ltar phra bar ston pa dang / nyung bar ston pa dang / yun thung bar ston pa dang / chung bar ston pa dang / lhag pa med par ston pa dang / mtha' dag ma yin par ston pa rnams kyang che ba'am rigs pa'i phyogs dgag par mtshungs te /
translated: Thus, the teaching of the subtle, the teaching of the few, the teaching of the short duration, the teaching of the small, the teaching of the remainderless, and the teaching of the incomplete are similar in blocking the side of greatness or reason.

original: de'i phyir gcig tu 'du'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir gcig tu 'du'o //
translated: Therefore, they are included in one.

original: des na dgag pa'i rnam grangs brgyad du bsdu ste /
analyzed: des na dgag pa'i rnam grangs brgyad du bsdu ste /
translated: Thus, the eight types of synonyms of negation are included in three.

original: 'di ltar med par dgag pa dang / ma @256b yin par dgag pa dang / 'dra ba las dgag pa dang / dman par dgag pa dang / phra bar dgag ba dang / mi mthun par dgag pa dang / gnyen por dgag pa dang / phral bar dgag pa ste brgyad do //
analyzed: 'di ltar med par dgag pa dang / ma @256b yin par dgag pa dang / 'dra ba las dgag pa dang / dman par dgag pa dang / phra bar dgag ba dang / mi mthun par dgag pa dang / gnyen por dgag pa dang / phral bar dgag pa ste brgyad do //
translated: negation of nonexistence, negation of nonbeing, negation of similarity, negation of inferiority, negation of subtlety, negation of incompatibility, negation of antidote, and negation of separation.

original: bdun du bsdu ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bdun du bsdu ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the inclusion of seven,üîΩit is said:

original: mi mthun gnyen por sbyar bas bdun //üîΩzhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: mi mthun gnyen por sbyar bas bdun // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Seven by applying incompatibility and antidote.

original: rgyun lhan cig gnas pa la 'gal ba yin pas mi mthun pa shas che na /
analyzed: rgyun lhan cig gnas pa la 'gal ba yin pas mi mthun pa shas che na /
translated: Since the incompatible are very strong in the simultaneous presence of the stream,

original: gnyen po mthu nyams par ma byas kyang byas pa dang 'dra bas mi mthun pa yang gnyen por bsdu ste /
analyzed: gnyen po mthu nyams par ma byas kyang byas pa dang 'dra bas mi mthun pa yang gnyen por bsdu ste /
translated: even though the power of the antidote is not impaired, it is as if it is impaired. Thus, incompatibility is also included in the antidote.

original: de ltar na rnam grangs bdun no //
analyzed: de ltar na rnam grangs bdun no //
translated: Thus, there are seven categories.

original: drug tu bsdu ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: drug tu bsdu ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the inclusion of six,üîΩit is said:

original: dman dang chung dang zhum pa ru //
analyzed: dman dang chung dang zhum pa ru //
translated: Inferior, small, and weak

original: bsdus pa zhes bya lhag ma'o //
analyzed: bsdus pa zhes bya lhag ma'o //
translated: are said to be included. The rest are different.

original: dgag pa'i rnam grangs rnam pa drug ste /
analyzed: dgag pa'i rnam grangs rnam pa drug ste /
translated: There are six kinds of negation.

original: dman pa dang chung ba dag kyang rang gi gzhi mi 'dor bar 'dra ba'i phyir der 'du ste /
analyzed: dman pa dang chung ba dag kyang rang gi gzhi mi 'dor bar 'dra ba'i phyir der 'du ste /
translated: Inferior and superior are included in that, because they are similar in not abandoning their own basis.

original: de'i phyir drug tu'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir drug tu'o //
translated: Therefore, there are six.

original: rnam grangs lngar dbye ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam grangs lngar dbye ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To indicate the fivefold division, it says:

original: don gyis go bar byed pa dang // tshig gcig rnam par sgrub pa dang // de ldan rang tshig mi ston pa //
analyzed: don gyis go bar byed pa dang // tshig gcig rnam par sgrub pa dang // de ldan rang tshig mi ston pa //
translated: Indicated by meaning, established by one word, not showing one's own words,

original: de las gzhan pa gzhan yin no //üîΩzhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa gzhan yin no // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: and different from that.

original: de la don gyis go bar byed pa ni dper na lha sbyin nyin par zan mi za ba las tsho zhes brjod na /
analyzed: de la don gyis go bar byed pa ni dper na lha sbyin nyin par zan mi za ba las tsho zhes brjod na /
translated: Among those, indicated by meaning is like saying Devadatta does not eat during the day,

original: mtshan mo za bar don gyis go ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: mtshan mo za bar don gyis go ba lta bu'o //
translated: where eating at night is understood by implication.

original: tshig gcig gis sgrub par byed pa ni ma skyes pa yod ces bya ba brjod na yod pa'i tshig gcig gis ma skyes pa'i dngos po sgrub pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: tshig gcig gis sgrub par byed pa ni ma skyes pa yod ces bya ba brjod na yod pa'i tshig gcig gis ma skyes pa'i dngos po sgrub pa lta bu'o //
translated: Established by one word is like saying existence of non-arisen, where the word existence establishes non-arisen things.

original: de gnyi ga dang ldan pa ni ma yin par dgag pa nyid de /
analyzed: de gnyi ga dang ldan pa ni ma yin par dgag pa nyid de /
translated: Both of those are just implicative negations.

original: don gyis go bar 'gyur yang tshig gcig gis sgrub par yang sbyar du rung ba'o //
analyzed: don gyis go bar 'gyur yang tshig gcig gis sgrub par yang sbyar du rung ba'o //
translated: Although the meaning is understood, it is also suitable to apply it with one word.

original: rang gi tshig gis mi ston pa ni rgyal rigs la bram ze ma yin pa zhes brjod pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: rang gi tshig gis mi ston pa ni rgyal rigs la bram ze ma yin pa zhes brjod pa lta bu'o //
translated: Not teaching with one's own words is like saying not a Brahmin to a Brahmin.

original: de dag las gzhan pa ni dngos su ston pa ste /
analyzed: de dag las gzhan pa ni dngos su ston pa ste /
translated: Other than those, it is directly taught.

original: med par ston pa tsam byed pa'o //
analyzed: med par ston pa tsam byed pa'o //
translated: It merely teaches non-existence.

original: rnam grangs bzhir bsdu ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam grangs bzhir bsdu ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the four types of inclusion, it is said:üîΩThe four types of cessation are:üîΩcessation through thorough analysis,üîΩcessation through the basis itself,

original: kun du brtags pa'i 'gog pa dang // rang gi gzhi las zhum pa dang // gzhan dang 'gal ba rnam pa bzhi //üîΩzhes bya ba smos te ;
analyzed: kun du brtags pa'i 'gog pa dang // rang gi gzhi las zhum pa dang // gzhan dang 'gal ba rnam pa bzhi // zhes bya ba smos te ;
translated: cessation through conflict with others.

original: de la kun brtags pa'i 'gog par byed pa'i dgog pa ni med par dgag pa yin te /üîΩ'di ltar gzhan dag khas len pa'i log par rtog pas brtags pa'i 'dod pa bsal ba dang / som nyid dang ma rtogs pa dag bsal ba'i bya ba byed pas don gyi de kho na nyid ston par mi byed @257a * //
analyzed: de la kun brtags pa'i 'gog par byed pa'i dgog pa ni med par dgag pa yin te / 'di ltar gzhan dag khas len pa'i log par rtog pas brtags pa'i 'dod pa bsal ba dang / som nyid dang ma rtogs pa dag bsal ba'i bya ba byed pas don gyi de kho na nyid ston par mi byed @257a * //
translated: Among those, cessation through thorough analysis is an affirming negation,

original: pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it performs the function of dispelling the desires imagined by false conceptions accepted by others, and dispelling doubts and misunderstandings, but it does not teach the reality of the object.

original: rang gi gzhi las zhum pa ni dman pa dang / zhan pa dang / phra ba dang / chung ba dang / nyung ba dang / yun thung ba dang / lhag ma med pa dang / mtha' dag ma yin pa rnams kyang bstan par bya ba rang rang gi gzhi mi 'dor la /
analyzed: rang gi gzhi las zhum pa ni dman pa dang / zhan pa dang / phra ba dang / chung ba dang / nyung ba dang / yun thung ba dang / lhag ma med pa dang / mtha' dag ma yin pa rnams kyang bstan par bya ba rang rang gi gzhi mi 'dor la /
translated: The term diminution is used to indicate inferiority, weakness, subtlety, smallness, fewness, brevity, absence of remainder, and incompleteness, and it is used in the sense of not abandoning one's own basis.

original: zhum pa'am bcum pa'i ngo bor ston par mtshungs so //
analyzed: zhum pa'am bcum pa'i ngo bor ston par mtshungs so //
translated: The term diminution is used in the sense of indicating a diminished entity, and it is used in the sense of similarity.

original: gzhan pa ni bstan par bya ba gzhan pa yin la 'gal ba dang mi mthun pa med pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan pa ni bstan par bya ba gzhan pa yin la 'gal ba dang mi mthun pa med pa'o //
translated: The term other is used to indicate another basis that is not contradictory or incompatible.

original: 'gal ba ni rgyun lhan cig gnas par mi rung ba ste grang ba dang tsha ba'i reg pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'gal ba ni rgyun lhan cig gnas par mi rung ba ste grang ba dang tsha ba'i reg pa lta bu'o //
translated: The term contradictory is used to indicate that which is not suitable to remain together, like the sensation of cold and the sensation of heat.

original: gsum du bsdu ba ni /
analyzed: gsum du bsdu ba ni /
translated: The term three is used to indicate the three kinds of negation.

original: med pa dang ni gzhan pa dang // gnyen po'i don la 'jug pa gsum //üîΩzhes smos pa yin te /
analyzed: med pa dang ni gzhan pa dang // gnyen po'i don la 'jug pa gsum // zhes smos pa yin te /
translated: The three kinds of negation are non-existence, otherness, and the object of negation.

original: de la dgag pa 'di gsum ni dper na ma byas zhes brjod na byas par 'dod pa 'gegs pa zhig ste /
analyzed: de la dgag pa 'di gsum ni dper na ma byas zhes brjod na byas par 'dod pa 'gegs pa zhig ste /
translated: The term non-existence is used to indicate the negation of existence.üîΩThe term otherness is used to indicate the negation of identity.

original: byas pa med pa tsam ston na ma'i sgra med pa la 'jug go //üîΩgal te byas pa las gzhan pa'i dngos po gcig khong du chud par byed na gzhan pa la 'jug go //
analyzed: byas pa med pa tsam ston na ma'i sgra med pa la 'jug go // gal te byas pa las gzhan pa'i dngos po gcig khong du chud par byed na gzhan pa la 'jug go //
translated: If it merely indicates non-existence of the effect, the word is used in the sense of absence.üîΩIf it makes one understand a thing other than the effect, the word is used in the sense of difference.

original: gal te byas pa dang lhan cig 'gal ba ston na ma'i sgra 'gal ba la 'jug ste /
analyzed: gal te byas pa dang lhan cig 'gal ba ston na ma'i sgra 'gal ba la 'jug ste /
translated: If it indicates the effect as contradictory with the cause, the word is used in the sense of contradiction.

original: 'di rnams su bsdu bar brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di rnams su bsdu bar brjod pa yin no //
translated: These are the ways in which the word is used.

original: gnyis su bsdu ba brjod pa'i phyir //
analyzed: gnyis su bsdu ba brjod pa'i phyir //
translated: In order to state the twofold classification, he says:

original: dgag pa'i rnam grangs ji snyed pa //üîΩmed dang ma yin gnyis su 'du //
analyzed: dgag pa'i rnam grangs ji snyed pa // med dang ma yin gnyis su 'du //
translated: All the synonyms of negation

original: zhes smos te /
analyzed: zhes smos te /
translated: are included in the two, non-existence and non-being.

original: 'di ltar gal te med pa go bar byed pa yin na ni med par dgag pa zhes bya la /
analyzed: 'di ltar gal te med pa go bar byed pa yin na ni med par dgag pa zhes bya la /
translated: Thus, if it makes one understand non-existence, it is called absolute negation.üîΩIf it makes one understand a non-existent thing, it is called relative negation.

original: ma yin pa'i dngos po zhig go bar byed na ni ma yin par dgag pa zhes bya ba'i grangs su 'gro bas 'di gnyis su mi 'du ba med do //
analyzed: ma yin pa'i dngos po zhig go bar byed na ni ma yin par dgag pa zhes bya ba'i grangs su 'gro bas 'di gnyis su mi 'du ba med do //
translated: Thus, there is no negation that is not included in these two.

original: ldog pa rab tu bstan pa zhes bya ba las rnam grangs mdor bsdu ba'i le'u ste dang po'o /
analyzed: ldog pa rab tu bstan pa zhes bya ba las rnam grangs mdor bsdu ba'i le'u ste dang po'o /
translated: This concludes the first chapter, on the brief classification of the synonyms of negation, in the Treatise on the Presentation of the Types of Negation.

original: // / da ni bsdus pa'i bye brag bstan par 'dod nas /
analyzed: // / da ni bsdus pa'i bye brag bstan par 'dod nas /
translated: Now, wishing to teach the distinctions of the collections,

original: bstan bya don yod don med dang // zhes pa nas /
analyzed: bstan bya don yod don med dang // zhes pa nas /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúThe object of expression is existent and nonexistent,‚ÄùüîΩup to

original: bsdus pa'i bye brag shes par bya //üîΩzhes bya ba'i bar dag smos te /
analyzed: bsdus pa'i bye brag shes par bya // zhes bya ba'i bar dag smos te /
translated: one should know the distinctions of the collections.

original: de la bstan par bya ba ni khong du chud pa'o //
analyzed: de la bstan par bya ba ni khong du chud pa'o //
translated: Therein, the object of expression is comprehension.

original: don ni yul lo //
analyzed: don ni yul lo //
translated: Object is the domain.

original: yod pa ni ji ltar yang dmigs su yod pa'i dngos po'o //
analyzed: yod pa ni ji ltar yang dmigs su yod pa'i dngos po'o //
translated: Existent is an entity that is available to be observed in any way.

original: bstan par bya ba med pa ni de ltar ma yin pa ste de ni don gyi bye brag go //
analyzed: bstan par bya ba med pa ni de ltar ma yin pa ste de ni don gyi bye brag go //
translated: The object of expression that is nonexistent is not like that. That is the distinction of the object.üîΩThe mode of engagement is direct and indirect,

original: 'jug tshul dngos dang brgyud pa dang // zhes bya ba ni sgra 'jug pa'i thabs kyi bye brag ste /
analyzed: 'jug tshul dngos dang brgyud pa dang // zhes bya ba ni sgra 'jug pa'i thabs kyi bye brag ste /
translated: he says. This is the distinction of the means of engagement of the terms.

original: de la 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni sgra 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni sgra 'jug pa'o //
translated: Therein, engagement is the engagement of the terms.

original: tshul ni de'i thabs sam lugs te /
analyzed: tshul ni de'i thabs sam lugs te /
translated: Mode is the means or system of that.

original: de'i bye brag ni dngos @257b dang brgyud pa'o zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i bye brag ni dngos @257b dang brgyud pa'o zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The distinction of that is direct and indirect.

original: de la dngos su 'jug pa ni sgra ji bzhin pa ste /
analyzed: de la dngos su 'jug pa ni sgra ji bzhin pa ste /
translated: Therein, direct engagement is the literal meaning.

original: bstan pas 'jug ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bstan pas 'jug ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúengagement through teaching‚Äù is that.

original: brgyud pa ni shes bar bya ba gzhan yod pa ste /
analyzed: brgyud pa ni shes bar bya ba gzhan yod pa ste /
translated: The lineage is the existence of something to be known.

original: bshad pa'i tshul gyis 'jug ces bya ba yin no //
analyzed: bshad pa'i tshul gyis 'jug ces bya ba yin no //
translated: The mode of explanation is the engagement.

original: da ni dgos pa'i khyad par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni dgos pa'i khyad par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to teach the difference in purpose, he says:

original: kun du brtags pa bzlog pa dang // chos kyi de nyid bstan pa dang // gzhan gyi 'dod pa bsal ba dang // rang gi 'dod ba'ang sgrub pa dang // zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: kun du brtags pa bzlog pa dang // chos kyi de nyid bstan pa dang // gzhan gyi 'dod pa bsal ba dang // rang gi 'dod ba'ang sgrub pa dang // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The reversal of the imagined, the teaching of reality, the elimination of the desires of others, the establishment of one‚Äôs own desire, and the attainment of the result.

original: de la kun du brtags pa zhes bya ba ni log pa'i rtog pas nan gyis brtags pa ste thag pa la sprul bzhin no //
analyzed: de la kun du brtags pa zhes bya ba ni log pa'i rtog pas nan gyis brtags pa ste thag pa la sprul bzhin no //
translated: Therein, the imagined is the intense imagination by false imagination, like a snake on a rope.

original: de bzlog pa ni kun du rtog pa bzlog pa yin te /
analyzed: de bzlog pa ni kun du rtog pa bzlog pa yin te /
translated: The reversal of that is the reversal of imagination.

original: brtags pa ni shin tu med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir de bzlog pa dang gzhag pa med kyi /
analyzed: brtags pa ni shin tu med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir de bzlog pa dang gzhag pa med kyi /
translated: Since the imagined is utterly nonexistent, its reversal and establishment do not exist.

original: 'on kyang 'jig rten pa dag yod pa nyid du rtog pas de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang 'jig rten pa dag yod pa nyid du rtog pas de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: However, since worldly people imagine it to exist, it is said thus.

original: chos kyi de kho na nyid ni 'di ltar chos gang yang rang rang gi de kho na nyid mi 'dor te ;
analyzed: chos kyi de kho na nyid ni 'di ltar chos gang yang rang rang gi de kho na nyid mi 'dor te ;
translated: The reality of phenomena is such that no phenomenon abandons its own reality.

original: de la 'di nyid de yin te ma nor bas na de kho na'o //
analyzed: de la 'di nyid de yin te ma nor bas na de kho na'o //
translated: It is just this, and not mistaken, so it is reality.

original: de'i ngo bo nyid yin te /üîΩ'di ltar dngos po'i ngo bo nyid dam /
analyzed: de'i ngo bo nyid yin te / 'di ltar dngos po'i ngo bo nyid dam /
translated: It is its own nature.

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid ni chos kyi de kho na nyid do //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid ni chos kyi de kho na nyid do //
translated: Thus, the reality of phenomena is the nature of things or the nature of nonthings.

original: sgra gang gis de ston ba ni snga ma las gzhan nyid du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: sgra gang gis de ston ba ni snga ma las gzhan nyid du shes par bya'o //
translated: The term that teaches this is to be understood as different from the previous one.

original: gzhan yang gzhan gyi 'dod pa grub pa'i mtha' sel zhing bzlog pa ni rang gi grub pa'i mtha' mi sgrub la /
analyzed: gzhan yang gzhan gyi 'dod pa grub pa'i mtha' sel zhing bzlog pa ni rang gi grub pa'i mtha' mi sgrub la /
translated: Moreover, the refutation and reversal of the tenets of others does not establish one‚Äôs own tenets.

original: rang gi 'dod pa'ang sgrub pa dang // zhes bya ba'i 'ang gi sgra brjod pa ni gzhan gyi 'dod pa sel ba 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
analyzed: rang gi 'dod pa'ang sgrub pa dang // zhes bya ba'i 'ang gi sgra brjod pa ni gzhan gyi 'dod pa sel ba 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
translated: The term ‚Äúand‚Äù in the line ‚Äúand establishes one‚Äôs own assertions‚Äù indicates that not only does it eliminate the assertions of others,

original: rang gi 'dod pa'i don yang sgrub par byed de /
analyzed: rang gi 'dod pa'i don yang sgrub par byed de /
translated: it also establishes the meaning of one‚Äôs own assertions.

original: 'di yang dgos pa'i bye brag go //
analyzed: 'di yang dgos pa'i bye brag go //
translated: This is another specific purpose.

original: 'byung ba'i dus kyi khyad par gyis //
analyzed: 'byung ba'i dus kyi khyad par gyis //
translated: The specific time of occurrence

original: zhes bya ba ni 'byung ba dang dus kyi bye brag bstan te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'byung ba dang dus kyi bye brag bstan te /
translated: This shows the difference in terms of the elements and time.

original: de la 'byung ba ni sgra brjod pa 'byung ba'o //üîΩde'i dus ni dus gang gi tshe sgra 'di 'byung bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: de la 'byung ba ni sgra brjod pa 'byung ba'o // de'i dus ni dus gang gi tshe sgra 'di 'byung bar 'gyur la /
translated: Therein, the elements are the elements from which sound arises.üîΩTime is the time at which this sound will arise.

original: gang gi tshe 'di 'byung ngo zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'di 'byung ngo zhes bya ba ste /
translated: At what time will this arise?üîΩOne should understand the difference between non-existence and non-actuality by means of these.

original: de dag gis med pa dang ma yin pa gnyis kyi bye brag shes par bya'o zhes bya ba ni khyad par de dag gang gis khyad par yin pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de dag gis med pa dang ma yin pa gnyis kyi bye brag shes par bya'o zhes bya ba ni khyad par de dag gang gis khyad par yin pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show what the difference is, he says:üîΩThe meaning, the mode of engagement, the purpose,

original: don dang 'jug tshul dgos pa dang // 'byung tshul dbang ste go rims bzhin //üîΩzhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: don dang 'jug tshul dgos pa dang // 'byung tshul dbang ste go rims bzhin // zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: and the mode of arising are the four in order.

original: da ni bye brag de dag dgag pa rnam pa gnyis dang go rims ji ltar sbyar ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni bye brag de dag dgag pa rnam pa gnyis dang go rims ji ltar sbyar ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to show the order in which the two kinds of negation are applied to those differences, he says:

original: med pa'i bstan bya @258a * //üîΩdon med de //
analyzed: med pa'i bstan bya @258a * // don med de //
translated: The object of the non-existentüîΩis not the meaning.

original: ma yin pa ni don yod pa'o //
analyzed: ma yin pa ni don yod pa'o //
translated: The object of the non-actuality is the meaning.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: And so on.

original: de la med par dgag pa bstan par bya ba'i yul ji ltar med ce na /
analyzed: de la med par dgag pa bstan par bya ba'i yul ji ltar med ce na /
translated: How is the object of demonstration of non-affirming negation non-existent?

original: 'di ltar med pa tsam khong du chud par byed pa ni don gyi dngos po gang yang khas mi len pa'i phyir don gyi de kho na nyid med do //
analyzed: 'di ltar med pa tsam khong du chud par byed pa ni don gyi dngos po gang yang khas mi len pa'i phyir don gyi de kho na nyid med do //
translated: Thus, the reality of the object does not exist, because the understanding of mere non-existence does not accept any entity of an object at all.

original: ma yin par dgag pa ni yod pa yin te /
analyzed: ma yin par dgag pa ni yod pa yin te /
translated: Negation of non-existence is existence,

original: gang ltar yang dngos po 'am dngos po med pa'i dngos po la dmigs pa dam 'cha' ba'i phyir dmigs pa'i don yod pas dmigs su yod pa'o //
analyzed: gang ltar yang dngos po 'am dngos po med pa'i dngos po la dmigs pa dam 'cha' ba'i phyir dmigs pa'i don yod pas dmigs su yod pa'o //
translated: because the object of perception exists, since it is asserted that the object of perception is an entity or a non-entity in some way.

original: de bzhin med pa dngos su 'jug //
analyzed: de bzhin med pa dngos su 'jug //
translated: Non-existence is direct engagement.

original: ma yin pa ni brgyud pas so //
analyzed: ma yin pa ni brgyud pas so //
translated: Non-existence is indirect engagement.

original: zhes bya ba la ;
analyzed: zhes bya ba la ;
translated: Here,

original: med par dgag pa ni sgra'i 'jug tshul dngos su 'jug ste /
analyzed: med par dgag pa ni sgra'i 'jug tshul dngos su 'jug ste /
translated: non-affirming negation is direct engagement of the mode of operation of the word.

original: dper na ri bong la rva med par bstan pa'i phyir dmus long dag la 'di skad du mgo la sra ba dang rno ba'i rang bzhin ma skyes pas ri bong gi rva med ces brjod na rva med pa nyid go bar byed kyi gzhan zhig go bar mi
analyzed: dper na ri bong la rva med par bstan pa'i phyir dmus long dag la 'di skad du mgo la sra ba dang rno ba'i rang bzhin ma skyes pas ri bong gi rva med ces brjod na rva med pa nyid go bar byed kyi gzhan zhig go bar mi
translated: For example, in order to teach that a rabbit does not have horns, if one says to the blind, ‚ÄúBecause a hard, sharp nature has not arisen on the head, a rabbit‚Äôs horn does not exist,‚Äù one makes them understand the nonexistence of a horn, but one does not make them understand anything else.

original: byed do // ma yin par dgag pa ni brgyud pa'i tshul gyis 'jug ste /
analyzed: byed do // ma yin par dgag pa ni brgyud pa'i tshul gyis 'jug ste /
translated: Negation by a negative is indirect.

original: dper na rgyal rigs la bram ze ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i sgras brjod na de bram ze bkag pas go bar bya ba gzhan rgya la rigs yod de /
analyzed: dper na rgyal rigs la bram ze ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i sgras brjod na de bram ze bkag pas go bar bya ba gzhan rgya la rigs yod de /
translated: For example, when the word ‚Äúnon-Brahmin‚Äù is used for a member of the warrior caste, since that negates a Brahmin, it makes one understand the existence of a member of the warrior caste.

original: de'i phyir brgyud pa'i tshul yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir brgyud pa'i tshul yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is indirect.

original: kun rtog zlog pa med pa ste //
analyzed: kun rtog zlog pa med pa ste //
translated: It does not stop conceptualization.

original: de nyid ston pa ma yin pa'o //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de nyid ston pa ma yin pa'o // zhes bya ba la /
translated: It does not teach reality.

original: med par dgag pas ji ltar kun du rtog pa zlog ce na /
analyzed: med par dgag pas ji ltar kun du rtog pa zlog ce na /
translated: How does negation by a negative stop conceptualization?

original: dper na la la dag thag pa la sprul du rtog pa dag la sprul med ces brjod na de ni med par dgag pa yin te /
analyzed: dper na la la dag thag pa la sprul du rtog pa dag la sprul med ces brjod na de ni med par dgag pa yin te /
translated: For example, if one says to those who conceptualize a rope as a snake, ‚ÄúThere is no snake,‚Äù that is a negation by a negative.

original: des kun du rtog pa zlog par byed do //
analyzed: des kun du rtog pa zlog par byed do //
translated: It is the reversal of imagination.

original: ma yin par dgag pas chos rnams kyi de kho na nyid ston pa ni /
analyzed: ma yin par dgag pas chos rnams kyi de kho na nyid ston pa ni /
translated: The teaching of the reality of things by a negation isüîΩas follows:

original: 'di ltar chos thams cad ni ma skyes pa'am /
analyzed: 'di ltar chos thams cad ni ma skyes pa'am /
translated: All things are unproduced,üîΩThe words ‚Äúunproduced‚Äù and ‚Äúunceased‚Äù teach the reality of things, the reality free from conceptual elaborations.

original: ma 'gags pa zhes brjod pa'i sgras chos rnams kyi chos nyid spros pa dang bral ba'i de kho na nyid ston pa lta bu dang / ma chags pa'i sgras chags pa med pa tsam ston par ma byed kyi /
analyzed: ma 'gags pa zhes brjod pa'i sgras chos rnams kyi chos nyid spros pa dang bral ba'i de kho na nyid ston pa lta bu dang / ma chags pa'i sgras chags pa med pa tsam ston par ma byed kyi /
translated: The word ‚Äúnonattachment‚Äù does not teach mere nonattachment,

original: chags pa'i gnyen por gyur pa'i dge ba'i chos kyi de kho na nyid ston pa lta bu dag go //üîΩgzhan gyi 'dod pa sel ba ni //
analyzed: chags pa'i gnyen por gyur pa'i dge ba'i chos kyi de kho na nyid ston pa lta bu dag go // gzhan gyi 'dod pa sel ba ni //
translated: but teaches the reality of the virtuous things which are the antidote to attachment.üîΩThe elimination of the assertions of others

original: med par dgag pa'i dgos pa ste //üîΩrang 'dod sgrub pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: med par dgag pa'i dgos pa ste // rang 'dod sgrub pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: is the purpose of a negation.

original: zhes bya ba la /üîΩmed par dgag pas gzhan gyi 'dod pa sel ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la / med par dgag pas gzhan gyi 'dod pa sel ba ni /
translated: It is not the establishment of one‚Äôs own assertion.üîΩThe elimination of the assertions of others by a negation

original: gzhan gyi grub pa'i mtha' sel ba ste /
analyzed: gzhan gyi grub pa'i mtha' sel ba ste /
translated: is the elimination of the tenets of others.

original: de yang 'dod @258b pa ni 'dun pa'i bdag nyid yin la /
analyzed: de yang 'dod @258b pa ni 'dun pa'i bdag nyid yin la /
translated: Moreover, assertion is of the nature of desire.

original: grub pa'i mtha' ni shes rab dang mos pa'i bye brag yin te /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' ni shes rab dang mos pa'i bye brag yin te /
translated: The philosophical theory is a particular kind of understanding and belief.

original: 'dir 'dod pa yang nges par 'dzin pa'i 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir 'dod pa yang nges par 'dzin pa'i 'dod pa'o //
translated: Here, belief is a firm grasping.üîΩThe refutation of that is the refutation of the belief in a self, and the statement ‚Äúthere is no self‚Äù is the rejection of the belief in a self.üîΩThe negation is the establishment of one‚Äôs own belief.üîΩThe negation is the establishment of one‚Äôs own belief.üîΩThe negation is the establishment of one‚Äôs own belief.

original: de sel ba ni bdag tu 'dod pa dag gi 'dod pa bsal ba'i phyir bdag med ces brjod pas khas blangs pa dag spong ba yin no //
analyzed: de sel ba ni bdag tu 'dod pa dag gi 'dod pa bsal ba'i phyir bdag med ces brjod pas khas blangs pa dag spong ba yin no //
translated: The negation is the establishment of one‚Äôs own belief.

original: ma yin par dgag pa ni rang gi 'dod pa sgrub pa ste /üîΩgang zhig chos 'di dag la chos rnams kyis chos kyi ngo bo nyid bdag gi ngo bo dang bral bar ston cing rang gi gzhan tshugs par byed pa dag go //
analyzed: ma yin par dgag pa ni rang gi 'dod pa sgrub pa ste / gang zhig chos 'di dag la chos rnams kyis chos kyi ngo bo nyid bdag gi ngo bo dang bral bar ston cing rang gi gzhan tshugs par byed pa dag go //
translated: The negation is the establishment of one‚Äôs own belief.üîΩThe negation is the establishment of one‚Äôs own belief.üîΩThe negation is the establishment of one‚Äôs own belief.üîΩThe negation is the establishment of one‚Äôs own belief.üîΩThe negation is the establishment of one‚Äôs own belief.

original: ma rtogs log rtogs the tshom dag / sel 'dod dus na med pa 'byung //
analyzed: ma rtogs log rtogs the tshom dag / sel 'dod dus na med pa 'byung //
translated: The negation is the establishment of one‚Äôs own belief.üîΩThe negation is the establishment of one‚Äôs own belief.üîΩThe negation is the establishment of one‚Äôs own belief.üîΩThe negation is the establishment of one‚Äôs own belief.üîΩThe negation is the establishment of one‚Äôs own belief.üîΩThe negation is the establishment of one‚Äôs own belief.üîΩThe negation is the establishment of one‚Äôs own belief.üîΩThe negation is the establishment of one‚Äôs own belief.üîΩThe negation is the establishment of one‚Äôs own belief.üîΩThe negation is the establishment of one‚Äôs own belief.üîΩThe negation is the establishment of one‚Äôs own belief.üîΩThe negation is the establishment of one‚Äôs own belief.üîΩThe negation is the establishment of one‚Äôs own belief.üîΩThe negation is the establishment of one‚Äôs own belief.üîΩThe negation is the establishment of one‚Äôs own belief.üîΩThe negation is the establishment of one‚Äôs own belief.üîΩThe negation is the establishment of one‚Äôs own belief.üîΩThe negation is the establishment of one‚Äôs own belief.üîΩThe negation is the establishment of one‚Äôs own belief.üîΩThe negation is the establishment of one‚Äôs own belief.üîΩThe negation is the establishment of one‚Äôs own belief.üîΩThe negation is the establishment of one‚Äôs own belief.üîΩThe negation is the establishment of one‚Äôs own belief.üîΩThe negation is the establishment of one‚Äôs own belief.üîΩThe negation is the establishment of one‚Äôs own belief.

original: zhes bya ba ni smra ba po'i yid la byed pa ni 'dod pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni smra ba po'i yid la byed pa ni 'dod pa yin te /
translated: The negation is the establishment of one‚Äôs own belief.

original: dper na chos thams cad bdag med par ma rtogs pa'i skye bo phal pa dang / log par rtogs pa'i phyi rol ba dang / the tshom can gyi las dang po pa dag gi rtog pa de rnams bsal bar 'dod pa'i yid la byed pa gang gis bskyed pa'i brjod pa de ni dgag pa'i skabs su med par dgag par 'gyur te /
analyzed: dper na chos thams cad bdag med par ma rtogs pa'i skye bo phal pa dang / log par rtogs pa'i phyi rol ba dang / the tshom can gyi las dang po pa dag gi rtog pa de rnams bsal bar 'dod pa'i yid la byed pa gang gis bskyed pa'i brjod pa de ni dgag pa'i skabs su med par dgag par 'gyur te /
translated: For example, the expression that is generated by any mental attention which desires to eliminate the conceptual thoughts of ordinary people who have not realized that all things are devoid of self-existence, of non-Buddhists who have wrongly realized , and of beginners who are doubtful, is a non-implicative negation in the context of negation.

original: 'byung ba'i dus ni de nyid yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba'i dus ni de nyid yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that the time of its occurrence is just that.

original: don nyid khong du chud 'dod na //üîΩma yin dgag pa 'byung bar 'gyur //
analyzed: don nyid khong du chud 'dod na // ma yin dgag pa 'byung bar 'gyur //
translated: When one desires to understand the reality of the meaning of things,

original: zhes bya ba ni yid la byed pa gang gis chos rnams kyi don gyi ngo bo nyid khong du chud par 'dod nas brjod pa 'byung ba ni dgag pa'i skabs su ma yin par dgag pa'i grangs su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni yid la byed pa gang gis chos rnams kyi don gyi ngo bo nyid khong du chud par 'dod nas brjod pa 'byung ba ni dgag pa'i skabs su ma yin par dgag pa'i grangs su 'gyur ro //
translated: the expression that is generated by any mental attention which desires to understand the reality of the meaning of things is an implicative negation in the context of negation.

original: da ni sngar 'di skad du /
analyzed: da ni sngar 'di skad du /
translated: Now, previously it was said:üîΩMeaning, mode of engagement, purpose,

original: don dang 'jug tshul dgos pa dang // 'byung dus dbang ste go rims bzhin //
analyzed: don dang 'jug tshul dgos pa dang // 'byung dus dbang ste go rims bzhin //
translated: time of occurrence, and faculty, in order.

original: zhes brjod pa gsal bar bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes brjod pa gsal bar bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to clearly demonstrate that, he says:

original: dgag pa'i sgra dang dgag bya yis //
analyzed: dgag pa'i sgra dang dgag bya yis //
translated: The words of negation and the object of negation

original: bstan par bya ba'i don du 'dod //üîΩces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: bstan par bya ba'i don du 'dod // ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: are asserted to be the means of teaching.

original: de la dgag pa'i sgra ni 'gegs par byed pa ste /
analyzed: de la dgag pa'i sgra ni 'gegs par byed pa ste /
translated: Therein, the words of negation are the negator.

original: 'di skad du //
analyzed: 'di skad du //
translated: It is like this:

original: hya na aa bhi gang ldan pa //
analyzed: hya na aa bhi gang ldan pa //
translated: That which possesses the hya and abhi

original: lhan cig pa ni ldog par 'gyur //üîΩzhes bya ba lta bu yin no //
analyzed: lhan cig pa ni ldog par 'gyur // zhes bya ba lta bu yin no //
translated: is the co-existent, which is the negatee.

original: dgag par bya ba ni de dang lhan cig pa yin te /
analyzed: dgag par bya ba ni de dang lhan cig pa yin te /
translated: The object of negation is co-existent with that,

original: byed pa des ldag par bya ba'o //
analyzed: byed pa des ldag par bya ba'o //
translated: and is to be negated by that action.

original: de gnyis kyis bstan par bya ba ni brjod par bya ba nas rtogs par bya ba'i bar du yin no //
analyzed: de gnyis kyis bstan par bya ba ni brjod par bya ba nas rtogs par bya ba'i bar du yin no //
translated: That which is taught by those two is the object of expression up to the object of understanding.

original: de'i don yin te /
analyzed: de'i don yin te /
translated: It has that as its object.

original: de ltar shes par bya ba ni 'di'i 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar shes par bya ba ni 'di'i 'dod pa'o //
translated: That is to be known is the assertion here.

original: tshul ston pa ni /
analyzed: tshul ston pa ni /
translated: The demonstration of the method is:

original: don de ji ltar ston byed pa'i //üîΩtshul ni 'di ru thabs su 'dod //
analyzed: don de ji ltar ston byed pa'i // tshul ni 'di ru thabs su 'dod //
translated: The method by which that object is taught

original: ces bya ba yin te /
analyzed: ces bya ba yin te /
translated: is asserted here as the means.

original: ji ltar ston pa'i @259a * //
analyzed: ji ltar ston pa'i @259a * //
translated: The means by which that object is taughtüîΩis the method.

original: tshul ni dngos su 'jug pa'i tshul dang / brgyud pa'i tshul te sngar dpyad zin to //
analyzed: tshul ni dngos su 'jug pa'i tshul dang / brgyud pa'i tshul te sngar dpyad zin to //
translated: The method is the direct method and the indirect method, as previously analyzed.

original: 'di ru zhes bya ba ni mtshon par byed pa'i skabs 'dir ro //
analyzed: 'di ru zhes bya ba ni mtshon par byed pa'i skabs 'dir ro //
translated: Here means in this context of illustration.

original: tshul zhes bya ba ni thabs yin no zhes so //
analyzed: tshul zhes bya ba ni thabs yin no zhes so //
translated: Method is the means.

original: thabs kyang lugs sam sgo'o //
analyzed: thabs kyang lugs sam sgo'o //
translated: The means is a system or door.

original: gzhan du ni rang bzhin dang / rigs pa dang / sdom pa dang / nye bar sbyor ba dang / dman pa dag la yang 'jug go zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du ni rang bzhin dang / rigs pa dang / sdom pa dang / nye bar sbyor ba dang / dman pa dag la yang 'jug go zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Otherwise, it is the nature, the reasoning, the vow, the application, and the engagement in the inferior.

original: dgos pa ston pa ni /
analyzed: dgos pa ston pa ni /
translated: The explanation of the purpose is:

original: thabs kyi 'bras bu dgos pa'o //üîΩzhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: thabs kyi 'bras bu dgos pa'o // zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: The result of the method is the purpose.

original: thabs de dag gi bya ba'i 'bras bu ni sgra brjod pa'i dgos pa yin te /
analyzed: thabs de dag gi bya ba'i 'bras bu ni sgra brjod pa'i dgos pa yin te /
translated: The result of the activity of those methods is the purpose of expressing the words.

original: kun du rtog pa zlog pa dang / chos rnams kyi dngos po bstan pa dang / gzhan gyi khas blangs bsal ba dang / rang gi gzhung bsgrub par bya ba rnams grub pa khong du chud pa yin te /
analyzed: kun du rtog pa zlog pa dang / chos rnams kyi dngos po bstan pa dang / gzhan gyi khas blangs bsal ba dang / rang gi gzhung bsgrub par bya ba rnams grub pa khong du chud pa yin te /
translated: The understanding of the refutation of imagination, the teaching of the entities of phenomena, the elimination of others' assertions, and the establishment of one's own scriptures is the purpose.

original: de ni dgos pa'o //
analyzed: de ni dgos pa'o //
translated: That is the purpose.

original: dus ston pa ni /
analyzed: dus ston pa ni /
translated: The explanation of the time is:

original: 'byung dus rnam pa bzhir bshad pa //
analyzed: 'byung dus rnam pa bzhir bshad pa //
translated: The time of origination is explained as fourfold.

original: smra bar byed pa gang zhig gi //
analyzed: smra bar byed pa gang zhig gi //
translated: What is the speaker?

original: yid la byed pa gang ldan pa //
analyzed: yid la byed pa gang ldan pa //
translated: What is the mental attention?

original: 'dod ldan 'byung ba'i dus su 'dod //
analyzed: 'dod ldan 'byung ba'i dus su 'dod //
translated: The desire is at the time of origination of the desire.

original: ces bya ba yin te /
analyzed: ces bya ba yin te /
translated: This is the verse.

original: sma ba po'i 'dod pa gang yid la byed pa'i dus na'o zhes bya bar 'byur ro //
analyzed: sma ba po'i 'dod pa gang yid la byed pa'i dus na'o zhes bya bar 'byur ro //
translated: The desire of the speaker is at the time of mental attention.

original: de la dgag pa'i sgra 'byung ba'i dus rnam pa bzhi ni don ma rtogs pa rtogs par bya ba dang / log par rtogs pa dgag pa dang / som nyi za ba bsal ba dang / ngo bo nyid rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: de la dgag pa'i sgra 'byung ba'i dus rnam pa bzhi ni don ma rtogs pa rtogs par bya ba dang / log par rtogs pa dgag pa dang / som nyi za ba bsal ba dang / ngo bo nyid rtogs par bya'o //
translated: The time of origination of the sound is fourfold: for one who has not understood the meaning, for the sake of understanding; for one who has understood wrongly, for the sake of refuting; for one who has doubt, for the sake of dispelling it; for one who has the nature of understanding, for the sake of reminding.

original: smra ba po'i yid la byed pa ni don de rnams ji lta ba de ltar 'dod pa yid la byed pa ste /
analyzed: smra ba po'i yid la byed pa ni don de rnams ji lta ba de ltar 'dod pa yid la byed pa ste /
translated: The mental attention of the speaker is the mental attention to those meanings just as they are.

original: de gang dang ldan pa de na de dag ston pa'i sgra 'byung bar 'gyur bas sgra 'byung pa'i dus su 'dod do //
analyzed: de gang dang ldan pa de na de dag ston pa'i sgra 'byung bar 'gyur bas sgra 'byung pa'i dus su 'dod do //
translated: The desire is at the time of the origination of the sound, because the sound originates when one has that.

original: da ni med par dgag pa dang / ma yin par dgag pa'i bye brag de snyed brjod pa'i gzhi 'am rtsa ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni med par dgag pa dang / ma yin par dgag pa'i bye brag de snyed brjod pa'i gzhi 'am rtsa ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate the basis or root of the various distinctions between the implicative and the non-implicative negations,üîΩhe says,

original: bye brag rtsa ba 'di yin te //üîΩmed pa yod pa mi sgrub ste //üîΩma yin pa ni yin pa sgrub //
analyzed: bye brag rtsa ba 'di yin te // med pa yod pa mi sgrub ste // ma yin pa ni yin pa sgrub //
translated: This is the root of the distinctions.üîΩThe non-implicative negation does not affirm existence.

original: ces bya ba smos so //
analyzed: ces bya ba smos so //
translated: The implicative negation affirms what is not that.

original: de'i don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de'i don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows.

original: med par dgag pa ni yod pa bkag pa'i med pas bstan par bya ba yod pa sgrub par mi byed la ma yin par dgag pa ni yin pa bkag pa ma yin pas bstan par bya ba'i dngos po yang sgrub par byed de /
analyzed: med par dgag pa ni yod pa bkag pa'i med pas bstan par bya ba yod pa sgrub par mi byed la ma yin par dgag pa ni yin pa bkag pa ma yin pas bstan par bya ba'i dngos po yang sgrub par byed de /
translated: The implicative negation does not affirm the existence of what is to be expressed by the negation of existence through non-existence. The implicative negation affirms the entity which is to be expressed by the negation of what is not that.

original: 'di gnyis ni bye brag gi rtsa ba yin no zhes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di gnyis ni bye brag gi rtsa ba yin no zhes par 'gyur ro //
translated: These two are the root of the distinctions.

original: med par dgag pa ji ltar yod pa mi sgrub ce na /
analyzed: med par dgag pa ji ltar yod pa mi sgrub ce na /
translated: How does the non-implicative negation not affirm existence?

original: med pa tsam khong du chud pas de'i bya ba yongs su rdzogs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: med pa tsam khong du chud pas de'i bya ba yongs su rdzogs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the mere absence is understood, the action of that is completely finished.

original: ma yin par dgag pa yin @259b pa sgrub pa ni don gzhan dgag pa'i sgo nas don ston pa de'i bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma yin par dgag pa yin @259b pa sgrub pa ni don gzhan dgag pa'i sgo nas don ston pa de'i bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The proof of non-affirming negation is the activity of that which teaches a meaning by way of negating another meaning.üîΩNow, in order to teach the mode of non-establishment of an existent thing by non-affirming negation, and in order to teach that even though it is expressed by the word ‚Äúnon-existent,‚Äù if one asserts an existent thing, it is not a non-affirming negation,

original: da ni med par dgag pa yod pa'i dngos po mi sgrub pa'i tshul dang / med pa'i sgras brjod kyang yod pa'i dngos po 'dod pa na med par dgag par mi 'gyur bar bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: da ni med par dgag pa yod pa'i dngos po mi sgrub pa'i tshul dang / med pa'i sgras brjod kyang yod pa'i dngos po 'dod pa na med par dgag par mi 'gyur bar bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: [the root text] says:üîΩThe cause is the effect, and likewise,

original: rgyu la 'bras bu de bzhin dang ; / tha dad dngos dang brtags pa tsam //
analyzed: rgyu la 'bras bu de bzhin dang ; / tha dad dngos dang brtags pa tsam //
translated: The thing is merely imputed.

original: zhes bya ba rim pa bzhin du /
analyzed: zhes bya ba rim pa bzhin du /
translated: [The root text] says this in order,üîΩPrior non-existence, destruction,

original: snga na med dang zhig pa dang // phan tshun gcig la gcig med dang // shin tu med par gyur pa dag //
analyzed: snga na med dang zhig pa dang // phan tshun gcig la gcig med dang // shin tu med par gyur pa dag //
translated: Mutual non-existence, and utter non-existence,

original: med pa dgag pa'i gzhir gyur pa //
analyzed: med pa dgag pa'i gzhir gyur pa //
translated: Are the bases of non-affirming negation.

original: gal te yod pa'i dngos 'dod na //
analyzed: gal te yod pa'i dngos 'dod na //
translated: If one asserts an existent thing,

original: med par dgag par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: med par dgag par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: It is not a non-affirming negation.

original: zhes smos so //
analyzed: zhes smos so //
translated: [The root text] says this.

original: de la rgyu la 'bras bu'i rang bzhin med pa snga na med pa dang / de bzhin zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu la rgyu'i rang bzhin med pa zhig nas med pa dang / tha dad pa'i dngos po phan tshun gcig la gcig med pa dang /
analyzed: de la rgyu la 'bras bu'i rang bzhin med pa snga na med pa dang / de bzhin zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu la rgyu'i rang bzhin med pa zhig nas med pa dang / tha dad pa'i dngos po phan tshun gcig la gcig med pa dang /
translated: Nonexistence is explained as the basis for understanding a negation, such as the nonexistence of a result in a cause, the prior nonexistence of a result, the subsequent nonexistence of a result, the nonexistence of a cause in a result, the mutual nonexistence of different things, and the complete nonexistence of mere imputations, like the horns of a rabbit.

original: brtags pa tsam ri bong gi rva lta bu shin tu med par gyur pa rnams ni med par dgag pa go bar bya ba'i gzhir 'chad pa de dag kyang yod pa ston na med pa dgag par mi 'gyur ba 'di lta ste /
analyzed: brtags pa tsam ri bong gi rva lta bu shin tu med par gyur pa rnams ni med par dgag pa go bar bya ba'i gzhir 'chad pa de dag kyang yod pa ston na med pa dgag par mi 'gyur ba 'di lta ste /
translated: If those are taught to exist, they are not negated as nonexistent.üîΩThe word prior indicates a cause, the word subsequent indicates a result, the word mutual indicates one thing, and the word complete indicates an imputed entity.

original: snga na med pa'i sgras rgyu go bar byed pa dang / de bzhin du zhig nas med pa 'bras bu dang / gcig la gcig med pas gcig dang / shin tu med pas brtags pa'i bdag po go bar 'dod na med par dgag pa'i grangs su mi chud do zhes bya ba yin no //üîΩde phyir yod pa mi sgrub ste //
analyzed: snga na med pa'i sgras rgyu go bar byed pa dang / de bzhin du zhig nas med pa 'bras bu dang / gcig la gcig med pas gcig dang / shin tu med pas brtags pa'i bdag po go bar 'dod na med par dgag pa'i grangs su mi chud do zhes bya ba yin no // de phyir yod pa mi sgrub ste //
translated: If those are asserted to be understood, they are not included in the enumeration of negations.üîΩTherefore, existence is not established.

original: med ba'i yod pa 'ang mi sgrub po //
analyzed: med ba'i yod pa 'ang mi sgrub po //
translated: Nor is nonexistence established.

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Thus, it is.

original: yod pa mi sgrub pa ni ji ltar rgyu las 'bras bu'i rang bzhin med pas 'bras bu tsam du dgag pa dang / de bzhin du 'bras bu la rgyu dang / gcig la gcig gis gcig tsam dang / shin tu med pas de nyid 'gegs par byed na med par dgag pa yin pas sngar brjod pa'i yod pa de dag mi 'grub bo //
