analyzed: yod pa mi sgrub pa ni ji ltar rgyu las 'bras bu'i rang bzhin med pas 'bras bu tsam du dgag pa dang / de bzhin du 'bras bu la rgyu dang / gcig la gcig gis gcig tsam dang / shin tu med pas de nyid 'gegs par byed na med par dgag pa yin pas sngar brjod pa'i yod pa de dag mi 'grub bo //
translated: Non-establishment of existence is as follows: since the effect does not have the nature of the cause, the effect is merely negated; and likewise, the cause in regard to the effect, one in regard to the other, and mere identity are negated since they do not exist at all. Since it is a non-implicative negation, the previously mentioned existences are not established.

original: med pa'i yod pa zhes bya ba ni rdzas su med pa'i ngo bo nyid yod pa'i dngos po ste nam mkha' lta bu'o //
analyzed: med pa'i yod pa zhes bya ba ni rdzas su med pa'i ngo bo nyid yod pa'i dngos po ste nam mkha' lta bu'o //
translated: Existence of non-existence is a thing that has the nature of non-substantiality, like space.

original: med par dgag pa ni tha na de yang mi sgrub bo zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: med par dgag pa ni tha na de yang mi sgrub bo zhes bya ba'o //
translated: A non-implicative negation does not even establish that.

original: de ltar na med par dgag pas de ltar yod pa mi sgrub pa'i rgyu kho nas 'gyur ba ni /
analyzed: de ltar na med par dgag pas de ltar yod pa mi sgrub pa'i rgyu kho nas 'gyur ba ni /
translated: Thus, it is a non-implicative negation since it does not establish existence in that way, merely by the reason that it does not establish existence.

original: de yis bstan bya don med dang // sgra nyid dngos su 'jug pa dang // dgos pa brtags pa sel ba dang // de bzhin gzhan gyi 'dod pa dang // 'byung ba'i dus ni gsum du brjod //
analyzed: de yis bstan bya don med dang // sgra nyid dngos su 'jug pa dang // dgos pa brtags pa sel ba dang // de bzhin gzhan gyi 'dod pa dang // 'byung ba'i dus ni gsum du brjod //
translated: and the time of origination are stated as three.

original: ces @260a * //üîΩbya ba yin no //
analyzed: ces @260a * // bya ba yin no //
translated: This is what is said.

original: de la bstan par bya ba'i don med pa mi sgrub pa'i rgyus sgrub pa ni 'di yod pa mi tshol na don med pa nyid du zad de /
analyzed: de la bstan par bya ba'i don med pa mi sgrub pa'i rgyus sgrub pa ni 'di yod pa mi tshol na don med pa nyid du zad de /
translated: Among them, the proof by the reason of not establishing the meaningless object to be expressed is this: if the existence is not sought, it is just meaningless.

original: bsgrub par bya ba'i don gyi rdzas ni med do //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba'i don gyi rdzas ni med do //
translated: The substance of the object to be established does not exist.

original: yod pa mi sgrub pa'i rgyus sgra dngos su 'jug pa sgrub pa ni 'di ltar med pa'i sgras don gzhan mi ston na med pa'i sgra bzhin nyid yin te /
analyzed: yod pa mi sgrub pa'i rgyus sgra dngos su 'jug pa sgrub pa ni 'di ltar med pa'i sgras don gzhan mi ston na med pa'i sgra bzhin nyid yin te /
translated: The proof by the reason of not establishing the word itself directly engaged is like this: if the word non-existent does not indicate another object, it is just the word non-existent itself.

original: brgyud mi dgos pa'i phyir dngos su 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: brgyud mi dgos pa'i phyir dngos su 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because there is no need for an intermediary, it becomes directly engaged.

original: de bzhin du rgyu des dgos pa brtags pa sel bar 'gyur ba ni 'di ltar don gyi ngo bo nyid yod pa mi ston na dgos pa gzhan brtags pa sel ba ma yin pa med do //
analyzed: de bzhin du rgyu des dgos pa brtags pa sel bar 'gyur ba ni 'di ltar don gyi ngo bo nyid yod pa mi ston na dgos pa gzhan brtags pa sel ba ma yin pa med do //
translated: In the same way, the investigation of the purpose of the reason is eliminated, because if the intrinsic reality of the object is not taught, there is no other purpose to be investigated that is not eliminated.

original: gzhan gyi 'dod pa sel ba yang byed de 'di ltar rang 'dod pa'i don mi ston na rang bzhin gyis der 'gyur ba gdon mi za'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi 'dod pa sel ba yang byed de 'di ltar rang 'dod pa'i don mi ston na rang bzhin gyis der 'gyur ba gdon mi za'o //
translated: The elimination of the assertions of others is also done, because if the object that is asserted by oneself is not taught, it is undoubtedly the case that it is eliminated by its nature.

original: rgyu de nyid kyis 'byung ba'i dus gsum du 'gyur pa yang 'di yin te /
analyzed: rgyu de nyid kyis 'byung ba'i dus gsum du 'gyur pa yang 'di yin te /
translated: By that very reason, the three times of arising are also like this.

original: ma rtogs pa sel bar 'dod pa'i dus na 'byung ba yang dper na skyes bu gser gyi rang bzhin mi shes pa dag la mi 'gyur zhes bstan na de mi 'gyur ba'i ngo bo nyid gser mi sgrub na ma rtogs pa tsam sel ba'i dus su 'gyur ro
analyzed: ma rtogs pa sel bar 'dod pa'i dus na 'byung ba yang dper na skyes bu gser gyi rang bzhin mi shes pa dag la mi 'gyur zhes bstan na de mi 'gyur ba'i ngo bo nyid gser mi sgrub na ma rtogs pa tsam sel ba'i dus su 'gyur ro
translated: When the non-realization is to be eliminated, the arising is like this: For example, when it is taught to those who do not know the nature of gold, ‚ÄúIt does not change,‚Äù if the intrinsic reality of gold that does not change is not established, then the mere non-realization is eliminated.

original: // log par rtogs pa sel bar 'dod pa'i dus na 'byung bar yang 'gyur te /
analyzed: // log par rtogs pa sel bar 'dod pa'i dus na 'byung bar yang 'gyur te /
translated: When the wrong realization is to be eliminated, the arising is also like this.

original: dper na / thag pa la sgrul du 'khrul ba'i shes pa can dag la sbrul med ces brjod na yod pa'i ngo bo thag pa mi ston na sbrul du 'khrul pa'i shes pa tsam bral bar byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dper na / thag pa la sgrul du 'khrul ba'i shes pa can dag la sbrul med ces brjod na yod pa'i ngo bo thag pa mi ston na sbrul du 'khrul pa'i shes pa tsam bral bar byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: For example, when one says to someone who has the idea that a rope is a snake, ‚ÄúThere is no snake,‚Äù if one does not show the real thing, the rope, one will not be able to remove the idea of a snake.

original: rgyu des som nyi za ba sel ba'i dus na 'byung bar yang 'gyur te /üîΩ'di ltar gal te thag pa la sbrul du the tshom za na de la 'di skad du sbrul ma yin zhes brjod na thag pa la sogs pa yod pa'i dngos po mi ston na gzhi gang la 'khrul du zad de sbrul du the tshom za ba ldog go
analyzed: rgyu des som nyi za ba sel ba'i dus na 'byung bar yang 'gyur te / 'di ltar gal te thag pa la sbrul du the tshom za na de la 'di skad du sbrul ma yin zhes brjod na thag pa la sogs pa yod pa'i dngos po mi ston na gzhi gang la 'khrul du zad de sbrul du the tshom za ba ldog go
translated: And when one removes the doubt, one will say, ‚ÄúIt is a rope.‚ÄùüîΩIn the same way, if one doubts that a rope is a snake, when one says, ‚ÄúIt is not a snake,‚Äù if one does not show the real thing, the rope, what is the basis of the doubt? The doubt that it is a snake is removed.

original: // de'i phyir dus de dag na 'byung ba yang yod pa mi sgrub pa'i rgyus grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: // de'i phyir dus de dag na 'byung ba yang yod pa mi sgrub pa'i rgyus grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, when one says that the rope is not a snake, one does not establish the existence of the rope.

original: da ni ma yin par dgag pa'i bye brag med pa las tha dad pa rnams kyi rtsa ba yin pa'i ngo bo nyid ji ltar sgrub pa dang / rgyu des ji ltar 'gyur ba ston pa las dang por yin pa'i ngo bo nyid ji ltar sgrub par byed pa la brtsams nas /
analyzed: da ni ma yin par dgag pa'i bye brag med pa las tha dad pa rnams kyi rtsa ba yin pa'i ngo bo nyid ji ltar sgrub pa dang / rgyu des ji ltar 'gyur ba ston pa las dang por yin pa'i ngo bo nyid ji ltar sgrub par byed pa la brtsams nas /
translated: First, beginning with how one establishes the nature of that which is,üîΩit is said:üîΩThe conventions of nonimplicative negations

original: gzhan dang gnyen po la sogs pa'i //üîΩma yin dgag pa'i tha snyad dag / gang zhig yin pa bzlog pa yis //
analyzed: gzhan dang gnyen po la sogs pa'i // ma yin dgag pa'i tha snyad dag / gang zhig yin pa bzlog pa yis //
translated: such as other, antidote, and so onüîΩare sought as things that are

original: yin pa'i dngos po gzhan du tshol //
analyzed: yin pa'i dngos po gzhan du tshol //
translated: by reversing what they are not.

original: ma yin tsam du mi sgrub ste //
analyzed: ma yin tsam du mi sgrub ste //
translated: They are not established as mere nonexistence,

original: de'i phyir ma yin dgag pa ni //
analyzed: de'i phyir ma yin dgag pa ni //
translated: and therefore nonimplicative negations

original: yin @260b pa'i dngos po sgrub pa'o //üîΩzhes smos te /
analyzed: yin @260b pa'i dngos po sgrub pa'o // zhes smos te /
translated: are established as things that are.

original: de la dgag pa'i rnam grangs bco lngar bshad pa de rnams las gzhan pa dang 'dra ba la sogs pa bcu bzhi ni ma yin par dgag pa'i bye brag yin te /
analyzed: de la dgag pa'i rnam grangs bco lngar bshad pa de rnams las gzhan pa dang 'dra ba la sogs pa bcu bzhi ni ma yin par dgag pa'i bye brag yin te /
translated: With regard to that, from among the fifteen categories of negation that were explained, the fourteen such as similar and so on are specific nonimplicative negations.

original: de rnams kun kyang yin par bkag pa byas nas ma yin pa tsam du 'gyur bar mi byed kyi /
analyzed: de rnams kun kyang yin par bkag pa byas nas ma yin pa tsam du 'gyur bar mi byed kyi /
translated: All of these are not made to be mere negations of being, but are made to be the mere negation of being that very entity.

original: yin pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi don de las gzhan du tshol bar byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yin pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi don de las gzhan du tshol bar byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one seeks the meaning of being in something other than that entity.

original: de la re zhig gzhan pa ni 'di ltar ba lang ma yin zhes bya bas ba lang dgag pa tsam ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de la re zhig gzhan pa ni 'di ltar ba lang ma yin zhes bya bas ba lang dgag pa tsam ma yin gyi /
translated: In that regard, other is like this: by saying ‚Äúnot a cow,‚Äù it is not merely a negation of a cow,

original: rta yin par ston pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: rta yin par ston pa lta bu'o //
translated: but it shows that it is a horse.

original: de bzhin du 'dra ba dag kyang 'di ltar dper na rig byed dang 'dra ba dgag pa tsam ma yin te ;
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dra ba dag kyang 'di ltar dper na rig byed dang 'dra ba dgag pa tsam ma yin te ;
translated: In the same way, similarities are like this: for example, it is not merely a negation of similarity to the Vedas,

original: mi 'dra ba'i dngos po'i chos ston pa'o //
analyzed: mi 'dra ba'i dngos po'i chos ston pa'o //
translated: but it shows the quality of an entity that is dissimilar.

original: de ltar na dgag pa gzhan yang dgag par bya ba dgag pa tsam ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na dgag pa gzhan yang dgag par bya ba dgag pa tsam ma yin te /
translated: Thus, other negations are not merely negations of the object of negation,

original: dman pa nas bral ba'i bar du rang rang gi ngo bo ston par byed pa gang yin pa de dag re re sgrub par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: dman pa nas bral ba'i bar du rang rang gi ngo bo ston par byed pa gang yin pa de dag re re sgrub par shes par bya'o //
translated: but each should be understood to establish whatever shows its own nature, from the inferior up to freedom.

original: da ni yin pa'i dngos po sgrub par byed pa'i rgyu des bsdus pa'i bye brag de dag de lta bu 'grub par byed par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni yin pa'i dngos po sgrub par byed pa'i rgyu des bsdus pa'i bye brag de dag de lta bu 'grub par byed par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate that the particularities subsumed by that cause which establishes the existent thing are established in that way, he says:üîΩThe existent thing is what is to be taught by that,üîΩthe engagement by way of the mode of succession,üîΩthe teaching of the reality of the phenomenon,üîΩthe establishment of one‚Äôs assertion,

original: de yis bstan bya don yod dang // brgyud pa'i tshul gyis 'jug pa dang // chos kyi de nyid ston pa dang // rang gi 'dod pa sgrub pa dang // 'byung dus gcig tu brjod pa yin //üîΩzhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de yis bstan bya don yod dang // brgyud pa'i tshul gyis 'jug pa dang // chos kyi de nyid ston pa dang // rang gi 'dod pa sgrub pa dang // 'byung dus gcig tu brjod pa yin // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: and the expression of the time of occurrence.

original: de la yin pa sgrub pa'i rgyu de yis ji ltar bstan par bya ba don yod par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de la yin pa sgrub pa'i rgyu de yis ji ltar bstan par bya ba don yod par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: With regard to that, if it is asked, ‚ÄúHow does the existent thing become the existent thing that is to be taught by that cause which establishes the existent thing?‚Äù

original: 'di ltar gang gi yin pa'i dngos po sgrub par byed na dngos po de nyid don yod pa yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar gang gi yin pa'i dngos po sgrub par byed na dngos po de nyid don yod pa yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: In this way, when the existent thing is established, that very existent thing becomes the existent thing.

original: gzhan yang rgyu des sgra brgyud pa'i tshul gyis 'jug par yang 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan yang rgyu des sgra brgyud pa'i tshul gyis 'jug par yang 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, the existent thing is also the engagement by way of the mode of succession of that cause.

original: dper na lhas byin med pa zhes bya ba'i sgras yul bar ndha ston na de ni brgyud pa ste /
analyzed: dper na lhas byin med pa zhes bya ba'i sgras yul bar ndha ston na de ni brgyud pa ste /
translated: For example, if the sound ‚ÄúDevadatta does not exist‚Äù teaches the object ‚Äúbarley,‚Äù that is a succession.

original: sgra des ni lhas byin med pa tsam mi ston la /
analyzed: sgra des ni lhas byin med pa tsam mi ston la /
translated: That sound does not teach the mere nonexistence of Devadatta,

original: des yul ba randha go bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des yul ba randha go bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it causes the object, V·πõndƒÅ, to be understood.

original: rgyu de chos rnams kyi kho na nyid ston par 'gyur ba ni /
analyzed: rgyu de chos rnams kyi kho na nyid ston par 'gyur ba ni /
translated: That reason is the teaching of the reality of phenomena,

original: 'di ltar rtog pa zlog pa tsam ma yin par ngo bo gcig ston par byed na dngos po'i de kho na nyid ston par byed kyang rung /
analyzed: 'di ltar rtog pa zlog pa tsam ma yin par ngo bo gcig ston par byed na dngos po'i de kho na nyid ston par byed kyang rung /
translated: because if it teaches the same entity without merely reversing conception, it may teach the reality of things,

original: dngos po med pa'i de kho na nyid ston par byed kyang rung ste /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i de kho na nyid ston par byed kyang rung ste /
translated: or it may teach the reality of nonthings.

original: chos rnams gyi de kho na nyid ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos rnams gyi de kho na nyid ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: It is the teaching of the reality of phenomena.

original: rgyu de nyid kyis smra ba po rang nyid kyi 'dod pa 'grub par 'gyur te /üîΩ'di ltar smra ba thams cad dngos su gzhan la go bar byed pa yin yang de 'ba' zhig sgrub par mi byed na brgyud pas rang gi don @261a * //
analyzed: rgyu de nyid kyis smra ba po rang nyid kyi 'dod pa 'grub par 'gyur te / 'di ltar smra ba thams cad dngos su gzhan la go bar byed pa yin yang de 'ba' zhig sgrub par mi byed na brgyud pas rang gi don @261a * //
translated: By that very reason, the proponent‚Äôs own assertion is established,

original: kyang yin te /
analyzed: kyang yin te /
translated: because although all speech is the direct cause of understanding for others, if it does not establish that alone, it is indirectly established for oneself.

original: de'i phyir rang gi 'dod pa yang sgrub par byed par don mi za'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir rang gi 'dod pa yang sgrub par byed par don mi za'o //
translated: Therefore, the proponent‚Äôs own assertion is also established.

original: rgyu des chos rnams kyi don khong du chud par 'dod pa'i dus na ma yin par dgag pa 'byung bar 'gyur ba yang yin te /
analyzed: rgyu des chos rnams kyi don khong du chud par 'dod pa'i dus na ma yin par dgag pa 'byung bar 'gyur ba yang yin te /
translated: And it is also the case that when one wishes to understand the meaning of phenomena by means of that cause, then an implicative negation arises.

original: 'di ltar don gang yin pa ston par byed pa na sgra de don de nyid ldog par byed pas de 'dod pa'i dus na 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar don gang yin pa ston par byed pa na sgra de don de nyid ldog par byed pas de 'dod pa'i dus na 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, when one teaches the meaning of a word, that word also expresses the negation of that very meaning, and it arises when one wishes to understand that meaning.

original: de ltar med par dgag pa dang / ma yin par dgag pa'i bye brag de dag gi rtsa ba med par dgag pa yod pa ni mi bsgrub pa dang / ma yin par dgag pa yin pa'i ngo bo nyid sgrub par byed pa yin par bstan pa la /
analyzed: de ltar med par dgag pa dang / ma yin par dgag pa'i bye brag de dag gi rtsa ba med par dgag pa yod pa ni mi bsgrub pa dang / ma yin par dgag pa yin pa'i ngo bo nyid sgrub par byed pa yin par bstan pa la /
translated: In order to demonstrate that the root of those distinctions between implicative and nonimplicative negations is the nonimplicative negation, which is the nature of nonestablishment and establishment, respectively,üîΩone may not know the reason for nonestablishment and establishment, respectively.

original: yod pa mi sgrub pa nyid dang yin pa sgrub pa nyid kyi rgyu mi shes pas de bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yod pa mi sgrub pa nyid dang yin pa sgrub pa nyid kyi rgyu mi shes pas de bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: The cause of the distinction

original: yid la byed pa'i khyad par dag / smra ba gang gi blo la gnas //
analyzed: yid la byed pa'i khyad par dag / smra ba gang gi blo la gnas //
translated: is the presence of a particular mental activity.

original: de ni bye brag gnyis kyi rgyu //üîΩzhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de ni bye brag gnyis kyi rgyu //üîΩzhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The cause of the distinctionüîΩis the presence of a particular mental activity.

original: smra ba po gang yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i shes pa la 'dod par bya ba'i yul gang zhig gzhan gyis go bar 'dod pas yid la byed pas 'phangs pa'i yid kyi yul du byas pa'i don gyi spyi dang / de brjod pa'i sgra'i spyi shes pa gcig gi yul du mtshungs pa ming dang ming can 'brel par nus shing sgra skyed par byed pa'i bdag nyid can de rgyu yin no //
analyzed: smra ba po gang yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i shes pa la 'dod par bya ba'i yul gang zhig gzhan gyis go bar 'dod pas yid la byed pas 'phangs pa'i yid kyi yul du byas pa'i don gyi spyi dang / de brjod pa'i sgra'i spyi shes pa gcig gi yul du mtshungs pa ming dang ming can 'brel par nus shing sgra skyed par byed pa'i bdag nyid can de rgyu yin no //
translated: The universal of the object that is the mental object of the conceptual consciousness of the speaker, which is the object of desire of the one who wishes to make others understand, and the universal of the word that expresses that are similar objects of a single consciousness. That is the cause that has the nature of generating the sound.

original: gal te sgra'i rgyu de snyed yin na 'dir smra ba bo'i blo la yid la byed pa'i bye brag yod pa kho na rgyur smos she na /
analyzed: gal te sgra'i rgyu de snyed yin na 'dir smra ba bo'i blo la yid la byed pa'i bye brag yod pa kho na rgyur smos she na /
translated: If that is the cause of sound, why is the specific mental attention of the speaker alone mentioned as the cause?

original: de ni thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir de bstan par rigs pa yin te /
analyzed: de ni thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir de bstan par rigs pa yin te /
translated: It is logical to teach that because it is not shared in common.

analyzed: ji ltar gling bu las byung ba'i sgra la gling bu'i sgra zhes brjod pa dag de'i rgyu lag pa la sogs pa yang yin mod kyi /
translated: Just as the sound that arises from a flute is called the sound of a flute, although the cause of that sound is the hands and so on,

analyzed: thun mong ma yin pa'i sgo nas bod par rigs pa de bzhin du shes pa gcig gi yul du mtshungs pa'i sgra dang don gyi spyi skyed pa'i bdag nyid can ni sgra thams cad kyi rgyu yin pas de mi brjod kyi / yid la byed pa'i bye brag ni khyad par gyi rgyu yin pas de brjod par rigs so // gzhan yang yid la byed pa'i bye brag ni rgyu'i gtso bo yin te / 'di ltar byed pa po yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Just as it is for Tibetans, it is also for others.üîΩThe specific mental activity is the primary cause of the sound because it is the agent.

translated: Similarly, when there is mental attention that is the instigator, then in dependence on the continuum of consciousness, the cognition that is associated with conceptualization arises, and the appearance of the aspect of the universal of the word and the universal of the referent arises.

original: snang ba de yang yid la byed pas ji ltar 'phangs pa de ltar 'byung ba dper na rdo khab len gang du g-yo ba dang / ji ltar g-yo ba de ltar lcags g-yo ba bzhin no //
analyzed: snang ba de yang yid la byed pas ji ltar 'phangs pa de ltar 'byung ba dper na rdo khab len gang du g-yo ba dang / ji ltar g-yo ba de ltar lcags g-yo ba bzhin no //
translated: Moreover, that appearance arises in accordance with the way it is projected by mental attention, just as the movement of iron is in accordance with the way the magnet moves.

original: shes pa g-yo ba yang rang rang gi snang ba la g-yo ba dang / snang ba yang 'dra ba'i bdag nyid yin pas de dag tshogs na brjod pa 'byung la ;
analyzed: shes pa g-yo ba yang rang rang gi snang ba la g-yo ba dang / snang ba yang 'dra ba'i bdag nyid yin pas de dag tshogs na brjod pa 'byung la ;
translated: The movement of cognition is the movement in regard to its own appearance, and the appearance is of the nature of a reflection. When these two are combined, verbalization arises.

original: tshogs pa yid la byed pa la rag las pas 'dir de kho na'i bye brag gi rgyu'i bdag nyid du smos so //
analyzed: tshogs pa yid la byed pa la rag las pas 'dir de kho na'i bye brag gi rgyu'i bdag nyid du smos so //
translated: Since the combination depends on mental attention, here it is mentioned as the nature of the cause of the particular of that.

original: da ni dgag pa rnam pa gnyis kyi bye brag gi rtsa ba yod pa mi sgrub pa dang / yin pa sgrub pa'i rgyu yid la byed pa'i bye brag yin par bstan pa de la yid la byed pa'i bye brag gnyis gang yin pa mi shes pas de bstan pa'i phyir /

translated: In order to demonstrate the difference between the two, the negation of the antidote and the negation of the other, it is said:üîΩThe antidote and the other are explainedüîΩBy the difference of the simultaneous obstruction of the continuum

original: cas bya ba smos te /

original: dngos po'i ngo bo gcig gi rgyun rgyun ma chad par gnas pa gang zhig la dngos po gzhan gyi rgyun dang de nye bar gyur na rang gi nas pa med pa'i skabs su byed pa ste /
analyzed: dngos po'i ngo bo gcig gi rgyun rgyun ma chad par gnas pa gang zhig la dngos po gzhan gyi rgyun dang de nye bar gyur na rang gi nas pa med pa'i skabs su byed pa ste /
translated: The continuum of the nature of one entity is uninterruptedly present. When the continuum of another entity becomes proximate to it, it creates an opportunity for the absence of its own capacity.

original: de dang gzhan yang rang gi rgyun dang nye yang rang gi nus pa la phan gnod med pa gang gang zhig dang nyen rang gi rgyun rgyas par 'gyur ba yod do //
analyzed: de dang gzhan yang rang gi rgyun dang nye yang rang gi nus pa la phan gnod med pa gang gang zhig dang nyen rang gi rgyun rgyas par 'gyur ba yod do //
translated: Even though that and others are proximate to their own continuum, there is no benefit or harm to their own capacity. That which is proximate to that becomes expanded in its own continuum.

analyzed: de rnams las 'dir ni gnod pa byed pa dang / gnod pa dgag pa'i dbang du byas te gnyen po dang / gzhan pa zhes gnyis su phye ba yin no //
translated: From among those, here, the antidote and the other are divided into two, taking the perspective of the harm-doer and the negation of harm.

analyzed: 'gal ba dang / zhan pa dang / zhum par dbye ba ni /

analyzed: dgag bya bag las gzhan nyid dang // dgag bya nyid las mi gzhan pas //
translated: since it is not different from the object of negation itself,

original: 'gal dang gzhan dang zhum pa'o //
analyzed: 'gal dang gzhan dang zhum pa'o //
translated: there is contradiction, difference, and weakness.

original: zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: This is what it says.

original: 'di ltar gzhan pa nyid la yang dgag par bya ba'i sgra las gzhan du ston pa'i dbang gis gzhan pa zhes bya ba dang / dgag par bya ba nyid kyi gzhi las gzhan du ston par mi byed pa'i dbang gis zhum pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar gzhan pa nyid la yang dgag par bya ba'i sgra las gzhan du ston pa'i dbang gis gzhan pa zhes bya ba dang / dgag par bya ba nyid kyi gzhi las gzhan du ston par mi byed pa'i dbang gis zhum pa ste /
translated: Thus, in difference, since it is shown as different from the word of the object of negation, it is called different. Since it is not shown as different from the basis of the object of negation itself, it is called weak.

original: snga ma gnyen po'i don ni 'gal bar bstan te gsum du phye ba yin no //
analyzed: snga ma gnyen po'i don ni 'gal bar bstan te gsum du phye ba yin no //
translated: The former two meanings of antidote are taught as contradiction, and are divided into three.

original: de la 'gal ba'i nang du mi mthun ba dang / gnyen po gnyi ga 'dur rung ste /
analyzed: de la 'gal ba'i nang du mi mthun ba dang / gnyen po gnyi ga 'dur rung ste /
translated: Among them, both incompatibility and antidote are suitable to be included in contradiction.

original: 'di ltar lhan cig gnas pa na gnod pa med par mi gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar lhan cig gnas pa na gnod pa med par mi gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because when they coexist, they do not remain without harming each other.

original: de yang yul thag ring na mi 'gal la mthun mnyam pa'i yul na mi 'gal te /
analyzed: de yang yul thag ring na mi 'gal la mthun mnyam pa'i yul na mi 'gal te /
translated: Moreover, they are not contradictory in a distant place, but they are contradictory in a place that is compatible and equal.

original: 'on kyang 'gal ba'i chos nyid btang ba ma yin no //üîΩ'di ltar khang mig gi nang na phyogs gcig na mar me gnas /
analyzed: 'on kyang 'gal ba'i chos nyid btang ba ma yin no // 'di ltar khang mig gi nang na phyogs gcig na mar me gnas /
translated: But it is not that they have given up their contradictory natures.

original: phyogs gcig na mun pa gnas pa na phyogs re na gnyi ga yang gnas shing gnod pa byed pa med kyang mar me'i rang bzhin mun pa sel ba btang ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: phyogs gcig na mun pa gnas pa na phyogs re na gnyi ga yang gnas shing gnod pa byed pa med kyang mar me'i rang bzhin mun pa sel ba btang ba ni ma yin no //
translated: For example, in a single room, a lamp is in one place and darkness is in another place. Although both are present in the same place and do not harm each other, it is not that the nature of the lamp has given up dispelling darkness.

original: mun pa sel ba yang mun pa'i nus pa nyams pa na der rang gi mthu'i snang ba bskyed de /
analyzed: mun pa sel ba yang mun pa'i nus pa nyams pa na der rang gi mthu'i snang ba bskyed de /
translated: And although it dispels darkness, when the power of darkness is impaired, it generates its own light there.

original: thams cad du ma yin yang rang bzhin ma btang ba nyid kyis thams cad nas thams cad du 'gal ba zhes bya ba'i ming btags pa la nyes pa med @262b do ;üîΩ/ gal ba thams cad kyang mtshungs par lhan cig skye ba'i 'gal ba dang / mtshan nyid gcig pa'i ngo bor 'gal ba gnyis so //
analyzed: thams cad du ma yin yang rang bzhin ma btang ba nyid kyis thams cad nas thams cad du 'gal ba zhes bya ba'i ming btags pa la nyes pa med @262b do ; / gal ba thams cad kyang mtshungs par lhan cig skye ba'i 'gal ba dang / mtshan nyid gcig pa'i ngo bor 'gal ba gnyis so //
translated: Although it is not everywhere, there is no fault in calling it ‚Äúcontradictory‚Äù because it does not give up its nature of being everywhere.üîΩAll of these are similar. There are two types of contradiction: contradiction of simultaneous arising and contradiction of having the same nature.

original: de la mtshungs par lhan cig skye ba'i 'gal ba yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de la mtshungs par lhan cig skye ba'i 'gal ba yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The first, contradiction of simultaneous arising, is of three types:

original: nus pa nyams par byed pa'i 'gal ba dang / rang bzhin gyi skabs mi 'byed pa'i 'gal ba dang / phan tshun gnod pa byed pa'i 'gal ba'o //
analyzed: nus pa nyams par byed pa'i 'gal ba dang / rang bzhin gyi skabs mi 'byed pa'i 'gal ba dang / phan tshun gnod pa byed pa'i 'gal ba'o //
translated: 3. The contradiction of mutual harm.

original: de la nus pa nyams par byed pa'i 'gal ba ni dper na mun pa la snang ba lta bu yin te /
analyzed: de la nus pa nyams par byed pa'i 'gal ba ni dper na mun pa la snang ba lta bu yin te /
translated: The contradiction of the loss of potency is, for example, like light and darkness.

original: ji ltar mun pa'i nu sa pa nyams par byed pa'i las can nyid kyis sel bar byed do //
analyzed: ji ltar mun pa'i nu sa pa nyams par byed pa'i las can nyid kyis sel bar byed do //
translated: Just as darkness has the activity of causing the loss of potency of sight, light removes it.

original: rang bzhin gyi skabs me 'byed pa'i 'gal ba ni snang ba la mun pa lta bu yin te /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi skabs me 'byed pa'i 'gal ba ni snang ba la mun pa lta bu yin te /
translated: The contradiction of not allowing the opportunity for intrinsic nature is, for example, like light and darkness.

original: ji ltar rang gi mthu ma nyams kyi bar du snang ba'i go skabs mi 'byed do //
analyzed: ji ltar rang gi mthu ma nyams kyi bar du snang ba'i go skabs mi 'byed do //
translated: Just as long as the power of light is not lost, it does not allow the opportunity for darkness.

original: phan tshun gnod pa byed pa'i 'gal ba ni grang ba dang tsha ba'i reg pa lta bu yin te /
analyzed: phan tshun gnod pa byed pa'i 'gal ba ni grang ba dang tsha ba'i reg pa lta bu yin te /
translated: The contradiction of mutual harm is, for example, like the sensation of cold and the sensation of heat.

original: 'di ltar grang ba'i reg pa mthu chen tsha ba'i reg pa yod kyang mtshungs pa gzhan skye ba la gnod pa'i bdag nyid can du byed pa yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar grang ba'i reg pa mthu chen tsha ba'i reg pa yod kyang mtshungs pa gzhan skye ba la gnod pa'i bdag nyid can du byed pa yin la /
translated: Thus, the sensation of cold has the nature of harming the arising of another sensation of heat that is similar to it, even if it is powerful.

original: gal te tsha ba'i reg pa mthu chen yang de bzhin te /
analyzed: gal te tsha ba'i reg pa mthu chen yang de bzhin te /
translated: If the touch of heat is powerful, it is the same.

original: 'di gnyi ga yang byed pa'i bdag nyid can du gnas blta bu'o //
analyzed: 'di gnyi ga yang byed pa'i bdag nyid can du gnas blta bu'o //
translated: Both of these are seen to be of the nature of activity.

original: mtshan nyid gcig pa'i ngo bor 'gal ba la yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: mtshan nyid gcig pa'i ngo bor 'gal ba la yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two kinds of contradiction in the nature of a single characteristic:

original: yod pa dang med pa dang / yin pa dang ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa dang / yin pa dang ma yin pa'o //
translated: existence and non-existence, and being and non-being.

original: de la snga ma ni dngos su 'gal bar shes pa yin la /
analyzed: de la snga ma ni dngos su 'gal bar shes pa yin la /
translated: The former is known as direct contradiction.

original: gcig ni brgyud nas 'gal bar shes pa yin te /
analyzed: gcig ni brgyud nas 'gal bar shes pa yin te /
translated: The latter is known as indirect contradiction.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: dper na lha sbyin yod pas ni med pa dngos su spangs te gnas pa yin la /
analyzed: dper na lha sbyin yod pas ni med pa dngos su spangs te gnas pa yin la /
translated: For example, Devadatta, existing, directly excludes non-existence and abides.

original: med pa yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: med pa yang de bzhin no //
translated: Non-existence is the same.

original: ma yin pa ni sngar med pa khong du chud dgos te /
analyzed: ma yin pa ni sngar med pa khong du chud dgos te /
translated: Non-being must be understood as non-existence.

original: de nas gdod ma yin par shes so //
analyzed: de nas gdod ma yin par shes so //
translated: Only then is it known as non-being.

original: de rnams las med pa ni med par dgag pa yin te 'dir mi rtag go //
analyzed: de rnams las med pa ni med par dgag pa yin te 'dir mi rtag go //
translated: Among those, non-existence is a non-affirming negation. Here, it is impermanent.

original: ma yin pa ni skabs yin no //
analyzed: ma yin pa ni skabs yin no //
translated: Non-being is the context.

original: 'dir 'gal bar dgag pa zhes brjod pa ni mtshungs par lhan cig skye ba'i 'gal ba kho na gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir 'gal bar dgag pa zhes brjod pa ni mtshungs par lhan cig skye ba'i 'gal ba kho na gzung bar bya'o //
translated: Here, the expression ‚Äúcontradictory negation‚Äù should be understood as referring only to the contradiction of simultaneous origination.

original: de la mtshungs pa ni skad cig ma snga ma dang phyi ma'i rgyun 'dra bar 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: de la mtshungs pa ni skad cig ma snga ma dang phyi ma'i rgyun 'dra bar 'byung ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúSimultaneous‚Äù means that the earlier and later moments occur in a similar continuum.

original: lhan cig ces bya ba ni rgyun gnyis nas gcig tu skye ba'i chos te skad cig ma gzhan skyed pa'o //
analyzed: lhan cig ces bya ba ni rgyun gnyis nas gcig tu skye ba'i chos te skad cig ma gzhan skyed pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúOrigination‚Äù refers to a phenomenon that arises as a single entity from two continua, producing another moment.

original: 'gal ba ni gcig skye ba na gcig nyams pa ste /
analyzed: 'gal ba ni gcig skye ba na gcig nyams pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúContradictory‚Äù means that when one arises, the other ceases.

original: 'gal ba dang / mi mthun pa dang / so sor byed pa ni rnam grangs so //
analyzed: 'gal ba dang / mi mthun pa dang / so sor byed pa ni rnam grangs so //
translated: ‚ÄúContradictory,‚Äù ‚Äúincompatible,‚Äù and ‚Äúexclusive‚Äù are synonyms.

original: mtshon par bya ba'am byed pa'i don ni mtshan ma ste /
analyzed: mtshon par bya ba'am byed pa'i don ni mtshan ma ste /
translated: ‚ÄúCharacteristic‚Äù means that which is indicated or that which indicates.

original: rang rang gi chos mtshon pas mtshan ma'o //
analyzed: rang rang gi chos mtshon pas mtshan ma'o //
translated: Since each phenomenon is indicated by its own characteristic, it is a characteristic.

original: de ni @263a * //
analyzed: de ni @263a * //
translated: That is its nature.

original: de'i ngo bo nyid yin te de mthun pa ni gcig pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo nyid yin te de mthun pa ni gcig pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That which is similar to that is called ‚Äúthe same.‚Äù

original: chos gang dag rang rang gi mtshan nyid du gnas pa ni mtshan nyid gcig gi ngo bor 'gal te /
analyzed: chos gang dag rang rang gi mtshan nyid du gnas pa ni mtshan nyid gcig gi ngo bor 'gal te /
translated: Any phenomena that abide as their own characteristics are contradictory in the nature of a single characteristic.

original: 'di ni dngos po thams cad kyi chos nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni dngos po thams cad kyi chos nyid yin no //
translated: This is the reality of all things.

original: de ni rnam grangs bco lngar bshad pa'i dgag pa de dag gi bye brag bstan par 'dod de /
analyzed: de ni rnam grangs bco lngar bshad pa'i dgag pa de dag gi bye brag bstan par 'dod de /
translated: He wishes to teach the distinctions among the fifteen types of negation that have been explained.

original: de yang dgag par bya ba'i sgo nas dbye ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de yang dgag par bya ba'i sgo nas dbye ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the divisions from the point of view of the negatee, he says:üîΩThe other to be taught,üîΩthe similar negatee,

original: bstan par bya ba gzhan nyid dang // dgag par bya ba 'dra ba dang // de bzhin yon tan nyid dang ni //
analyzed: bstan par bya ba gzhan nyid dang // dgag par bya ba 'dra ba dang // de bzhin yon tan nyid dang ni //
translated: and likewise, the very quality,üîΩthe complete proliferation,üîΩthe nature of the activity,üîΩthe gross entity of the continuum,üîΩthe many synonyms of the desire,üîΩand likewise, the long duration,

original: kun du rnam par spros pa dang // las su byed pa'i bdag nyid dang // rgyun gyi dngos po rags pa dang // 'dod pa'i rnam grangs du ma dang / de bzhin yun gyi chu srid dang // dngos kyi rang bzhin che ba dang // bsams pa'i don las lhag pa dang //
analyzed: kun du rnam par spros pa dang // las su byed pa'i bdag nyid dang // rgyun gyi dngos po rags pa dang // 'dod pa'i rnam grangs du ma dang / de bzhin yun gyi chu srid dang // dngos kyi rang bzhin che ba dang // bsams pa'i don las lhag pa dang //
translated: the great intrinsic reality of the entity,üîΩand the excess of the intended meaning,üîΩthe complete pervasion,

original: kun du khyab par gyur pa dang // lhan cig gnas par gyur pa la //
analyzed: kun du khyab par gyur pa dang // lhan cig gnas par gyur pa la //
translated: and the co-abiding,üîΩare not able to abide,üîΩthe one who steals the ability in that,

original: gnas par nus pa ma yin dang // de la nus pa 'phrog byed dang // med pas mtshon pa'i yod pa yis //
analyzed: gnas par nus pa ma yin dang // de la nus pa 'phrog byed dang // med pas mtshon pa'i yod pa yis //
translated: and the existent indicated by the non-existent,

original: ji ltar bstan pa'i don bzhin du //
analyzed: ji ltar bstan pa'i don bzhin du //
translated: As it is taught,

original: bsdu ba'i bye brag de bzhin no //üîΩzhes bya ba smos te /üîΩde la bstan par bya ba gzhan zhes bya ba ni gzhan par dgag pa'i bye brag ste /
analyzed: bsdu ba'i bye brag de bzhin no // zhes bya ba smos te / de la bstan par bya ba gzhan zhes bya ba ni gzhan par dgag pa'i bye brag ste /
translated: so is the distinction of inclusion.üîΩHere, ‚Äúthe other that is taught‚Äù is the distinction of negation of other.

original: gang zhig bkag pas gzhan ston ces bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig bkag pas gzhan ston ces bya ba yin no //
translated: By negating that, the other is taught.

original: dgag par bya ba 'dra ba zhes bya ba ni mi 'dra bar ston pa'i dgag bya yin te /
analyzed: dgag par bya ba 'dra ba zhes bya ba ni mi 'dra bar ston pa'i dgag bya yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúThe similar that is negated‚Äù is the negatee of teaching the dissimilar.

original: de bkag nas de dang mi mtshungs pa'i ngo bor ston pa zhes bya ba'i don yin no //
analyzed: de bkag nas de dang mi mtshungs pa'i ngo bor ston pa zhes bya ba'i don yin no //
translated: By negating that, the entity that is not similar to that is taught.

original: de bzhin yon tan nyid ces bya ba ni dman par dgag pa'i dgag par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin yon tan nyid ces bya ba ni dman par dgag pa'i dgag par bya ba yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúJust so, the quality itself‚Äù is the negatee of negation of inferiority.

original: de bzhin zhes bya ba ni dgag par bya ba zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de bzhin zhes bya ba ni dgag par bya ba zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: ‚ÄúJust so‚Äù is to be connected with ‚Äúthe negatee.‚Äù

original: nyid ces bya ba ni yon tan gyi dngos po'o //
analyzed: nyid ces bya ba ni yon tan gyi dngos po'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe quality itself‚Äù is the entity of the quality.

original: kun du rnam par spros pa zhes bya ba ni zhum pa'i dgag bya ste /
analyzed: kun du rnam par spros pa zhes bya ba ni zhum pa'i dgag bya ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThe complete proliferation‚Äù is the negatee of depression.

original: spros pa'i ngo bo ni rgyas pa yin la /
analyzed: spros pa'i ngo bo ni rgyas pa yin la /
translated: The nature of proliferation is expansion.

original: de dgag go zhes so //
analyzed: de dgag go zhes so //
translated: That is negated.

original: las su byed pa'i bdag nyid dang // zhes bya ba ni zhan pa'i dgag bya ste /
analyzed: las su byed pa'i bdag nyid dang // zhes bya ba ni zhan pa'i dgag bya ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe nature of an agent‚Äù refers to the weak form of the object of negation.

original: mtshan nyid gang la las gang yod pa de nus pa drag pa dang zhen pa dag las drag pa byed pa'i bdag nyid de dgag par bya ba ste 'dir yang gzhi'i las ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mtshan nyid gang la las gang yod pa de nus pa drag pa dang zhen pa dag las drag pa byed pa'i bdag nyid de dgag par bya ba ste 'dir yang gzhi'i las ni ma yin no //
translated: The nature of an agent is the strong form of the object of negation, which is the capacity of a thing to perform an action that is stronger than its capacity to adhere to itself.

original: de yang las zhes bya ba ni dper na shing gcod pa lta bu yin la /üîΩde la skyes bu lag cha'i tshogs kyis byed pas byed pa'i las de la yod la /
analyzed: de yang las zhes bya ba ni dper na shing gcod pa lta bu yin la / de la skyes bu lag cha'i tshogs kyis byed pas byed pa'i las de la yod la /
translated: The action is like the cutting of a tree.üîΩThe agent is the person who performs the action by means of the instrument.

original: de yang shing dang 'phrad pa na byed pas de dag la shing gcod pa'i las can @263b zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de yang shing dang 'phrad pa na byed pas de dag la shing gcod pa'i las can @263b zhes bya'o //
translated: The instrument is the thing that performs the action when it comes in contact with the object.

original: shing yang gcad par bya ba yin pas gcad pa'i gzhi las te /üîΩde gnyi ga yang rtag pa'i sgo nas las su gzhag gi dngos su ni byed pa po'i nye bar 'dod pa shing gcod pa yin te /
analyzed: shing yang gcad par bya ba yin pas gcad pa'i gzhi las te / de gnyi ga yang rtag pa'i sgo nas las su gzhag gi dngos su ni byed pa po'i nye bar 'dod pa shing gcod pa yin te /
translated: The object is the thing that is cut.üîΩBoth the agent and the instrument are posited as the action in terms of their relation to the object.üîΩThe actual agent is the one who desires to perform the action of cutting the tree.

original: des byed pa po dang byed pa dang gzhi nyid 'du byed do //
analyzed: des byed pa po dang byed pa dang gzhi nyid 'du byed do //
translated: The agent, the action, and the object are all brought together by that desire.

original: gang gis 'du byed pa de ni las yin no //
analyzed: gang gis 'du byed pa de ni las yin no //
translated: That by which it is formed is the action.

original: de dag las 'dir ni byed pa la gnas pa'i las de gzung bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de dag las 'dir ni byed pa la gnas pa'i las de gzung bar bya ba yin no //
translated: Of these, here the action that is based on the agent is to be understood.üîΩThe gross entity of the continuum

original: rgyun gyi dngos po rags ba dang // zhes bya ba ni phra ba'i dgag bya ste /
analyzed: rgyun gyi dngos po rags ba dang // zhes bya ba ni phra ba'i dgag bya ste /
translated: is the object of negation in the context of the subtle.

original: de la rgyun ni skad cig ma mang po 'dus pa'o //
analyzed: de la rgyun ni skad cig ma mang po 'dus pa'o //
translated: Here, the continuum is the aggregation of many moments.

original: skad cig ma mang po rgyun du gnas pa'i ngo bo nyid ni dngos po ste /
analyzed: skad cig ma mang po rgyun du gnas pa'i ngo bo nyid ni dngos po ste /
translated: The entity is the nature of many moments that endures in a continuum.

original: de ni 'dir de'i dgag par bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ni 'dir de'i dgag par bya ba'o //
translated: That is the object of negation here.üîΩThe many synonyms of ‚Äúdesire‚Äù

original: 'dod pa'i rnam grangs du ma zhes bya ba ni nyung ba'i dgag par bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i rnam grangs du ma zhes bya ba ni nyung ba'i dgag par bya ba ste /
translated: are the object of negation in the context of the few.

original: du ma ni mang po'i tshig go //
analyzed: du ma ni mang po'i tshig go //
translated: Many is a word for a lot.

original: 'dod pa zhes smos pa ni mi 'dod na gal te mang de sgrub par mi byed do //
analyzed: 'dod pa zhes smos pa ni mi 'dod na gal te mang de sgrub par mi byed do //
translated: The word desire is used because if one does not desire something, then one will not strive to accomplish it, even if it is a lot.

original: de ni 'di ltar yin te /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar yin te /
translated: This is how it is.

original: smra ba po'i blo la nyung bar bsgrub par 'dod na rnam grangs ji snyed yod kyang de nyung bar sgrub la /
analyzed: smra ba po'i blo la nyung bar bsgrub par 'dod na rnam grangs ji snyed yod kyang de nyung bar sgrub la /
translated: If the speaker wishes to establish something as few, then no matter how many synonyms there are, it is established as few.

original: de lta bu gcig tu bzlums te de dang 'dra ba'i du ma 'gegs par byed de /
analyzed: de lta bu gcig tu bzlums te de dang 'dra ba'i du ma 'gegs par byed de /
translated: In the same way, many such things are negated by a single negation.

original: de'i phyir 'dod pa'i rnam grangs zhes smos kyi rnam grangs tsam gyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dod pa'i rnam grangs zhes smos kyi rnam grangs tsam gyis ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is called a nominal negation, not a mere nominal negation.

original: de bzhin yul gyi chu srid ces bya ba ni thung ba'i dgag bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin yul gyi chu srid ces bya ba ni thung ba'i dgag bya ste /
translated: Similarly, the negation of short is called long.

original: de la chu srid ni dngos po'i dbyibs la yang yod pas yun zhes smos te 'dir dus la bya'o//
analyzed: de la chu srid ni dngos po'i dbyibs la yang yod pas yun zhes smos te 'dir dus la bya'o//
translated: Here, long refers to the shape of a thing, so duration is mentioned, which here means time.

original: de bzhin zhes bya ba ni 'dir yang 'dod pa'i yun du bsams te dgag go zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin zhes bya ba ni 'dir yang 'dod pa'i yun du bsams te dgag go zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Similarly, here also, the negation of short is considered to be long, and is negated.

original: dngos kyi rang bzhin che ba zhes bya ba ni chung ba'i dgag par bya ba ste /
analyzed: dngos kyi rang bzhin che ba zhes bya ba ni chung ba'i dgag par bya ba ste /
translated: The negation of small is called great.

original: de la dngos po ni rdzas su yod pa'o //
analyzed: de la dngos po ni rdzas su yod pa'o //
translated: Here, a thing is substantially existent.

original: de'i ngo bo nyid ni de'i rang bzhin te nge dgag par bya'o zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo nyid ni de'i rang bzhin te nge dgag par bya'o zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Its nature is its essence, and that is negated.

original: bsams pa'i don las lhag pa ni lhag ma med pa'i dgag par bya ba ste /
analyzed: bsams pa'i don las lhag pa ni lhag ma med pa'i dgag par bya ba ste /
translated: The negation of less than is called more.

original: 'di ltar bsams pa'i don yod kyang de las gzhan pa'i lhag ma ste de dag go zhe'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar bsams pa'i don yod kyang de las gzhan pa'i lhag ma ste de dag go zhe'o //
translated: Although the meaning of this is understood, the remainder, i.e., the other, is to be explained.

original: kun du khyab par gyur pa ni mtha' dag ma yin pa'i dgag par bya ste /
analyzed: kun du khyab par gyur pa ni mtha' dag ma yin pa'i dgag par bya ste /
translated: The negation of the non-universal is the negation of the universal.

original: 'di ni mtha' dag gi ngo bor 'dud ba 'gegs kyi mtha' dag nyid bkag na ni med pa'am gzhi 'pho bar 'gyur gyi chung ba'i khongs su bsdur rung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ni mtha' dag gi ngo bor 'dud ba 'gegs kyi mtha' dag nyid bkag na ni med pa'am gzhi 'pho bar 'gyur gyi chung ba'i khongs su bsdur rung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: This is the negation of the universal as the nature of the non-universal, but if the universal itself were negated, it would be non-existent or transferred to another basis, and it would not be possible to include it within the non-universal.

original: de ni mgo gcig tu lung bstan pa'i sgras rnam par phye ba'i don yang ston pa yin pa las 'di rnam par phye ba'i don du 'gyur bar gzung ba yin no //
analyzed: de ni mgo gcig tu lung bstan pa'i sgras rnam par phye ba'i don yang ston pa yin pa las 'di rnam par phye ba'i don du 'gyur bar gzung ba yin no //
translated: This is also shown to be the meaning distinguished by the term ‚Äúunqualified‚Äù prediction, but here it is taken as the meaning distinguished.

original: 'di ni thun mong du dgag pa zhes bya la /
analyzed: 'di ni thun mong du dgag pa zhes bya la /
translated: This is called the common negation.

original: gcig ni @264a * //
analyzed: gcig ni @264a * //
translated: One is

original: thun mong bstan te dgag pa yin no //
analyzed: thun mong bstan te dgag pa yin no //
translated: the common negation.

original: de dag gi phyir chos can gyi ngo bo 'am de'i rigs su bsdus pas gcig la chos gcig bye brag med pa kho nar thun mong du khyab par gyur pa de 'di'i dgag par bya ba yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de dag gi phyir chos can gyi ngo bo 'am de'i rigs su bsdus pas gcig la chos gcig bye brag med pa kho nar thun mong du khyab par gyur pa de 'di'i dgag par bya ba yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, the object of negation is that which is included in the nature of the subject or its type, and is only pervasively and without exception the same in all subjects.üîΩBut how can the negation of a particular and the teaching of a particular be negated?

original: 'o na thun mongs ma yin par dgag pa dang / thun mong ma yin par ston pa de dgag par ji ltar 'gyur zhe na 'di gnyis ni nges par gzung ba'i dgag pa yin pas dgag pa kun gyi spyir 'gro ste /
analyzed: 'o na thun mongs ma yin par dgag pa dang / thun mong ma yin par ston pa de dgag par ji ltar 'gyur zhe na 'di gnyis ni nges par gzung ba'i dgag pa yin pas dgag pa kun gyi spyir 'gro ste /
translated: These two are definite descriptions, and they are the general mode of all negations.

original: 'di ltar nges par 'dzin pa bkag na ni de dag gang yang rung ste thun mong gi chos su 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ltar nges par 'dzin pa bkag na ni de dag gang yang rung ste thun mong gi chos su 'gyur te /
translated: For if a definite description is negated, then any of them becomes a common phenomenon.

original: 'di ltar dper na lhas byin gyi bu ngan pa la lhas byin kho na la bu yod pa ma yin zhes bya ba'i sgra bu drag pa dang phrad par 'dod na de nges par 'dzin pa bkag na gzhan la yang yod par ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar dper na lhas byin gyi bu ngan pa la lhas byin kho na la bu yod pa ma yin zhes bya ba'i sgra bu drag pa dang phrad par 'dod na de nges par 'dzin pa bkag na gzhan la yang yod par ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: For example, if the word ‚Äúonly‚Äù in the statement ‚ÄúDevadatta‚Äôs son is bad‚Äù is negated, then it is taught that he has another son.

original: rang la yod pa yang mi 'dor te /
analyzed: rang la yod pa yang mi 'dor te /
translated: Nor does it abandon what is already present in itself.

original: thun mong gi ngo bar ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thun mong gi ngo bar ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: It shows the common nature.

original: gal te nges par bzung ste bkag na ni sgra de nyid la lha byin la yod pa 'ba' zhig bkag nas gzhan la yang yod par ston te /
analyzed: gal te nges par bzung ste bkag na ni sgra de nyid la lha byin la yod pa 'ba' zhig bkag nas gzhan la yang yod par ston te /
translated: If it were to negate by means of a restrictive specification, then it would show that sound exists elsewhere, having negated only that sound which exists in Devadatta.

original: 'di ni thun mong ma yin par ston par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni thun mong ma yin par ston par byed pa yin no //
translated: This is the way it shows the uncommon.

original: de ni zhar la 'ongs pa ste /
analyzed: de ni zhar la 'ongs pa ste /
translated: This is a digression.

original: 'og nas tshig gi phrad dgag pa'i skabs su rig par bya'o //üîΩlhan cig gnas par gyur pa la //
analyzed: 'og nas tshig gi phrad dgag pa'i skabs su rig par bya'o // lhan cig gnas par gyur pa la //
translated: It will be understood later in the section on the refutation of verbal conventions.üîΩIt is not possible for that whichüîΩcoexists to be a basis.

original: gnas par nus pa ma yin dang // zhes bya ba ni mi mthun par dgag pa'i dgag bye ste /
analyzed: gnas par nus pa ma yin dang // zhes bya ba ni mi mthun par dgag pa'i dgag bye ste /
translated: This is the negatee of mutual exclusion.

original: de ni rang bzhin gyi go skabs mi 'byed pa'i skabs su bshad zin to //
analyzed: de ni rang bzhin gyi go skabs mi 'byed pa'i skabs su bshad zin to //
translated: It has already been explained in the section on the non-interruption of the intrinsic nature.üîΩThere, the negation of the potential is

original: de la nus pa 'phrog byed dang // zhes bya ba ni gnyen por dgag pa'i dgag par bya ba ste /
analyzed: de la nus pa 'phrog byed dang // zhes bya ba ni gnyen por dgag pa'i dgag par bya ba ste /
translated: the negatee of the negation of the antidote.

original: de ni nus pa nyams par byed pa'i 'gal bar bshad zin to //
analyzed: de ni nus pa nyams par byed pa'i 'gal bar bshad zin to //
translated: It has already been explained as the contradiction which undermines the potential.

original: med pas mtshon pa'i yod pa ni bral ba'i bstan par bya ba ste /
analyzed: med pas mtshon pa'i yod pa ni bral ba'i bstan par bya ba ste /
translated: The existence that is indicated by nonexistence is the object of the teaching of separation.

original: de yang sngar bshad zin to //
analyzed: de yang sngar bshad zin to //
translated: And that has already been explained.

original: yis zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba ste /
analyzed: yis zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba ste /
translated: The word ‚Äúthus‚Äù is a summary.

original: dang gi zlas dbye ba de dag 'dir dril te ji ltar bstan pa zhes kun la spyar ro //
analyzed: dang gi zlas dbye ba de dag 'dir dril te ji ltar bstan pa zhes kun la spyar ro //
translated: The alternatives of and are combined here. ‚ÄúThus‚Äù is to be supplied with each.

original: don bzhin du //
analyzed: don bzhin du //
translated: In accordance with the meaning.

original: bsdu ba'i bye brag de bzhin no //
analyzed: bsdu ba'i bye brag de bzhin no //
translated: The specific summaries are similar.

original: zhes bya ba ni don gyi dbye ba rgyas pa de la ji ltar phye ba de bzhin du de las cung zad bsdu ba rnams kyi yang de bzhin du shes par bya'o zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni don gyi dbye ba rgyas pa de la ji ltar phye ba de bzhin du de las cung zad bsdu ba rnams kyi yang de bzhin du shes par bya'o zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The specific summaries are to be understood as they are summarized in brief, in accordance with the extensive classification of the meaning.

original: de yang ming tha dad pa dag ni sngar bshad nas ming mthun pa rnams ltos pa yin te /
analyzed: de yang ming tha dad pa dag ni sngar bshad nas ming mthun pa rnams ltos pa yin te /
translated: Moreover, the different names have already been explained. The common names are to be understood in terms of their dependence.

original: 'di ltar gzhan pa dang / 'dra ba dang / dman pa dang / chung ba dang / mi mthun pa dang / gnyen po dang / bral ba dang bdun du @264b dbye ba'i don gyi khyad par dang / gzhan yang mi mthun pa ma gtogs pa drug gi dbye ba dag de dag nyid kyis shes par bya'o zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar gzhan pa dang / 'dra ba dang / dman pa dang / chung ba dang / mi mthun pa dang / gnyen po dang / bral ba dang bdun du @264b dbye ba'i don gyi khyad par dang / gzhan yang mi mthun pa ma gtogs pa drug gi dbye ba dag de dag nyid kyis shes par bya'o zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
translated: Moreover, the six divisions except for dissimilar should be understood by those very [seven divisions].

original: ldog pa bsdus pa rab tu bstan pa zhes bya ba las bsdus pa'i bye brag bstan pa'i le'u zhes bya ba ste gnyis pa'o /
analyzed: ldog pa bsdus pa rab tu bstan pa zhes bya ba las bsdus pa'i bye brag bstan pa'i le'u zhes bya ba ste gnyis pa'o /
translated: This is the second chapter called ‚ÄúThe Exposition of the Divisions of Inclusion‚Äù from the treatise ‚ÄúThe Detailed Explanation of the Summary of the Five Heaps.‚Äù

original: // / da ni dgag pa'i ltos pa bstan par 'dod nas /üîΩdgag pa yul dang gnas skabs dang / dus la ltos par shes par bya //
analyzed: // / da ni dgag pa'i ltos pa bstan par 'dod nas / dgag pa yul dang gnas skabs dang / dus la ltos par shes par bya //
translated: Now, wishing to explain the dependence of negation,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgya cher smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgya cher smos te /
translated: [the root text] states extensively: ‚ÄúNegation should be understood as depending on object, occasion, and time.‚Äù

original: de la dgag pa'i yul ni med pa dang / ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid gzhi gang la yod pa 'dir yul du 'dod de /
analyzed: de la dgag pa'i yul ni med pa dang / ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid gzhi gang la yod pa 'dir yul du 'dod de /
translated: Regarding that, the object of negation is any basis characterized by non-existence and non-actuality, which is asserted here as the object.

original: dper na bum pa dgag par byed na bum pas dben pa'i sa gzhi lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na bum pa dgag par byed na bum pas dben pa'i sa gzhi lta bu'o //
translated: For example, when one negates a pot, one does so on a place devoid of a pot.

original: yul gzhan pa ni 'dir mi bzung ste /
analyzed: yul gzhan pa ni 'dir mi bzung ste /
translated: One should not take the other objects here.

original: rgyas par yul gyi bye brag rgyas par bstan pa'i skabs su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyas par yul gyi bye brag rgyas par bstan pa'i skabs su rig par bya'o //
translated: One should understand them in detail in the section on the detailed teaching of the distinctions of objects.

original: gnas skabs ni don gyi dngos po ji ltar ston pa'i shugs yin te /
analyzed: gnas skabs ni don gyi dngos po ji ltar ston pa'i shugs yin te /
translated: The occasion is the power of how the meaning is taught.

original: de yang don gyi dgos pa'i shugs nyid yin no //
analyzed: de yang don gyi dgos pa'i shugs nyid yin no //
translated: Moreover, it is the power of the purpose of the meaning itself.

original: dus ni gsum ste /
analyzed: dus ni gsum ste /
translated: Time is threefold:

original: 'das pa dang / da ltar byung ba dang / ma 'ongs pa'o //
analyzed: 'das pa dang / da ltar byung ba dang / ma 'ongs pa'o //
translated: past, present, and future.

original: de dag la ltos pa ni dper na bum pa dgag par 'dod na 'di skad du phyogs 'di na sngon chad bum pa med ces bya ba la sogs pa smos na yul khyad par can la ma ltos na yul thams cad dgag bar ni mi nus so //
analyzed: de dag la ltos pa ni dper na bum pa dgag par 'dod na 'di skad du phyogs 'di na sngon chad bum pa med ces bya ba la sogs pa smos na yul khyad par can la ma ltos na yul thams cad dgag bar ni mi nus so //
translated: In dependence on them, for example, when one wishes to negate a pot, if one says, In this place, previously there was no pot, and so on, without relying on a particular object, one cannot negate all objects.

original: dus kun du yang mi nus te /
analyzed: dus kun du yang mi nus te /
translated: One cannot do so at all times.

original: de'i khyad par gzung dgos la /
analyzed: de'i khyad par gzung dgos la /
translated: One must apprehend its distinctions.

original: gnas skabs med pa dang / ma yin pa la sogs pa ji ltar go bar bya ba'i dgos ched kyi khyad par med na bstan pa'i dmigs med par 'gyur bas de rnams la ltos dgos pa nyid do //
analyzed: gnas skabs med pa dang / ma yin pa la sogs pa ji ltar go bar bya ba'i dgos ched kyi khyad par med na bstan pa'i dmigs med par 'gyur bas de rnams la ltos dgos pa nyid do //
translated: If there were no difference in the purpose of understanding nonexistence, non-actuality, etc., then the teaching would be pointless, so one must rely on those.

original: ltos pa'i sa de dag kyang thams cad la 'am /
analyzed: ltos pa'i sa de dag kyang thams cad la 'am /
translated: Do those which are relied on exist in all cases,

original: 'on te ma nges she na /
analyzed: 'on te ma nges she na /
translated: or are they not ascertained?

original: de ni ma nges te /
analyzed: de ni ma nges te /
translated: They are not ascertained.üîΩThus:

original: 'di ltar / de dag gsum mam gnyis sam //üîΩre re'i dbang la'ang ltos pa yin //
analyzed: 'di ltar / de dag gsum mam gnyis sam // re re'i dbang la'ang ltos pa yin //
translated: They are relied on in three ways, two ways,

original: zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: and one way.

original: de'i don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de'i don ni 'di yin te /
translated: This is the meaning of that.

original: ltos pa zhes bya ba yang khyad par du byas te ltos dgos pas na ltos pa zhes gdags so //
analyzed: ltos pa zhes bya ba yang khyad par du byas te ltos dgos pas na ltos pa zhes gdags so //
translated: That which is called ‚Äúrelied on‚Äù is relied on in a specific way, so it is designated as ‚Äúrelied on.‚Äù

original: gal te khyad par mi 'dzin te spyi tsam du 'dzin na ni de ltos pa'i rnam grangs su 'dir mi gzung ngo //
analyzed: gal te khyad par mi 'dzin te spyi tsam du 'dzin na ni de ltos pa'i rnam grangs su 'dir mi gzung ngo //
translated: If one does not apprehend a specific object but apprehends a mere generality, then it is not held here as a synonym of ‚Äúrelied on.‚Äù

original: des na 'di ltar 'gyur te /
analyzed: des na 'di ltar 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, it is like this:

original: kha cig tu yul dang dus dang gnas skabs gsum char gyi bye brag gzung dgos ba yang yod la /
analyzed: kha cig tu yul dang dus dang gnas skabs gsum char gyi bye brag gzung dgos ba yang yod la /
translated: In some cases, one must apprehend the distinctions of all three: object, time, and occasion.

original: kha cig tu de dag gang yang rung ba @265a * //üîΩgnyis gnyis sam /
analyzed: kha cig tu de dag gang yang rung ba @265a * // gnyis gnyis sam /
translated: In some cases, it is not necessary to mention the particular, because the general is mentioned.

original: re re'i khyad par bzung bas gzhan spyir 'gyur bas gzung mi dgos pa yang yod do zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
analyzed: re re'i khyad par bzung bas gzhan spyir 'gyur bas gzung mi dgos pa yang yod do zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
translated: In some cases, it is not necessary to mention either, because both the general and the particular are understood.

original: de ltar yul dang dus dang gnas skabs kyi spyi dang khyad par de dag mthun par dbye ba yod dam /
analyzed: de ltar yul dang dus dang gnas skabs kyi spyi dang khyad par de dag mthun par dbye ba yod dam /
translated: In this way, the general and the particular of objects, time, and condition are distinguished.

original: 'on te bye brag yod pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'on te bye brag yod pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that there are also distinctions, he says:

original: spyi dang khyad par dbye ba ni /
analyzed: spyi dang khyad par dbye ba ni /
translated: The distinction between the general and the particular

original: yul dang dus la yod pa yin //
analyzed: yul dang dus la yod pa yin //
translated: Exists in regard to objects and time.

original: gnas skabs la yang cha yod do //üîΩzhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: gnas skabs la yang cha yod do // zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: It also exists in regard to condition.

original: de la yul dang dus la ni mthun par spyi dang bye brag gzung du yod de /
analyzed: de la yul dang dus la ni mthun par spyi dang bye brag gzung du yod de /
translated: In regard to objects and time, the general and the particular are apprehended as being in agreement.

original: des na res 'ga' smos dgos la res 'ga' mi dgos te /
analyzed: des na res 'ga' smos dgos la res 'ga' mi dgos te /
translated: Therefore, sometimes it is necessary to mention them and sometimes it is not.

original: gnas skabs bye brag gi ngo bo yin pas thams cad du shes par byed dgos pa yin na yang re zhig na dgag pa tsam du 'jog pa'i spyi'i cha yod do zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gnas skabs bye brag gi ngo bo yin pas thams cad du shes par byed dgos pa yin na yang re zhig na dgag pa tsam du 'jog pa'i spyi'i cha yod do zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Although it is the nature of the particular occasion, it must be understood in all cases, but for the time being, there is a general aspect that is posited as mere negation.

original: de la dang por yul dang dus dang gnas skabs gsum la ltos dgos par bstan pa de ltos pa gsum gyis sgo nas dgag pa'i yul du gyur pa med pa rnam pa bzhi zhes brjod pa yang 'grub par 'dod de /
analyzed: de la dang por yul dang dus dang gnas skabs gsum la ltos dgos par bstan pa de ltos pa gsum gyis sgo nas dgag pa'i yul du gyur pa med pa rnam pa bzhi zhes brjod pa yang 'grub par 'dod de /
translated: In that regard, first, it is taught that one must rely on the three: object, time, and occasion. Relying on those three, it is asserted that the four types of non-existence that are the objects of negation are established.

original: de bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that,üîΩthe characteristics of things

original: dngos po rnams kyi mtshan nyid dag / phan tshun gcig la gcig med pa //
analyzed: dngos po rnams kyi mtshan nyid dag / phan tshun gcig la gcig med pa //
translated: are mutually not in each other.

original: yul gyi khyad par la ltos pa'o //
analyzed: yul gyi khyad par la ltos pa'o //
translated: They rely on the distinctions of the object.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so// de la 'di ni gcig la gcig med pa ni yul gyi bye brag la ltos pa yin no zhes bya ba yin te ;
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so// de la 'di ni gcig la gcig med pa ni yul gyi bye brag la ltos pa yin no zhes bya ba yin te ;
translated: In that regard, this is the statement that mutually not existing relies on the distinctions of the object.

original: dper na rta la ba lang gis stong ste med pa dang / ba lang la rta yis stong ste med pa la dus kyi bye brag ni smos mi dgos te /
analyzed: dper na rta la ba lang gis stong ste med pa dang / ba lang la rta yis stong ste med pa la dus kyi bye brag ni smos mi dgos te /
translated: The particular time of their emptiness is not mentioned, because

original: yul gyi khyad par gang zhig la gang zhig med pa de yul kho na la ltos pa yin no //
analyzed: yul gyi khyad par gang zhig la gang zhig med pa de yul kho na la ltos pa yin no //
translated: the absence of something in a particular place depends only on that place.

original: snga na med pa dang / zhig nas med pa'i bye brag gi ltos pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: snga na med pa dang / zhig nas med pa'i bye brag gi ltos pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the particularity of the absence of something prior to its existence and the absence of something after its destruction,üîΩhe says:üîΩThe nature of cause and effect

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo dag / snga na med dang zhig nas med //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo dag / snga na med dang zhig nas med //
translated: is the absence of something prior to its existence and the absence of something after its destruction.

original: dus kyi khyad par la ltos pa'o //üîΩzhes smos pa yin no //
analyzed: dus kyi khyad par la ltos pa'o // zhes smos pa yin no //
translated: They depend on the particular time.

original: 'di ltar rgyu dag la 'bras bu'i rang bzhin snga na med pa dang / 'bras bu dag la rgyu'i rang bzhin zhig nas med pa ni dus snga phyi'i bye brag la ltos pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar rgyu dag la 'bras bu'i rang bzhin snga na med pa dang / 'bras bu dag la rgyu'i rang bzhin zhig nas med pa ni dus snga phyi'i bye brag la ltos pa yin te /
translated: Thus, the absence of the nature of the effect in the cause prior to its existence and the absence of the nature of the cause in the effect after its destruction depend on the particularity of earlier and later times.

original: rgyu 'bras kyi rgyu tsam gyi yul ni bye brag mi 'dzin no //
analyzed: rgyu 'bras kyi rgyu tsam gyi yul ni bye brag mi 'dzin no //
translated: The mere place of cause and effect does not apprehend the particularity.

original: shin tu med pa'i ltos pa bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: shin tu med pa'i ltos pa bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: In order to demonstrate the particularity of complete non-existence,üîΩhe says:

original: ri bong rva dang mo gsham bu //
analyzed: ri bong rva dang mo gsham bu //
translated: The horns of a rabbit, the son of a barren woman,

original: shin tu med par gyur pa ni //
analyzed: shin tu med par gyur pa ni //
translated: are utterly nonexistent,

original: yul dus spyi la ltos pa'o //
analyzed: yul dus spyi la ltos pa'o //
translated: in terms of place, time, and universal.

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: This is what is said.

original: ri bong gi rva la sogs pa ni btags pa tsam ste /
analyzed: ri bong gi rva la sogs pa ni btags pa tsam ste /
translated: The horns of a rabbit, etc., are mere designations,

original: phyogs thams cad na gtan @265b med pa'i phyir yul dang dus gang gi yang bye bar gzung mi dgos kyi /
analyzed: phyogs thams cad na gtan @265b med pa'i phyir yul dang dus gang gi yang bye bar gzung mi dgos kyi /
translated: because they are utterly nonexistent in all places. Therefore, they need not be apprehended as the particulars of any place or time.

original: 'on kyang spyi tsam 'dzin pa la ltos pa zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang spyi tsam 'dzin pa la ltos pa zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: However, it is said that they are dependent on the apprehension of a mere universal.

original: de ltar yul dang dus gnyis kyis med pa bzhir 'gyur pas /üîΩyul dang dus kyi dbang gis ni //
analyzed: de ltar yul dang dus gnyis kyis med pa bzhir 'gyur pas / yul dang dus kyi dbang gis ni //
translated: Thus, since there are four types of nonexistence in terms of place and time,üîΩit is said:

original: med pa rnam pa bzhir 'dod do //
analyzed: med pa rnam pa bzhir 'dod do //
translated: Nonexistence is asserted as four types

original: zhes smos so //
analyzed: zhes smos so //
translated: in terms of place and time.

original: da ni gnas skabs kyi dbang du bstan pas dgag pa'i dbye bar 'gyur ba bstan pa la mang du byed pa yang dgos pa ma yin la /
analyzed: da ni gnas skabs kyi dbang du bstan pas dgag pa'i dbye bar 'gyur ba bstan pa la mang du byed pa yang dgos pa ma yin la /
translated: Now, in the presentation from the perspective of occasion, the divisions of negation will be explained. It is not necessary to make many,üîΩand it is difficult to understand a concise summary.

original: nyung du bsdu ba yang rtogs par dka' ba'i phyir //üîΩgnas skabs dag gi dbye ba yis //
analyzed: nyung du bsdu ba yang rtogs par dka' ba'i phyir // gnas skabs dag gi dbye ba yis //
translated: Therefore,üîΩthe meaning of the antidote of nonexistence and non-being

original: med dang ma yin gnyen po'i don //
analyzed: med dang ma yin gnyen po'i don //
translated: is through the divisions of occasions.

original: mi mthun chud sogs bral ba dang // mi 'dra ba dang gzhan pa'o //
analyzed: mi mthun chud sogs bral ba dang // mi 'dra ba dang gzhan pa'o //
translated: The non-concordant, the concordant, the separated, the unseparated, the dissimilar, and the different.

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The non-concordant, the concordant, the separated, the unseparated, the dissimilar, and the different.

original: ji ltar go bar bya ba'i gnas skabs kyis de ltar phye ba yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar go bar bya ba'i gnas skabs kyis de ltar phye ba yin te /
translated: This is the classification in terms of the state of being the basis of understanding.

original: 'di ltar de dag yul dang dus kyi bye brag la mi ltos pa ni ma yin mod kyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag yul dang dus kyi bye brag la mi ltos pa ni ma yin mod kyi /
translated: Indeed, they are not independent of the distinctions of place and time.

original: 'on kyang yul dang dus la ltos pa'i sgo nas ming gi bye brag de dag de ltar gdags par mi nus la /
analyzed: 'on kyang yul dang dus la ltos pa'i sgo nas ming gi bye brag de dag de ltar gdags par mi nus la /
translated: However, it is not possible to designate those specific names in terms of dependence on place and time.

original: yul dang dus mtshungs kyang gnas skabs kyi bye brag gi sgo nas ming de dag thob pa yin te /
analyzed: yul dang dus mtshungs kyang gnas skabs kyi bye brag gi sgo nas ming de dag thob pa yin te /
translated: Even with the same place and time, those names are obtained in terms of the distinction of state.

original: de'i phyir de dag gnas skabs kyi dbye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag gnas skabs kyi dbye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, they are classified in terms of the distinction of state.

original: de la gnas skabs kyi bye brag ji ltar yin pa ni bsdus pa'i bye brag bstan pa'i skabs dpyad zin to //
analyzed: de la gnas skabs kyi bye brag ji ltar yin pa ni bsdus pa'i bye brag bstan pa'i skabs dpyad zin to //
translated: The distinction of state has already been analyzed in the section on the teaching of the distinction of the aggregates.

original: de ltar yul dang dus la gnas skabs kyi dbang gis 'gyur ba de dag gang la gang gi ming ji ltar 'gyur ba bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar yul dang dus la gnas skabs kyi dbang gis 'gyur ba de dag gang la gang gi ming ji ltar 'gyur ba bstan nas /
translated: Having thus shown how those changes occur in terms of state in relation to place and time,

original: de dag gsum gyi dbang la ltos par bstan pa'i phyir 'dir dpe dgod pa /
analyzed: de dag gsum gyi dbang la ltos par bstan pa'i phyir 'dir dpe dgod pa /
translated: In order to demonstrate that the three kinds of non-existence are dependent on the three kinds of existence, an example is given:

original: 'di na sngon nam da ltar dag / bum pa med ces brjod pa gang //üîΩmed pa tsam zhig 'dod pa'am //
analyzed: 'di na sngon nam da ltar dag / bum pa med ces brjod pa gang // med pa tsam zhig 'dod pa'am //
translated: Whatever is said, ‚Äúa pot did not exist here before, nor does one exist here now,‚ÄùüîΩis asserted as mere non-existence,

original: gal te yod pa 'dod kyang rung /
analyzed: gal te yod pa 'dod kyang rung /
translated: or else it is asserted as existence.

original: de ni gsum la ltos pa'o //üîΩzhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de ni gsum la ltos pa'o // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: In either case, it is dependent on the three.

original: de la 'di ni zhes bya ba ni sa phyogs kyi bye brag smra ba po'i nye ba'am /üîΩmngon du bya ba 'di na ste /
analyzed: de la 'di ni zhes bya ba ni sa phyogs kyi bye brag smra ba po'i nye ba'am / mngon du bya ba 'di na ste /
translated: Here, ‚Äúhere‚Äù is the particular place where the speaker is present or is manifest.

original: des ni yul gyi bye brag la ltos par bstan to //
analyzed: des ni yul gyi bye brag la ltos par bstan to //
translated: ‚ÄúHere‚Äù indicates the particular place.

original: sngon nam da ltar dag ces bya ba ni dus kyi bye brag la ltos par ston pa yin te /üîΩ'di ltar sngon sa phyogs 'di na bum pa med ces brjod pa'am /
analyzed: sngon nam da ltar dag ces bya ba ni dus kyi bye brag la ltos par ston pa yin te / 'di ltar sngon sa phyogs 'di na bum pa med ces brjod pa'am /
translated: ‚ÄúBefore‚Äù and ‚Äúnow‚Äù indicate the particular time.

original: da ltar nyid phyogs 'di na bum pa med do zhes brjod na de dus thams cad du ni 'gegs par mi byed la /
analyzed: da ltar nyid phyogs 'di na bum pa med do zhes brjod na de dus thams cad du ni 'gegs par mi byed la /
translated: Thus, when it is said, ‚Äúa pot did not exist here before,‚Äù or ‚Äúa pot does not exist here now,‚Äù this does not negate the pot at all times,

original: yul kun na du yang mi byed de /
analyzed: yul kun na du yang mi byed de /
translated: nor does it negate the pot in all places.

original: 'di ltar smra ba po'i mngon du byas pa dus kyi rgyun gyis bar du chod kyang yid la ma brjed pa dang / da ltar @266a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar smra ba po'i mngon du byas pa dus kyi rgyun gyis bar du chod kyang yid la ma brjed pa dang / da ltar @266a * //
translated: Thus, the object of the present cognition is the same as the object of the past cognition, because the object of the past cognition is not forgotten and because the object of the present cognition is not obstructed.

original: mngon du byas pa la 'gegs par byed pa ni dus kyi bye brag la ltos pa yin no //üîΩyul kyang mngon du byas pa'i yul yin te /
analyzed: mngon du byas pa la 'gegs par byed pa ni dus kyi bye brag la ltos pa yin no // yul kyang mngon du byas pa'i yul yin te /
translated: Obstruction is dependent on a particular time.

original: sgrib pa tsan gyi yul du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sgrib pa tsan gyi yul du ni ma yin no //
translated: The object is the object of the present cognition, not the object of a cognition that is obstructed.

original: gang gi phyir sgrib pa can gyi yul nyid kyang ma rtogs na der dgag pa'i chos lta ga la 'grub /
analyzed: gang gi phyir sgrib pa can gyi yul nyid kyang ma rtogs na der dgag pa'i chos lta ga la 'grub /
translated: If the object of a cognition that is obstructed is not even understood, how much less so the property of negation?

original: de'i phyir yul sgrib pa can ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir yul sgrib pa can ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the object is not obstructed.

original: sgrib pa la rnam pa mang na yang 'dir mdor bsdu na 'di dag ste /
analyzed: sgrib pa la rnam pa mang na yang 'dir mdor bsdu na 'di dag ste /
translated: Although there are many kinds of obstruction, they are summarized here as follows.

original: phra dang bar gyis bskal pa dang // bar du bcad dang ches rags dang // mthun par zil gyis mnan pa dang // cher mi mthun par gyur pa dang // sngags la sogs pas bsgribs pa dang // chos kyis snang bar mi nus dang // dus kyis chod par ma gyur pa //
analyzed: phra dang bar gyis bskal pa dang // bar du bcad dang ches rags dang // mthun par zil gyis mnan pa dang // cher mi mthun par gyur pa dang // sngags la sogs pas bsgribs pa dang // chos kyis snang bar mi nus dang // dus kyis chod par ma gyur pa //
