translated: obscured by mantras, etc.,üîΩnot able to illuminate phenomena,üîΩand not cut off by time.

original: 'di rnams dgag sgrub nus pa'i rgyu //
analyzed: 'di rnams dgag sgrub nus pa'i rgyu //
translated: These are the causes of the ability to negate and affirm.

original: zhes 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ba yin no //
translated: This is what is stated.

original: bum pa med ces brjod pa gang //
analyzed: bum pa med ces brjod pa gang //
translated: What is said as the pot does not exist

original: zhes bya ba ni dgag pa nyid de /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dgag pa nyid de /
translated: is just a negation.

original: de yang bya ba ni bum pa'o //
analyzed: de yang bya ba ni bum pa'o //
translated: Moreover, the action is the pot.

original: byed pa med pa zhes bya'o //üîΩmed pa tsam zhig 'dod pa'am //
analyzed: byed pa med pa zhes bya'o // med pa tsam zhig 'dod pa'am //
translated: The agent is said to be non-existent.üîΩIf one asserts mere non-existence,

original: gal te yod pa 'dod kyang rung //
analyzed: gal te yod pa 'dod kyang rung //
translated: or if one asserts existence,

original: zhes bya ba ni gnas skabs la ltos par bstan pa yin te /üîΩde yang med pa tsam zhig 'dod pa yin na ni med par dgag par 'gyur la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gnas skabs la ltos par bstan pa yin te / de yang med pa tsam zhig 'dod pa yin na ni med par dgag par 'gyur la /
translated: this shows the dependence on the situation.üîΩMoreover, if one asserts mere non-existence, it becomes an external negation.

original: gal te yod pa 'dod na ni ma yin par dgag par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te yod pa 'dod na ni ma yin par dgag par 'gyur te /
translated: If one asserts existence, it becomes an internal negation.

original: 'dod pa'i skabs des ni dgos pa sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i skabs des ni dgos pa sgrub par byed do //
translated: The occasion of desire is what accomplishes the purpose.

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: Similarly,

original: gangs sam me la sogs pa la //
analyzed: gangs sam me la sogs pa la //
translated: with regard to snow, fire, and so on,

original: sngon nam da ltar phyis kyang rung //
analyzed: sngon nam da ltar phyis kyang rung //
translated: whether previously, now, or later,

original: 'di la myu gu mi skye zhes //
analyzed: 'di la myu gu mi skye zhes //
translated: the sprout does not arise.

original: dgag pa yang ni de bzhin no //
analyzed: dgag pa yang ni de bzhin no //
translated: The negation is also like that.

original: zhes smos pa yang sbyar bar bya ste /
analyzed: zhes smos pa yang sbyar bar bya ste /
translated: This is also to be applied.

original: sngon ni dus 'das pa la gsal bar dran pa dang / da ltar mngon du byas pa la dgag pa'i sgra bsgrub par bya ba ston pa yin la /
analyzed: sngon ni dus 'das pa la gsal bar dran pa dang / da ltar mngon du byas pa la dgag pa'i sgra bsgrub par bya ba ston pa yin la /
translated: Whether previously in the past, or now in the present, the sound of negation is shown to establish what is clearly remembered.

original: 'di ni 'das pa'am da ltar ram phyis kyang rung ste /
analyzed: 'di ni 'das pa'am da ltar ram phyis kyang rung ste /
translated: Whether in the past, present, or future,

original: yul nyid mngon du gyur na dus ni khyad par du gzung mi dgos te /
analyzed: yul nyid mngon du gyur na dus ni khyad par du gzung mi dgos te /
translated: when the object itself becomes manifest, time need not be grasped as distinct.

original: gang gzung yang 'di'o zhes ston pa'i sbyor ba yin no //
analyzed: gang gzung yang 'di'o zhes ston pa'i sbyor ba yin no //
translated: Whatever is grasped, it is shown to be this.

original: de'i don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de'i don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows.

original: smra ba po gang gis sngar gangs sam me'i mtshan nyid khong du chud na de'i yul de nye yang rung ring yang rung bsgribs pa dag na 'dug kyang rung ste /
analyzed: smra ba po gang gis sngar gangs sam me'i mtshan nyid khong du chud na de'i yul de nye yang rung ring yang rung bsgribs pa dag na 'dug kyang rung ste /
translated: If the speaker previously understood the characteristics of snow or fire, then whether their object is near or far, or even if they are obscured,

original: dgag pa'i yul du byas nas de la dgag par bya ba myu gu skye ba 'gegs par byed na dus gang bzung yang nges pa med la /
analyzed: dgag pa'i yul du byas nas de la dgag par bya ba myu gu skye ba 'gegs par byed na dus gang bzung yang nges pa med la /
translated: If, having taken the object of negation as the basis, one negates the arising of the sprout, the object of negation, then no matter what time one takes as the basis, there is no certainty.

original: 'on te ma bzung na yang 'og nas 'byung ba'i dgag pa yul la ltos pa nyid du 'gyur @266b ro ;
analyzed: 'on te ma bzung na yang 'og nas 'byung ba'i dgag pa yul la ltos pa nyid du 'gyur @266b ro ;
translated: But if one does not take a basis, then the negation that will occur below will be dependent on an object.

original: / de ni re zhig gsum la ltos pa'i tshul yin no //
analyzed: / de ni re zhig gsum la ltos pa'i tshul yin no //
translated: That is the way of depending on the three, for the time being.

original: da ni gang yang rung ba gnyis gnyis la ltos par ston pa la /
analyzed: da ni gang yang rung ba gnyis gnyis la ltos par ston pa la /
translated: Now, in order to teach the way of depending on any two of the three,

original: re zhig dus dang gnas skabs kyi khyad par 'dzin pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: re zhig dus dang gnas skabs kyi khyad par 'dzin pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: first, in order to teach the apprehension of the distinctions of time and occasion,

original: so ga shing 'bras mi smin ces //
analyzed: so ga shing 'bras mi smin ces //
translated: it is said, ‚ÄúIn spring, the fruit of the tree does not ripen.‚Äù

original: dgag pa dus dang gnas skabs la'o //üîΩzhes smos te /
analyzed: dgag pa dus dang gnas skabs la'o // zhes smos te /
translated: The negation is in terms of time and occasion.

original: so ga zhes bya ba ni dus kyi khyad par yin te /
analyzed: so ga zhes bya ba ni dus kyi khyad par yin te /
translated: Spring is a distinction of time.

original: dus de'i tshe na dgag par bya ba shing gi 'bras bu smon par dgag par byed na gnas skabs med pa'am ma yin pa zhig sgrub par sbyar bas yul gyi bye brag smos mi dgos te /
analyzed: dus de'i tshe na dgag par bya ba shing gi 'bras bu smon par dgag par byed na gnas skabs med pa'am ma yin pa zhig sgrub par sbyar bas yul gyi bye brag smos mi dgos te /
translated: If at that time one negates the ripening of the fruit of the tree, the object of negation, then since one applies the negation to a nonexistent or nonestablished occasion, it is not necessary to specify the particular object.

original: 'di ltar shin tu dro ba'i yul sen ta la sogs pa na yang mi smin na gzhan lta ci smos te dgag mi dgos so //
analyzed: 'di ltar shin tu dro ba'i yul sen ta la sogs pa na yang mi smin na gzhan lta ci smos te dgag mi dgos so //
translated: In this way, if it is not ripe in a very warm place, such as the land of Sendha, what need is there to mention other places? It is unnecessary to refute it.

original: gang gi phyir zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gang du shing rnams 'dab ma 'pho ba'i dus de ni so ga'i sgras brjod pa yin la /
analyzed: gang du shing rnams 'dab ma 'pho ba'i dus de ni so ga'i sgras brjod pa yin la /
translated: The time when trees shed their leaves is called spring.

original: de lta na 'dab ma yang mi rgyas na 'bras bu ga la smin te /
analyzed: de lta na 'dab ma yang mi rgyas na 'bras bu ga la smin te /
translated: If leaves do not grow in that way, how could fruit ripen?

original: yul gyi bye brag smos mi dgos so //
analyzed: yul gyi bye brag smos mi dgos so //
translated: There is no need to mention the distinctions of place.

original: gzhan yang yul dang dus la ltos te gnas skabs kyi bye brag mi 'dzin pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan yang yul dang dus la ltos te gnas skabs kyi bye brag mi 'dzin pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Moreover, to demonstrate that one does not apprehend the distinctions of time and place, it says:

original: 'di na da ltar 'di med ces //
analyzed: 'di na da ltar 'di med ces //
translated: Here, now, this is not.

original: dgag pa yul dang dus la'o //üîΩzhes smos te /
analyzed: dgag pa yul dang dus la'o // zhes smos te /
translated: The negation is in terms of place and time.üîΩHere, in this place, now, at this time, this object of negation does not exist.

original: yul 'di na dus da lta dgag par bya ba 'di med do zhes brjod na de med pa'am ma yin pa ni kho na bsgrub par blos ma phye ste /
analyzed: yul 'di na dus da lta dgag par bya ba 'di med do zhes brjod na de med pa'am ma yin pa ni kho na bsgrub par blos ma phye ste /
translated: When one says that, the mind does not distinguish the nonexistence or non-occurrence of that object.

original: spyi tsam du brjod na yul dang dus kyi bye brag 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: spyi tsam du brjod na yul dang dus kyi bye brag 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
translated: When one says it in a general way, one apprehends the distinctions of place and time.

original: yul dang gnas skabs la ltos pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yul dang gnas skabs la ltos pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the dependence on the object and the occasion, he says:

original: rta la ba lang med ces pa //
analyzed: rta la ba lang med ces pa //
translated: The statement ‚Äúthere is no cow on the horse‚Äù

original: yul dang skabs la ltos pa yin //üîΩzhes smos te /
analyzed: yul dang skabs la ltos pa yin // zhes smos te /
translated: depends on the object and the occasion.

original: yul rta'i ngo bo nyid la dgag par bya ba ba lang gi ngo bo nyid bkag na de ba lang med pa tsam 'dod kyang rung /
analyzed: yul rta'i ngo bo nyid la dgag par bya ba ba lang gi ngo bo nyid bkag na de ba lang med pa tsam 'dod kyang rung /
translated: If the nature of a cow, which is to be refuted, is refuted in the nature of a horse, the object, then it is acceptable to assert that the horse is merely not a cow.

original: rta shes par 'dod kyang rung ste /
analyzed: rta shes par 'dod kyang rung ste /
translated: Or, it is acceptable to assert that the horse is not a cow.

original: dus kyi bye brag smos mi dgos so //
analyzed: dus kyi bye brag smos mi dgos so //
translated: It is not necessary to mention a particular time.

original: gang gi phyir dus thams cad du rta la ba lang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir dus thams cad du rta la ba lang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the cow does not exist on the horse at all times.

original: da ni de dag re re'i dbang la ltos pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni de dag re re'i dbang la ltos pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate the dependence on each of those powers, he says:

original: gangs la myu gu skye med ces //
analyzed: gangs la myu gu skye med ces //
translated: The statement ‚Äúthere is no sprout on the snow‚Äù

original: dgag pa yul la ltos pa'o //üîΩzhes smos te /
analyzed: dgag pa yul la ltos pa'o // zhes smos te /
translated: is a negation that depends on the object.

original: 'di ltar gangs ni myu gu'i tshogs pa dang ji srid pa de srid du mi ldan te /
analyzed: 'di ltar gangs ni myu gu'i tshogs pa dang ji srid pa de srid du mi ldan te /
translated: Thus, snow is not endowed with a collection of sprouts for as long as it exists.

original: de'i phyir yul khyad par du byas te /
analyzed: de'i phyir yul khyad par du byas te /
translated: Therefore, the object is specified.

original: gnas skabs snga ma bzhin du sbyar na dus kyi bye brag rang bzhin gyis gzung mi dgos pa'i phyir de yul gcig pu la ltos pa zhes bya bar brjod du rung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnas skabs snga ma bzhin du sbyar na dus kyi bye brag rang bzhin gyis gzung mi dgos pa'i phyir de yul gcig pu la ltos pa zhes bya bar brjod du rung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is applied as before, then the specific time does not need to be grasped inherently, and it is suitable to say that it depends on a single place.üîΩNow, wishing to teach that it depends on a specific time,

original: da ni dus kyi bye brag la ltos pa bstan par 'dod nas //
analyzed: da ni dus kyi bye brag la ltos pa bstan par 'dod nas //
translated: he says,

original: lhas byin shi nas med ces pa //
analyzed: lhas byin shi nas med ces pa //
translated: ‚ÄúDevadatta is dead and does not exist‚Äù

original: @267a * // dgag pa dus la ltos pa'o //üîΩzhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: @267a * // dgag pa dus la ltos pa'o // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: is a negation that depends on time.

original: 'di ltar lha sbyin shi ba la bsams te lha sbyin med do zhes bstan na de phan chad yul dbus na lha sbyin gyi ngo bo med cing skyes bu'i bya ba mi byed na shi ba'i phyir yul gzhan na yang ngo bo med cing bya ba mi byed
analyzed: 'di ltar lha sbyin shi ba la bsams te lha sbyin med do zhes bstan na de phan chad yul dbus na lha sbyin gyi ngo bo med cing skyes bu'i bya ba mi byed na shi ba'i phyir yul gzhan na yang ngo bo med cing bya ba mi byed
translated: Thus, if it is taught that ‚ÄúDevadatta is dead and does not exist‚Äù thinking of Devadatta‚Äôs death, then after that time, the nature of Devadatta does not exist in the place of Magadha and he does not perform the actions of a person.üîΩSince he is dead, his nature does not exist in other places and he does not perform actions.

original: de / de'i phyir yul gyi khyad par ni gzung mi dgos la /
analyzed: de / de'i phyir yul gyi khyad par ni gzung mi dgos la /
translated: Therefore, it is not necessary to grasp the distinction of place,

original: shi nas gdod med pa'i phyir dus kyi khyad par ni gzung dgos pa nyid do //
analyzed: shi nas gdod med pa'i phyir dus kyi khyad par ni gzung dgos pa nyid do //
translated: but it is necessary to grasp the distinction of time because he does not exist after his death.

original: 'dir yang gnas skabs ni snga ma bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang gnas skabs ni snga ma bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: Here, the occasion should be understood as before.

original: da ni yul dang dus dang gnas skabs gsum po de dag re re 'am /üîΩgnyis gnyis la yang ltos par bstan pa de de dag kha nas yin te /üîΩgzhan dag gzhi mi dgos par rtogs par dgos nas de dag khyad par gang gtso bo khyad par du byed cing gzhan spyir byed pa la bsam pa'i don gyi dbang bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni yul dang dus dang gnas skabs gsum po de dag re re 'am / gnyis gnyis la yang ltos par bstan pa de de dag kha nas yin te / gzhan dag gzhi mi dgos par rtogs par dgos nas de dag khyad par gang gtso bo khyad par du byed cing gzhan spyir byed pa la bsam pa'i don gyi dbang bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate that each of those three‚Äîobject, time, and occasion‚Äî

original: re re'am gnyis gnyis ltos ston pa //üîΩkhyad par mi 'dzin dbang du'o //
analyzed: re re'am gnyis gnyis ltos ston pa // khyad par mi 'dzin dbang du'o //
translated: and also each pair depend on the other two,

original: zhes smos pa yin te /üîΩgang spyir byed pa de ni 'dir khyad par du mi 'dzin pa dang 'dra ste gzung zhing smos mi dgos so //
analyzed: zhes smos pa yin te / gang spyir byed pa de ni 'dir khyad par du mi 'dzin pa dang 'dra ste gzung zhing smos mi dgos so //
translated: he says, ‚ÄúThe other is not held to be a qualifier, but is held to be a general term.‚ÄùüîΩThe other is not held to be a qualifier, but is held to be a general term.üîΩThe other is not held to be a qualifier, but is held to be a general term.

original: de'i phyir / re re'am gnyis gnyis la ltos pa //üîΩzhes ston pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir / re re'am gnyis gnyis la ltos pa // zhes ston pa yin no //
translated: The other is not held to be a qualifier, but is held to be a general term.üîΩThe other is not held to be a qualifier, but is held to be a general term.üîΩThe other is not held to be a qualifier, but is held to be a general term.üîΩThe other is not held to be a qualifier, but is held to be a general term.üîΩThe other is not held to be a qualifier, but is held to be a general term.üîΩThe other is not held to be a qualifier, but is held to be a general term.üîΩThe other is not held to be a qualifier, but is held to be a general term.üîΩThe other is not held to be a qualifier, but is held to be a general term.üîΩThe other is not held to be a qualifier, but is held to be a general term.üîΩThe other is not held to be a qualifier, but is held to be a general term.üîΩThe other is not held to be a qualifier, but is held to be a general term.üîΩThe other is not held to be a qualifier, but is held to be a general term.üîΩThe other is not held to be a qualifier, but is held to be a general term.üîΩThe other is not held to be a qualifier, but is held to be a general term.üîΩThe other is not held to be a qualifier, but is held to be a general term.üîΩThe other is not held to be a qualifier, but is held to be a general term.üîΩThe other is not held to be a qualifier, but is held to be a general term.

original: de la gnas skabs ni khyad par nyid yin na spyi gang zhig yin zhes rtog pa bsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la gnas skabs ni khyad par nyid yin na spyi gang zhig yin zhes rtog pa bsal ba'i phyir /
translated: The other is not held to be a qualifier, but is held to be a general term.

original: skabs ni kun du'ang khyad par te //
analyzed: skabs ni kun du'ang khyad par te //
translated: The context is always distinguished.

original: skabs tsam spyi yi cha yin no //
analyzed: skabs tsam spyi yi cha yin no //
translated: The context is merely a general category.

original: zhes smos te /üîΩgang med pa'am /
analyzed: zhes smos te / gang med pa'am /
translated: This is what is said.üîΩThere is nothing that does not show nonexistence or

original: ma yin par ston par mi byed pa ni med do /
analyzed: ma yin par ston par mi byed pa ni med do /
translated: non-reality.

original: de'i phyir kun du yang khyad par yin mod kyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir kun du yang khyad par yin mod kyi /
translated: Therefore, it is indeed always distinguished.

original: gnyi ga yang dgag par bya ba dgag pa'i skabs tsam du 'dra ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gnyi ga yang dgag par bya ba dgag pa'i skabs tsam du 'dra ba'i phyir /
translated: However, both are similar in merely being the context of the negation of the negatee.

original: 'dod pa bye brag ma phyed pa'i spyi'i skabs la spyi'i don du gzung ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'dod pa bye brag ma phyed pa'i spyi'i skabs la spyi'i don du gzung ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, the general meaning is taken to be the general context without distinguishing the specific meaning. This is the meaning.

original: da ni de ltar bye brag 'dzin pa dang mi 'dzin pas de dag la ltos pa dang mi ltos pa bshad pa la /üîΩgang dag bsgrub par bya ba'i dgos par 'grub par 'dod pa la re re 'am /
analyzed: da ni de ltar bye brag 'dzin pa dang mi 'dzin pas de dag la ltos pa dang mi ltos pa bshad pa la / gang dag bsgrub par bya ba'i dgos par 'grub par 'dod pa la re re 'am /
translated: Now, in explaining the dependence and non-dependence on those in terms of grasping and not grasping distinctions,

original: gnyis gnyis kyis 'grub bam //
analyzed: gnyis gnyis kyis 'grub bam //
translated: it is necessary to know whether the purpose to be accomplished is accomplished by each or by both,üîΩor whether it is necessary to know the complete set.

original: 'on te tshang bar shes dgos snyam du rtog par dogs pa bsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'on te tshang bar shes dgos snyam du rtog par dogs pa bsal ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to dispel doubts about this, it is said:

original: dgos pa 'grub pa'i dbang du ni //
analyzed: dgos pa 'grub pa'i dbang du ni //
translated: In terms of accomplishing the purpose,

original: gsum nyid la ni ltos pa yin //
analyzed: gsum nyid la ni ltos pa yin //
translated: it depends on just three.

original: zhes smos te /
analyzed: zhes smos te /
translated: This is what is said.

original: dgos pa ni smra ba po'i 'dong ba'i don yin no //
analyzed: dgos pa ni smra ba po'i 'dong ba'i don yin no //
translated: The purpose is the meaning that the speaker intends.

original: de 'grub pa ni dgos pa 'grub pa yin te /
analyzed: de 'grub pa ni dgos pa 'grub pa yin te /
translated: The accomplishment of that is the accomplishment of the purpose.

original: gal te dgos pa 'grub par bya ba tha na ri bong gi rva dgag par bya na yul thams cad du med par @267b shes dogs la /
analyzed: gal te dgos pa 'grub par bya ba tha na ri bong gi rva dgag par bya na yul thams cad du med par @267b shes dogs la /
translated: If the purpose is to accomplish the negation of rabbit horns, then it is feared that one will know that it does not exist in all places.

original: gnas skabs kyang med pa'i ngo bor shes par 'dod pa shes dogs te /
analyzed: gnas skabs kyang med pa'i ngo bor shes par 'dod pa shes dogs te /
translated: And it is feared that one will know that it does not exist in terms of its nature.

original: yul dang dus khyad par du byed pa dang / ma yin par dgag pa la tshang bar dgos pa smos ci dgos te /
analyzed: yul dang dus khyad par du byed pa dang / ma yin par dgag pa la tshang bar dgos pa smos ci dgos te /
translated: What need is there to mention the purpose of specifying the place, time, and occasion in a nonaffirming negation?

original: thams cad du ltos dogs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: thams cad du ltos dogs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is feared that everything will be doubted.

original: da ni yul dang dus dang gnas skabs gsum dpe de dag bye brag mang bas gang gi dbang du byas pa mi rtogs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni yul dang dus dang gnas skabs gsum dpe de dag bye brag mang bas gang gi dbang du byas pa mi rtogs pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, since there are many examples of the three‚Äîplace, time, and occasion‚Äîit is not understood in terms of which one is being considered.üîΩTherefore, in order to make that understood, it is said:

original: yul ni dgag bya'i gzhi yin te //
analyzed: yul ni dgag bya'i gzhi yin te //
translated: The place is the basis of the object of negation.

original: dus gsum da lta'i dbang gis yin //
analyzed: dus gsum da lta'i dbang gis yin //
translated: It is due to the power of the present of the three times.

original: gnas skabs go bar bya ba'i dbang //üîΩzhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: gnas skabs go bar bya ba'i dbang //üîΩzhes bya ba smos so //
translated: The occasion is due to the power of what is to be understood.

original: de la dgag pa'i yul yin par 'dra yang tha snyad kyi yul gyi sgo nas dbye ba mang du yod pas 'dir ni dgag pa nyid kyi yul gzung ngo //
analyzed: de la dgag pa'i yul yin par 'dra yang tha snyad kyi yul gyi sgo nas dbye ba mang du yod pas 'dir ni dgag pa nyid kyi yul gzung ngo //
translated: Although they are similar in being the object of negation, there are many divisions of the object of convention, and here the object of negation itself is taken.

original: de bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that, he says,

original: dgag bya'i gzhi zhes smos te /
analyzed: dgag bya'i gzhi zhes smos te /
translated: the basis of the object of negation.

original: 'di ltar bum pa med ces dgag pa ni dgag par bya ba bum pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar bum pa med ces dgag pa ni dgag par bya ba bum pa yin te /
translated: Thus, the negation ‚Äúthe pot does not exist‚Äù has as its object of negation the pot,

original: bum pa med pa gang la yod pa de bzhi yin no //
analyzed: bum pa med pa gang la yod pa de bzhi yin no //
translated: and that is the basis of the nonexistence of the pot.

original: bram ze la rgyal rigs dgag na rgyal rigs ma yin pa yod na bram ze yin no //
analyzed: bram ze la rgyal rigs dgag na rgyal rigs ma yin pa yod na bram ze yin no //
translated: If the Brahmin is negated as being of the warrior class, then if the Brahmin is not of the warrior class, he is of the Brahmin class.

original: 'di ni med pa'i yul yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni med pa'i yul yin te /
translated: This is the object of nonexistence,

original: med pa'i tha snyad kyi yul ni ma yin pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: med pa'i tha snyad kyi yul ni ma yin pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: and the object of the convention of nonexistence is not existent, that is the meaning.

original: dus gsum da ltar gyi dbang gis yin te /
analyzed: dus gsum da ltar gyi dbang gis yin te /
translated: It is by the power of the three times.

original: de yang 'di ltar 'das pa'i dus can rnams rgyu yang spyad zin la 'bras bu yang spyad zin pa yin te /
analyzed: de yang 'di ltar 'das pa'i dus can rnams rgyu yang spyad zin la 'bras bu yang spyad zin pa yin te /
translated: Moreover, those of the past time have already used the cause and have already used the effect.

original: de'i dbang gis dbyer ni mi rung ste /
analyzed: de'i dbang gis dbyer ni mi rung ste /
translated: By the power of that, it is not suitable to divide them.

original: sngar da ltar gyi ngo bor gnas la phyis ni med pa yin pa'i phyir des gzhag par mi nus so //
analyzed: sngar da ltar gyi ngo bor gnas la phyis ni med pa yin pa'i phyir des gzhag par mi nus so //
translated: Because it previously existed in the present, but later it does not exist, it cannot be posited by that.

original: ma 'ongs pas kyang mi nus te /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pas kyang mi nus te /
translated: It also cannot be posited by the future,

original: rgyu 'bras gnyis ka ma spyad pa yin pas phyis tsam na ni da ltar gyi ngo bor gyur pa sngar ni med do //
analyzed: rgyu 'bras gnyis ka ma spyad pa yin pas phyis tsam na ni da ltar gyi ngo bor gyur pa sngar ni med do //
translated: because both cause and effect are not yet engaged. Later, it becomes the present, but it did not exist previously.

original: de'i phyir des kyang mi nus so //
analyzed: de'i phyir des kyang mi nus so //
translated: Therefore it also cannot be posited by that.

original: da ltar gyi dus can rnams rgyu ni spyad zin la /
analyzed: da ltar gyi dus can rnams rgyu ni spyad zin la /
translated: Those that exist in the present have already engaged their cause,

original: 'bras bu ni ma spyad de /
analyzed: 'bras bu ni ma spyad de /
translated: but they have not yet engaged their effect.

original: da ltar ba'i ngo bor yod la /
analyzed: da ltar ba'i ngo bor yod la /
translated: They exist in the present.

original: dus de nyid de ltar du brjod du yod do //
analyzed: dus de nyid de ltar du brjod du yod do //
translated: That time is said to be like that.

original: des gzhag na ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs ba yang gdags su rung ngo //
analyzed: des gzhag na ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs ba yang gdags su rung ngo //
translated: If it is posited by that, then the past and future can also be imputed.

original: de la 'di skad du da lta la stos nas 'das la gzhag pa na 'das pa las kyang da lta ltos su rung ngo zhe na /
analyzed: de la 'di skad du da lta la stos nas 'das la gzhag pa na 'das pa las kyang da lta ltos su rung ngo zhe na /
translated: In that regard, if it is said, ‚ÄúThe past is posited in dependence on the present, then the present can also be posited in dependence on the past,‚Äù

original: 'di lta ste yod pa dang med pa yang dang por yod pa la ltos nas med pa 'grub ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste yod pa dang med pa yang dang por yod pa la ltos nas med pa 'grub ste /
translated: it is like this: First, nonexistence is established in dependence on existence.

original: med pa yod pa'i gzhi la ltos pa yin pa de bzhin du med pa ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: med pa yod pa'i gzhi la ltos pa yin pa de bzhin du med pa ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: Nonexistence is not like that.

original: 'di ltar yod pa mngon sum du gyur pa mngon du byas pa'i @268a * //üîΩrjes su dpag nas med pa 'grub par byed de /
analyzed: 'di ltar yod pa mngon sum du gyur pa mngon du byas pa'i @268a * // rjes su dpag nas med pa 'grub par byed de /
translated: Nonexistence is established by inference, following the perception of existence.

original: med pa de yang yod pa'i dngos po de med ces yod pas 'jog go //
analyzed: med pa de yang yod pa'i dngos po de med ces yod pas 'jog go //
translated: Nonexistence is posited by existence, since it is said that nonexistence is the nonexistence of that existent thing.

original: med pa ni lung de dag las brjod kyi shes pa gang gis kyang mngon sum du ma byas pa ste /
analyzed: med pa ni lung de dag las brjod kyi shes pa gang gis kyang mngon sum du ma byas pa ste /
translated: Nonexistence is not directly perceived by any consciousness.

original: med pa nyid kyang ma rtogs na des yod pa ltag la grub /
analyzed: med pa nyid kyang ma rtogs na des yod pa ltag la grub /
translated: If nonexistence is not realized, then existence is not established.

original: de'i phyir yod pa dang med pa phan tshun ltos par bshad pa ni yod pas bzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir yod pa dang med pa phan tshun ltos par bshad pa ni yod pas bzhag pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the explanation that existence and nonexistence are mutually dependent is posited by existence.

original: sngar ma byung ba las byung ba dag kyang nam byung ba'i dngos po mngon du byas pa na de sngar ma byung ba zhes gdod 'jog par byed do //
analyzed: sngar ma byung ba las byung ba dag kyang nam byung ba'i dngos po mngon du byas pa na de sngar ma byung ba zhes gdod 'jog par byed do //
translated: Things that did not occur in the past are posited as not having occurred in the past when the thing that has occurred is perceived.

original: de bzhin du dus kyang 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa ni btags pa tsam ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du dus kyang 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa ni btags pa tsam ste /
translated: Similarly, the past and future are mere designations.

original: med pa nyid yin la med pas gzhag tu mi nus so //
analyzed: med pa nyid yin la med pas gzhag tu mi nus so //
translated: But if it does not exist, it cannot be posited.

original: da ltar gyi dngos po ni yod pa yin la mngon du yang byas so //
analyzed: da ltar gyi dngos po ni yod pa yin la mngon du yang byas so //
translated: The present thing exists and is manifest.

original: des gzhag na ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa 'grub po /
analyzed: des gzhag na ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa 'grub po /
translated: If it is posited, then the past and future are established.

original: de'i phyir dus gsum ni da ltar gyi dbang gis gzhag pa yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir dus gsum ni da ltar gyi dbang gis gzhag pa yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it should be understood that the three times are posited by the present.

original: gnas skabs kyang go bar bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: gnas skabs kyang go bar bya ba'i don te /
translated: The term ‚Äúoccasion‚Äù also has the meaning of that which is to be understood.

original: dgos pa'i dbang de nyid la 'dir gnas skabs zhes bya ste /
analyzed: dgos pa'i dbang de nyid la 'dir gnas skabs zhes bya ste /
translated: In this context, ‚Äúoccasion‚Äù refers to the power of the need.

original: spyir ni dus nyid skabs yin no //
analyzed: spyir ni dus nyid skabs yin no //
translated: In general, ‚Äútime‚Äù itself is an occasion.

original: 'on kyang 'dir dus ni dngos po'i dus yin la /
analyzed: 'on kyang 'dir dus ni dngos po'i dus yin la /
translated: However, here ‚Äútime‚Äù is the time of the thing,

original: gnas skabs ni smra ba po'i 'dod pa'i don gyi gnas skabs yin no //
analyzed: gnas skabs ni smra ba po'i 'dod pa'i don gyi gnas skabs yin no //
translated: and ‚Äúoccasion‚Äù is the occasion of the object that is the speaker‚Äôs intended meaning.

original: da ni dgag pa go bar byed pa'i sgra dang shes pa'i yul med pa bzhi yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni dgag pa go bar byed pa'i sgra dang shes pa'i yul med pa bzhi yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to show that the four non-existents are the objects of the words and consciousnesses that understand the negation, he says:

original: dgag pa go bar byed pa yi //
analyzed: dgag pa go bar byed pa yi //
translated: The objects of that which understands the negation

original: yul ni med pa bzhi yin te //üîΩsnga na med dang zhig nas med //
analyzed: yul ni med pa bzhi yin te // snga na med dang zhig nas med //
translated: are the four non-existents.üîΩPrior non-existence, post-disintegration non-existence,

original: gcig la gcig med shin tu med //
analyzed: gcig la gcig med shin tu med //
translated: mutual non-existence, and complete non-existence.

original: ces smos te /
analyzed: ces smos te /
translated: This is what is meant by the above verse.

original: dgag pa thams cad kyang med par sgrub pa yin la /
analyzed: dgag pa thams cad kyang med par sgrub pa yin la /
translated: All negations are proofs of non-existence.

original: dngos po tha dad pa'i med pa thams cad kyang bzhi po de dag tu 'dus te /
analyzed: dngos po tha dad pa'i med pa thams cad kyang bzhi po de dag tu 'dus te /
translated: And all non-existences of different things are included in those four.

original: de'i phyir dgag pa sgrub par byed pa'i sgra dang shes pa thams cad kyi dngos su bsgrub par bya ba med pa yin na med pa bzhi po dag dgag pa go bar byed pa'i yul yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir dgag pa sgrub par byed pa'i sgra dang shes pa thams cad kyi dngos su bsgrub par bya ba med pa yin na med pa bzhi po dag dgag pa go bar byed pa'i yul yin no //
translated: Therefore, if the non-existence that is the explicit object of proof of all words and consciousnesses that prove a negation, then the four non-existences are the objects that cause understanding of negation.

original: de ltar go bar byed pa'i yul bsnyad nas /
analyzed: de ltar go bar byed pa'i yul bsnyad nas /
translated: Having thus explained the objects that cause understanding,

original: go bar byed pa'i gnas skabs bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: go bar byed pa'i gnas skabs bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: in order to teach the occasion of the cause of understanding, he says:

original: go byed skabs ni gnyis yin te //
analyzed: go byed skabs ni gnyis yin te //
translated: The occasion of the cause of understanding is twofold:

original: che long dang ni rgyas par ro //üîΩzhes smos te /
analyzed: che long dang ni rgyas par ro // zhes smos te /
translated: The coarse and the extensive.

original: de la che long ni bye brag rgyas par ma phye ba ste /
analyzed: de la che long ni bye brag rgyas par ma phye ba ste /
translated: Therein, the coarse is the non-detailed extensive,

original: phyogs tsam mthong bar bya ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: phyogs tsam mthong bar bya ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: the meaning of which is ‚Äúseeing a mere portion.‚Äù

original: rgyas pa ni thams cad mthong @268b bar byed pa zhes bya ba'i don yin te /
analyzed: rgyas pa ni thams cad mthong @268b bar byed pa zhes bya ba'i don yin te /
translated: The extensive is the meaning of ‚Äúseeing everything.‚Äù

original: de dag bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de dag bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach those, he says:

original: che long gi dbang la brtsams nas med pa rnam pa bzhi la phye ba ni /
analyzed: che long gi dbang la brtsams nas med pa rnam pa bzhi la phye ba ni /
translated: The first is the non-existence of disintegration, the second is the non-existence of non-acquisition,üîΩthe third is the non-existence of mutual exclusion,üîΩand the fourth is the non-existence of negation.

original: zhig nas med dang shin tu med //
analyzed: zhig nas med dang shin tu med //
translated: The first is the non-existence of disintegration, the second is the non-existence of non-acquisition,üîΩthe third is the non-existence of mutual exclusion,

original: med par dgag pa zhes 'dod do //
analyzed: med par dgag pa zhes 'dod do //
translated: and the fourth is the non-existence of negation.üîΩThe first is the non-existence of disintegration, the second is the non-existence of non-acquisition,üîΩthe third is the non-existence of mutual exclusion,

original: lhag ma ma yin dgag par ni //üîΩche long dbang gis 'dod pa ste //
analyzed: lhag ma ma yin dgag par ni // che long dbang gis 'dod pa ste //
translated: and the fourth is the non-existence of negation.üîΩThe first is the non-existence of disintegration, the second is the non-existence of non-acquisition,üîΩthe third is the non-existence of mutual exclusion,

original: yul na med dang yod pa yi //
analyzed: yul na med dang yod pa yi //
translated: and the fourth is the non-existence of negation.üîΩThe first is the non-existence of disintegration, the second is the non-existence of non-acquisition,

original: dbang tsam dag tu 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: dbang tsam dag tu 'dod pa'o //
translated: the third is the non-existence of mutual exclusion,

original: zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: and the fourth is the non-existence of negation.

original: 'di ltar bum pa zhig ste med pa yang yul gang na yang bum pa'i ngo bo med de med pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar bum pa zhig ste med pa yang yul gang na yang bum pa'i ngo bo med de med pa nyid yin la /
translated: The first is the non-existence of disintegration, the second is the non-existence of non-acquisition,

original: ri bong gi rva la sogs pa yang yul gang na yang med de /üîΩde'i phyir de gnyis ni med par dgag par bsdu'o //
analyzed: ri bong gi rva la sogs pa yang yul gang na yang med de / de'i phyir de gnyis ni med par dgag par bsdu'o //
translated: the third is the non-existence of mutual exclusion,üîΩand the fourth is the non-existence of negation.üîΩThe first is the non-existence of disintegration, the second is the non-existence of non-acquisition,üîΩthe third is the non-existence of mutual exclusion,üîΩand the fourth is the non-existence of negation.

original: lhag ma ni snga na med pa dang / gcig la gcig med pa yin te /üîΩsnga na med pa yang da ltar gyi ngo bor yod de /
analyzed: lhag ma ni snga na med pa dang / gcig la gcig med pa yin te / snga na med pa yang da ltar gyi ngo bor yod de /
translated: The first is the non-existence of disintegration, the second is the non-existence of non-acquisition,üîΩthe third is the non-existence of mutual exclusion,üîΩand the fourth is the non-existence of negation.üîΩThe first is the non-existence of disintegration, the second is the non-existence of non-acquisition,üîΩthe third is the non-existence of mutual exclusion,

original: snga na med pa'i bum pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: snga na med pa'i bum pa lta bu'o //
translated: and the fourth is the non-existence of negation.üîΩThe first is the non-existence of disintegration, the second is the non-existence of non-acquisition,üîΩthe third is the non-existence of mutual exclusion,

original: gcig la gcig med pa yang rta ni rta'i rang bzhin du yod la /
analyzed: gcig la gcig med pa yang rta ni rta'i rang bzhin du yod la /
translated: and the fourth is the non-existence of negation.

original: ba lang ba lang gi rang bzhin du yod de /
analyzed: ba lang ba lang gi rang bzhin du yod de /
translated: The cow exists as the nature of cow.

original: 'di gnyi ga yang da ltar yul na yod pa yin pas ma yin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di gnyi ga yang da ltar yul na yod pa yin pas ma yin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Both of these exist in the present in the field, and so are said to be not nonexistent.

original: 'on kyang de dag gi phyogs tsam yin te med pa nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang de dag gi phyogs tsam yin te med pa nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: But they are only partially existent, not completely existent.

original: snga ma gnyis ni med pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: snga ma gnyis ni med pa nyid yin no //
translated: The first two are completely nonexistent.

original: gal te med pa nyid yin na phyogs tsam mthong ba zhes gang gi phyir bya zhe na /
analyzed: gal te med pa nyid yin na phyogs tsam mthong ba zhes gang gi phyir bya zhe na /
translated: If they are completely nonexistent, why is it said that one sees only a part of them?

original: de ni 'di ltar med pa gzhi med pa nyid du mthun pa yang yin la /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar med pa gzhi med pa nyid du mthun pa yang yin la /
translated: It is because the nonexistent is similar to the nonexistent basis.

original: rten brjod na kun kyang yin pa las sgra brjod pa na snga ma gnyis ni mi snang ba'i dus nyid na brjod la gzhan ni snang ba de nyid la rjod par byed de /
analyzed: rten brjod na kun kyang yin pa las sgra brjod pa na snga ma gnyis ni mi snang ba'i dus nyid na brjod la gzhan ni snang ba de nyid la rjod par byed de /
translated: When the basis is mentioned, all three are mentioned. But when the word is uttered, the first two are mentioned at the time of nonappearance, and the other is mentioned at the time of appearance.

original: de'i dus na yul na snang ba dang mi snang ba'i dbang tsam mthong bar byed pa ni phyogs yin no //
analyzed: de'i dus na yul na snang ba dang mi snang ba'i dbang tsam mthong bar byed pa ni phyogs yin no //
translated: At that time, one sees only a part, that is, the mere appearance or nonappearance of the object in the field.

original: rgyas par na ni de bzhi char yang med pa kho na yin pa'i phyir med par dgag pa'i dbye ba yin la /
analyzed: rgyas par na ni de bzhi char yang med pa kho na yin pa'i phyir med par dgag pa'i dbye ba yin la /
translated: If it is extensive, it is a division of non-affirming negation because all four of those do not exist at all.

original: de las brgyud nas gzhan ston pa yang yin pas ma yin par dgag pa yang yin no //
analyzed: de las brgyud nas gzhan ston pa yang yin pas ma yin par dgag pa yang yin no //
translated: And since it also indirectly teaches other [types of negation], it is also an affirming negation.

original: de yang yul na yod pa ste /
analyzed: de yang yul na yod pa ste /
translated: Moreover, it exists as an object.

original: rang gi ngo bo ni der sgrub par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo ni der sgrub par byed pa yin no //
translated: Its own nature is established as that.

original: rgyas par bstan pa nyid brjod par 'dod nas /
analyzed: rgyas par bstan pa nyid brjod par 'dod nas /
translated: Desiring to explain the extensive teaching, [the root text] states:

original: med pa bzhi nyed mi shes pa 'am //
analyzed: med pa bzhi nyed mi shes pa 'am //
translated: The four non-existences are not known,

original: gal te yod sogs 'dod pa la //
analyzed: gal te yod sogs 'dod pa la //
translated: Or if existence and so forth are asserted,

original: med pa tsam zhig sgrub pa na //
analyzed: med pa tsam zhig sgrub pa na //
translated: When mere non-existence is established,

original: med par dgag pa bzhir 'dod do //
analyzed: med par dgag pa bzhir 'dod do //
translated: The four non-affirming negations are asserted.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan to //
translated: And so on.

original: de la 'dir ni med par dgag pa'i bye brag dbye ba yin te /
analyzed: de la 'dir ni med par dgag pa'i bye brag dbye ba yin te /
translated: Here, it is a division of the particular types of non-affirming negations.

original: ji skad smos pa'i med pa bzhi'i rang gi ngo bo @269a * //
analyzed: ji skad smos pa'i med pa bzhi'i rang gi ngo bo @269a * //
translated: The nature of the four non-existences mentioned

original: mi shes pa 'am /
analyzed: mi shes pa 'am /
translated: is not known,

original: yod dam med the tshom za ba dang / 'di ltar yod par rtogs pa yod de //
analyzed: yod dam med the tshom za ba dang / 'di ltar yod par rtogs pa yod de //
translated: Or there is doubt about existence or non-existence, and there is the realization that it exists in this way.

original: snga na med pa la ni kha cig bum pa la mi rtag pa nyid snga nas yod de /
analyzed: snga na med pa la ni kha cig bum pa la mi rtag pa nyid snga nas yod de /
translated: Some say: Impermanence exists prior to the pot.

original: nam tho ba lta bu dang phrad nas bsal bar byas par zad de /
analyzed: nam tho ba lta bu dang phrad nas bsal bar byas par zad de /
translated: When it meets with a hammer, for example, it is simply eliminated.

original: de bzhin du 'bras bu thams cad kyang 'bras bu'i bya ba mi byed pa tsam du zad de /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'bras bu thams cad kyang 'bras bu'i bya ba mi byed pa tsam du zad de /
translated: So too, all effects simply do not perform the action of an effect.üîΩAt the time of the cause, the entity of the effect exists.

original: rgyu'i dus na 'bras bu'i ngo bor yod do zhes pa dang / zhig nas med pa la yang rgyun ni rgyu'i ngo bor dus thams cad du yod de /
analyzed: rgyu'i dus na 'bras bu'i ngo bor yod do zhes pa dang / zhig nas med pa la yang rgyun ni rgyu'i ngo bor dus thams cad du yod de /
translated: Some say: After disintegration, it does not exist. The continuum exists as the entity of the cause at all times.

original: 'jim pa'i gong bu ni bum pa la yod do //
analyzed: 'jim pa'i gong bu ni bum pa la yod do //
translated: A lump of clay exists in a pot.

original: rgyu'i rang bzhin mi 'dor ro //
analyzed: rgyu'i rang bzhin mi 'dor ro //
translated: The nature of the cause is not discarded.

original: zhes brjod pa dang / gcig la gcig med pa dag la yang rta la yang ba lang gi rang bzhin yod de /
analyzed: zhes brjod pa dang / gcig la gcig med pa dag la yang rta la yang ba lang gi rang bzhin yod de /
translated: Some say: Even though one does not exist in the other, the nature of an ox exists in a horse.

original: ba lang gi spyi ni yul thams cad na gnas so zhes dngos po thams cad kyi thams cad la thams cad kyis khyab par 'dod pa dang / shin tu med pa dag la yang ri bong gi rva ni rkyen med pa'i phyir sra ba dang rno ba'i bya ba byed par mi snang ba tsam las ma gtogs pa'i rva'i rang bzhin med pa ma yin te /üîΩdmigs su yod pa ni yod pa nyid yin no zhes log par rtog pa dag la med pa tsam zhig go bar byed na med par dgag pa'i dbye bar 'dod pa rnam pa bzhi yin no //
analyzed: ba lang gi spyi ni yul thams cad na gnas so zhes dngos po thams cad kyi thams cad la thams cad kyis khyab par 'dod pa dang / shin tu med pa dag la yang ri bong gi rva ni rkyen med pa'i phyir sra ba dang rno ba'i bya ba byed par mi snang ba tsam las ma gtogs pa'i rva'i rang bzhin med pa ma yin te / dmigs su yod pa ni yod pa nyid yin no zhes log par rtog pa dag la med pa tsam zhig go bar byed na med par dgag pa'i dbye bar 'dod pa rnam pa bzhi yin no //
translated: The universal of cow is present in all objects.

original: gal te med pa bzhi po de nyid yul du byas pa las brgyud de /üîΩdon zhig ston na ni ma yin par dgag par 'gyur bar bstan te /üîΩde'i phyir / gal te ri bong rva med pas //üîΩdngos med de nyid sgrub byed na //üîΩma yin dgag par 'dod pa ste //
analyzed: gal te med pa bzhi po de nyid yul du byas pa las brgyud de /üîΩdon zhig ston na ni ma yin par dgag par 'gyur bar bstan te /üîΩde'i phyir / gal te ri bong rva med pas //üîΩdngos med de nyid sgrub byed na //üîΩma yin dgag par 'dod pa ste //
translated: The non-existent is only the mere non-appearance of the function of hardness and sharpness of the rabbit‚Äôs horns, apart from the mere non-appearance of the function of hardness and apart from the mere non-appearance of the function of hardness and sharpness

original: tshig gcig rnam par sgrub pa'o //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: tshig gcig rnam par sgrub pa'o // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: one establishes a single word.

original: gal te ri bong gi rva med pa tsam zhig sgrub par byed na ni med par dgag par 'gyur la /
analyzed: gal te ri bong gi rva med pa tsam zhig sgrub par byed na ni med par dgag par 'gyur la /
translated: If one establishes mere non-existence of rabbit horns, it is an external negation.

original: des rva med pa'i chos nyid ston par byed cing sgrub par byed na de ma yin par dgag pa'i nang nas tshig gcig gis sgrub par byed pa yin no zhes bya'o //
analyzed: des rva med pa'i chos nyid ston par byed cing sgrub par byed na de ma yin par dgag pa'i nang nas tshig gcig gis sgrub par byed pa yin no zhes bya'o //
translated: If it teaches and establishes the reality of non-existence of horns, it is a single word that establishes from among internal negations.

original: snga na med pa dang / zhig nas med pa ma yin par bstan pa'o ;
analyzed: snga na med pa dang / zhig nas med pa ma yin par bstan pa'o ;
translated: It is taught that it is neither prior non-existence nor post non-existence.

original: / dgag pa bstan pa ni /
analyzed: / dgag pa bstan pa ni /
translated: The teaching of negation is:üîΩThe effect does not exist in the cause,

original: rgyu la 'bras bu med ces dang // 'bras bu la yang rgyu med ces //
analyzed: rgyu la 'bras bu med ces dang // 'bras bu la yang rgyu med ces //
translated: and the cause does not exist in the effect.

original: rgyu 'bras dngos po sgrub byed na //üîΩde yang de bzhin shes par bya //
analyzed: rgyu 'bras dngos po sgrub byed na // de yang de bzhin shes par bya //
translated: If one establishes the entities of cause and effect,

original: ces smos pa yin te /
analyzed: ces smos pa yin te /
translated: that also should be understood in the same way.

original: 'di ltar sa bon ston pa la myu gu med pa zhes bya ba dang / myu gu la sa bon @269b med pa zhes bya bas ston pa de bzhin du ma yin par dgag pa'i tshig gcig gis sgrub par 'gyur zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar sa bon ston pa la myu gu med pa zhes bya ba dang / myu gu la sa bon @269b med pa zhes bya bas ston pa de bzhin du ma yin par dgag pa'i tshig gcig gis sgrub par 'gyur zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Thus, it is not like the statement the sprout does not exist in the seed, or the seed does not exist in the sprout, where one negation establishes the other.

original: gcig la gcig med pa'i yul la ma yin par dgag par 'gyur ba ston pa ni /
analyzed: gcig la gcig med pa'i yul la ma yin par dgag par 'gyur ba ston pa ni /
translated: The statement the negation of one thing in a place is the negation of another thing in that same place is as follows.

original: rta la ba lang med ces pa //üîΩrta nyid sgrub par byed pa ni //üîΩma yin dgag pa zhes 'dod do //
analyzed: rta la ba lang med ces pa // rta nyid sgrub par byed pa ni // ma yin dgag pa zhes 'dod do //
translated: The statement there is no cow on the horseüîΩ is not an affirming negation,

original: zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: but is an implicative negation.

original: de ni snga ma bzhin du zhes par bya'o //
analyzed: de ni snga ma bzhin du zhes par bya'o //
translated: The word also should be supplied.

original: de ltar med pa rnam pa bzhi las ma yin par dgag pa tshig gcig gis sgrub par byed pa bshad nas /
analyzed: de ltar med pa rnam pa bzhi las ma yin par dgag pa tshig gcig gis sgrub par byed pa bshad nas /
translated: Thus, it is explained that one negation establishes the other in the case of the four kinds of non-existence.

original: da ni don gyis go ba bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩgang zhig bgag par gyur pa yis //
analyzed: da ni don gyis go ba bstan pa'i phyir / gang zhig bgag par gyur pa yis //
translated: Now, in order to teach the understood meaning, it is said:üîΩThe negation of one thing in a place is the negation of another thing in that same place.

original: gzhan du 'gal bar 'gyur ba dang // gang zhig nges par sgrub byed pa //
analyzed: gzhan du 'gal bar 'gyur ba dang // gang zhig nges par sgrub byed pa //
translated: The statement that which is negated by the negation of another thing is contradictory to it, and that which is necessarily established by the negation of another thing is understood by the negation of that other thing

original: dgag pa don gyis go ba'o //üîΩzhes smos so //
analyzed: dgag pa don gyis go ba'o //üîΩzhes smos so //
translated: is the understood meaning of the negation.

original: 'dir yang / med pa bzhi nyid yul du byas //
analyzed: 'dir yang / med pa bzhi nyid yul du byas //
translated: Here, the meaning of the passage is that

original: zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The four non-existences are taken as objects.

original: de'i don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de'i don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of that is as follows.

original: lhas byin ma shi la khyim na med na gzhan na yod par don gyis go ba lta bu ste /
analyzed: lhas byin ma shi la khyim na med na gzhan na yod par don gyis go ba lta bu ste /
translated: If Devadatta is not in the house when he is not dead, then it is implicitly understood that he is elsewhere.

original: lhas byin shi ba dang khyim na gnas pa bkag pas gzhan na gnas pa ma yin pa gzhan du sgrub pa 'gal te mi rung ba'i phyir gzhan na gnas par nges par sgrub pa yin te de lta bu dag go //
analyzed: lhas byin shi ba dang khyim na gnas pa bkag pas gzhan na gnas pa ma yin pa gzhan du sgrub pa 'gal te mi rung ba'i phyir gzhan na gnas par nges par sgrub pa yin te de lta bu dag go //
translated: When Devadatta dies, the negation of his presence in the house does not contradict the establishment of his presence elsewhere, because it is not tenable. Therefore, it is established with certainty that he is present elsewhere.

original: rang gi tshig gis mi ston pa'i sgrub par byed pa'i tshul bstan pa ni /
analyzed: rang gi tshig gis mi ston pa'i sgrub par byed pa'i tshul bstan pa ni /
translated: The mode of establishing that which is not indicated by its own words is taught:

original: ming gzhan dgag pas bstan pa'i dngos //
analyzed: ming gzhan dgag pas bstan pa'i dngos //
translated: The actual is indicated by the negation of another name.

original: 'gal dang nges pa med pa ni //
analyzed: 'gal dang nges pa med pa ni //
translated: The contradictory and the indefinite

original: rang gi tshig gis mi ston pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi tshig gis mi ston pa'o //
translated: are not indicated by their own words.

original: zhes bya ba smos pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos pa yin te /
translated: This is what is said.

original: ming gzhan bkag pas gzhan bstan pa ni dngos te /
analyzed: ming gzhan bkag pas gzhan bstan pa ni dngos te /
translated: The actual is indicated by the negation of another name.

original: lhas byin ma yin pa zhes lhas byin gyi ming bkag pas bstan pa'i dngos mchod sbyin te /
analyzed: lhas byin ma yin pa zhes lhas byin gyi ming bkag pas bstan pa'i dngos mchod sbyin te /
translated: The actual is indicated by the negation of Devadatta's name, saying not Devadatta.

original: de la lhas byin bkag pas mchod sbyin ma yin pa gzhan du 'gal ba yang med cing mchod sbyin dang nges par gzung ba yang med la /
analyzed: de la lhas byin bkag pas mchod sbyin ma yin pa gzhan du 'gal ba yang med cing mchod sbyin dang nges par gzung ba yang med la /
translated: Nor is the object of worship ascertained.

original: ngo bo de lta bur ston pa ni rang gi tshig gis mi ston pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ngo bo de lta bur ston pa ni rang gi tshig gis mi ston pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The statement of that nature is called ‚Äúnot teaching by one‚Äôs own words.‚Äù

original: de dag gi mjug bsdu ba ni /
analyzed: de dag gi mjug bsdu ba ni /
translated: The summary of those is:

original: gang zhig sgrub pa de lta bus //
analyzed: gang zhig sgrub pa de lta bus //
translated: That which is established by such a proofüîΩIs not an implicative negation

original: dngos dang dngos po med pa yi //üîΩde kho na nyid sgrub byed pa //
analyzed: dngos dang dngos po med pa yi // de kho na nyid sgrub byed pa //
translated: That establishes an entity or nonentity.

original: ma yin dgag pa zhes 'dod do //
analyzed: ma yin dgag pa zhes 'dod do //
translated: It is asserted to be a nonimplicative negation.

original: de dag ni sngar dpyad zin to //
analyzed: de dag ni sngar dpyad zin to //
translated: Those have already been analyzed.

original: med pa dag ni de las gzhan //üîΩzhes bya ba ni sgrub pa rnam pa bzhi po de dag gis sgrub pa de ltar bsgrub pa las /üîΩgzhan de dngos su sgrub po zhes @270a * //
analyzed: med pa dag ni de las gzhan // zhes bya ba ni sgrub pa rnam pa bzhi po de dag gis sgrub pa de ltar bsgrub pa las / gzhan de dngos su sgrub po zhes @270a * //
translated: Nonentities are other than that.üîΩThe meaning of that is: Other than the establishment of that which is established by those four types of proof,

original: bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bya ba'i don to //
translated: it is the establishment of that which is directly established.

original: da ni med par dgag pa yang med pa bzhir bstan pa dang / ma yin par dgag pa yang rnam grangs mang du bshad pa rnams tshan tshan du bsdu ba bstan par 'dod nas /
analyzed: da ni med par dgag pa yang med pa bzhir bstan pa dang / ma yin par dgag pa yang rnam grangs mang du bshad pa rnams tshan tshan du bsdu ba bstan par 'dod nas /
translated: Now, in order to show that the four types of non-entity are also taught as the four types of non-affirming negation, and that the many enumerations of the types of affirming negation are included in the groups,üîΩhe says,

original: mtshan nyid dbang gis dbye ba ni //
analyzed: mtshan nyid dbang gis dbye ba ni //
translated: The classification by way of characteristic

original: ma yin dgag pa'i dbye ba ste //
analyzed: ma yin dgag pa'i dbye ba ste //
translated: is the classification of affirming negation.

original: med pa dag ni mtshan nyid gcig //üîΩces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: med pa dag ni mtshan nyid gcig // ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Non-entities have one characteristic.

original: mtshan nyid kyi sgo nas dbye ba ni chos kyi rang gi ngo bo ston pa'i phyir ma yin par dgag pa'i dbye ba yin la /
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyi sgo nas dbye ba ni chos kyi rang gi ngo bo ston pa'i phyir ma yin par dgag pa'i dbye ba yin la /
translated: The classification by way of characteristic is the classification of affirming negation, because it teaches the intrinsic nature of phenomena.

original: med par dgag pa ni med par ston pas med pa la rnam grangs kyi mtshan nyid tha dad pa med do //üîΩde'i phyir / mtshan bzhi'i dbang gis bzhi yin no //
analyzed: med par dgag pa ni med par ston pas med pa la rnam grangs kyi mtshan nyid tha dad pa med do // de'i phyir / mtshan bzhi'i dbang gis bzhi yin no //
translated: Non-affirming negation is taught as non-existence, so there is no difference in the enumerated characteristics of non-existence.üîΩTherefore he says,

original: zhes smos te /
analyzed: zhes smos te /
translated: The four are by way of the four characteristics.

original: med pa'i mtshan nyid gang la yod pa de ni mtshan gzhi ste /
analyzed: med pa'i mtshan nyid gang la yod pa de ni mtshan gzhi ste /
translated: That which has the characteristic of non-existence is the basis of characteristics.

original: de yis phye bas med pa bzhir phye ba yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de yis phye bas med pa bzhir phye ba yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The four types of non-existence are distinguished by that.

original: ma yin par dgag pa la mtshan nyid kyi dbang gis phye ba yod par bstan pa la yang ji ltar go bar byed pa'i mtshan nyid dang / go bar bya ba'i mtshan nyid kyes bzhag ste /
analyzed: ma yin par dgag pa la mtshan nyid kyi dbang gis phye ba yod par bstan pa la yang ji ltar go bar byed pa'i mtshan nyid dang / go bar bya ba'i mtshan nyid kyes bzhag ste /
translated: The teaching that there is a division of implicative negation by way of its characteristics also has two parts: the characteristics that cause understanding and the characteristics that are to be understood.

original: de las ji ltar go bar byed pa gang dang gang bsdu ba bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de las ji ltar go bar byed pa gang dang gang bsdu ba bstan pa ni /
translated: The characteristics that cause understanding are taught by way of the method of how they cause understanding.

original: ma yin dgag pa'i mtshan nyid ni //
analyzed: ma yin dgag pa'i mtshan nyid ni //
translated: The characteristics of implicative negation

original: byed pa'i dbang gis bzhi yin te //
analyzed: byed pa'i dbang gis bzhi yin te //
translated: are four by way of the power of the agent.üîΩ  They are understood by the meaning,üîΩby a single word,üîΩby possessing that,

original: don gyis go bar byed pa dang // tshig gcig sgrub par byed pa dang // de dang ldan pa'i dgag pa dang // rang gi tshig gis mi ston pa'o //üîΩzhes smos pa yin te /
analyzed: don gyis go bar byed pa dang // tshig gcig sgrub par byed pa dang // de dang ldan pa'i dgag pa dang // rang gi tshig gis mi ston pa'o // zhes smos pa yin te /
translated: and by not teaching with one‚Äôs own words.

original: 'di rnams ni don ji ltar go bar byed pa'i tshul lam thabs yin te /
analyzed: 'di rnams ni don ji ltar go bar byed pa'i tshul lam thabs yin te /
translated: These are the methods or ways of how they cause understanding of the meaning.

original: 'di ltar kha cig ni don gyis go bar byed /
analyzed: 'di ltar kha cig ni don gyis go bar byed /
translated: Thus some are understood by the meaning.

original: kha cig ni tshig gcig gis go bar byed /
analyzed: kha cig ni tshig gcig gis go bar byed /
translated: Some are understood by a single word.

original: kha cig ni de gnyis ka dang ldan pas go bar byed /
analyzed: kha cig ni de gnyis ka dang ldan pas go bar byed /
translated: Some are understood by possessing both of those.

original: kha cig ni gzhan dgag pa'i sgo nas go bar byed de /
analyzed: kha cig ni gzhan dgag pa'i sgo nas go bar byed de /
translated: Some are understood by way of negation of others.

original: de'i phyir de dag ni go bar byed pa'i dbang du gzhug par bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag ni go bar byed pa'i dbang du gzhug par bsdu ba'o //
translated: Therefore, they are included in the power of understanding.

original: ji ltar go bar bya ba'i dbang du brjod pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ji ltar go bar bya ba'i dbang du brjod pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the power of what is to be understood, he says:

original: bya ba'i dbang gis bdun yin te //
analyzed: bya ba'i dbang gis bdun yin te //
translated: Seven are in terms of the power of action,

original: med pa nyid ni ma gtogs pa'o //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: med pa nyid ni ma gtogs pa'o // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: except for non-existence.

original: 'dir bdun ni gzung ba bde ba'i phyir smos pa snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: 'dir bdun ni gzung ba bde ba'i phyir smos pa snga ma bzhin no //
translated: Here, seven are mentioned for the sake of easy comprehension, as before.

original: bdun pa 'ba' zhig ma yin gyi de'i rigs su bsdu ba kun kyang yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bdun pa 'ba' zhig ma yin gyi de'i rigs su bsdu ba kun kyang yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that not only the seven but also all the other types of inclusion are included in this, he says:

original: mi mthun gnyen por bsdu ba yis /
analyzed: mi mthun gnyen por bsdu ba yis /
translated: By inclusion in the discordant and the antidote,

original: @270b brug gam 'gal dang gzhan pa yis //
analyzed: @270b brug gam 'gal dang gzhan pa yis //
translated: or by contradiction and by otherness,

original: gnyis su brjod par rig par bya //üîΩzhes smos te /
analyzed: gnyis su brjod par rig par bya // zhes smos te /
translated: the two should be understood.

original: go bar bya ba'i dbang du 'dra ba las bsdus par rgyas bar rig par bya'o zhes bstan par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: go bar bya ba'i dbang du 'dra ba las bsdus par rgyas bar rig par bya'o zhes bstan par rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that the inclusion in the similar is extensive in the power of what is to be understood.

original: de ni 'di ltar yin te /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar yin te /
translated: This is how it is.

original: la la ni gzhan du go bar ba ba la na dgag par bya ba dang mi 'dra ba go bar bya //
analyzed: la la ni gzhan du go bar ba ba la na dgag par bya ba dang mi 'dra ba go bar bya //
translated: Some are understood as the opposite of what is to be refuted.

original: la la ni rtag par bya ba dang dman par go bar bya ba /
analyzed: la la ni rtag par bya ba dang dman par go bar bya ba /
translated: Some are understood as permanent and inferior.

original: la la ni bstan par bya ba dang chung bar go bar bya ba /
analyzed: la la ni bstan par bya ba dang chung bar go bar bya ba /
translated: Some are understood as taught and small.

original: la la ni dgag par bya ba dang / mi mthun par go bar bya ba /
analyzed: la la ni dgag par bya ba dang / mi mthun par go bar bya ba /
translated: Some are understood as the opposite of what is to be refuted and incompatible.

original: la la ni dgag par bya ba'i gnyen por go bar bya ba dang / la la ni dgag par bya ba dang bral ba'i ngo bor go bar bya ba ste /
analyzed: la la ni dgag par bya ba'i gnyen por go bar bya ba dang / la la ni dgag par bya ba dang bral ba'i ngo bor go bar bya ba ste /
translated: Some are understood as the antidote to what is to be refuted, and some are understood as the essence free from what is to be refuted.

original: bsdu ba dang rgyas pa kun kyang rang rang gi ming gi sgo nas de ltar go bar bya ba yin pas go bar bya ba bsdu bar bya'o //
analyzed: bsdu ba dang rgyas pa kun kyang rang rang gi ming gi sgo nas de ltar go bar bya ba yin pas go bar bya ba bsdu bar bya'o //
translated: Since all the summaries and elaborations are to be understood in this way through their respective names, they should be summarized as what is to be understood.

original: da ni dgag pa de dag gi yul dang sgra dang nges pa'i tshig bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni dgag pa de dag gi yul dang sgra dang nges pa'i tshig bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to explain the objects, words, and etymologies of those refutations, it is said:

original: dgag pa'i yul yang rnam gsum ste //
analyzed: dgag pa'i yul yang rnam gsum ste //
translated: The objects of refutation are also threefold:

original: gzhi yi yul dang bya ba'i yul //
analyzed: gzhi yi yul dang bya ba'i yul //
translated: The object of the basis, the object of action,

original: dgos pa'i yul du 'dod pa yin //üîΩzhes smos te /
analyzed: dgos pa'i yul du 'dod pa yin //üîΩzhes smos te /
translated: And the object of purpose are asserted.

original: 'dir yang yul ni dgag pa'i sgra'i yul yin te /
analyzed: 'dir yang yul ni dgag pa'i sgra'i yul yin te /
translated: Here also, the object is the object of the negative statement.

original: yul gzhan ni ma bsnyad do //
analyzed: yul gzhan ni ma bsnyad do //
translated: Another object is not mentioned.

original: de las gzhi'i yul ni dgag par bya ba'i gzhi yin te sngar bshad zin to //
analyzed: de las gzhi'i yul ni dgag par bya ba'i gzhi yin te sngar bshad zin to //
translated: The object of the basis is the basis of the negation, as previously explained.

original: bya ba'i yul zhes bya ba ni dgag par bya ba nyid yul yin te /
analyzed: bya ba'i yul zhes bya ba ni dgag par bya ba nyid yul yin te /
translated: The object of the action is the object of the negation itself,

original: sgras dgag par bya ba yin pas so //
analyzed: sgras dgag par bya ba yin pas so //
translated: because the statement is the negation.

original: dgos pa'i yul ni dgag pa'i sgra'i dgos ched yin te /
analyzed: dgos pa'i yul ni dgag pa'i sgra'i dgos ched yin te /
translated: The object of the purpose is the purpose of the negative statement,

original: des bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is to be accomplished by that.üîΩTherefore, it is said:

original: de'i phyir / dgag pa'i gzhi dang dgag bya dang // dgag pa'i dgos ched gsum gyis so //üîΩzhes 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir / dgag pa'i gzhi dang dgag bya dang // dgag pa'i dgos ched gsum gyis so // zhes 'byung ba yin no //
translated: By the three: the basis of the negation, the negation, and the purpose of the negation.

original: sgra ston pa ni //
analyzed: sgra ston pa ni //
translated: The teaching of the statement is:

original: sgra ni bye brag med pa ste /
analyzed: sgra ni bye brag med pa ste /
translated: The statement is without distinction,

original: dgos pa'i dbang gis shes par bya //üîΩzhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: dgos pa'i dbang gis shes par bya // zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: to be known by the power of the purpose.

original: 'di ltar med par dgag pa ston pa'i sgra ni 'di ltar ma yin par dgag pa ston pa'i sgra ni 'di ltar zhes bye brag med de /
analyzed: 'di ltar med par dgag pa ston pa'i sgra ni 'di ltar ma yin par dgag pa ston pa'i sgra ni 'di ltar zhes bye brag med de /
translated: Thus, the statement that teaches an absolute negation is without distinction from the statement that teaches an implicative negation.

original: med do zhes bya ba dang / ma yin no zhes bya ba dag kyang thun mong gi khyad par ni dgos pa'i dbang du bstan pa nyid kyis so zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: med do zhes bya ba dang / ma yin no zhes bya ba dag kyang thun mong gi khyad par ni dgos pa'i dbang du bstan pa nyid kyis so zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúNo‚Äù and ‚Äúnot‚Äù are also common, since they are taught by the power of the need.

original: nges tshig ni /
analyzed: nges tshig ni /
translated: The definition isüîΩstated:

original: gang phyir gang yang ldog byed pas //
analyzed: gang phyir gang yang ldog byed pas //
translated: Because it causes the cessation of anything,

original: dgag pa zhes ni brjod pa yin //üîΩzhes smos te /
analyzed: dgag pa zhes ni brjod pa yin // zhes smos te /
translated: it is called a negation.

original: gang gi phyir dgag pa zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir dgag pa zhes bya zhe na /
translated: What is the reason for calling it a negation?

original: sgra gang yang dgag pa'i sgra 'dis ldog par byed pas de'i phyir dgag pa zhes bya'o /
analyzed: sgra gang yang dgag pa'i sgra 'dis ldog par byed pas de'i phyir dgag pa zhes bya'o /
translated: Because this word ‚Äúnegation‚Äù causes the cessation of anything, therefore it is called a negation.

original: @271a * // de yang gang dang sgrogs pa ldog par byed de /
analyzed: @271a * // de yang gang dang sgrogs pa ldog par byed de /
translated: Moreover, it causes the cessation of whatever is expressed.

original: 'di ltar ming dang sgrogs na ni ming nyid ldog par byed la /
analyzed: 'di ltar ming dang sgrogs na ni ming nyid ldog par byed la /
translated: If it expresses a name, it causes the cessation of the name itself.

original: de bzhin tshig dang / ngag dag gam ji srid du yang rung ste ldog par byed do //üîΩgzhan yang rang gi rigs dang gzhan dag kyang rung ste /
analyzed: de bzhin tshig dang / ngag dag gam ji srid du yang rung ste ldog par byed do // gzhan yang rang gi rigs dang gzhan dag kyang rung ste /
translated: Similarly, it causes the cessation of phrases, sentences, and so on, or whatever is expressed.

original: de dag thams cad ldog par byed do //
analyzed: de dag thams cad ldog par byed do //
translated: Moreover, it causes the cessation of all of them, whether of its own type or of another type.

original: de yang mi ldog par byed pa'i dus na ngo bo nyid ldog go //
analyzed: de yang mi ldog par byed pa'i dus na ngo bo nyid ldog go //
translated: Moreover, when the universal is negated, the nature is negated.

original: tshig ldog par byed pa'i dus na khyad par ldog pa dang / kha cig tu khyad par can ldog go //
analyzed: tshig ldog par byed pa'i dus na khyad par ldog pa dang / kha cig tu khyad par can ldog go //
translated: When the word is negated, the particular is negated, and in some cases the possessor of the particular is negated.

original: ngag dang / ji srid pa'i bar du yang de bzhin no //üîΩgzhan ldog par byed pa'i dus na sngar brjod pa ji lta ba bzhin no ;
analyzed: ngag dang / ji srid pa'i bar du yang de bzhin no // gzhan ldog par byed pa'i dus na sngar brjod pa ji lta ba bzhin no ;
translated: The same is true of the sentence and so on up to the treatise.üîΩWhen the other is negated, it is as previously stated.

original: / rang gi rigs ldog par byed pa'i dus na ma bkag pa ji lta ba bzhin no //
analyzed: / rang gi rigs ldog par byed pa'i dus na ma bkag pa ji lta ba bzhin no //
translated: When the class is negated, it is as previously stated.

original: ldog pa'i tshul yang rang dang sgrogs pa'i ming grub par mi byed pa tsam byed de /
analyzed: ldog pa'i tshul yang rang dang sgrogs pa'i ming grub par mi byed pa tsam byed de /
translated: The mode of negation is merely the non-establishment of the name in common usage.

original: tshig ji lta bu dang phrad kyang de bzhin du shes par bya'o //üîΩldog pa bsdus pa rab tu bstan pa zhes bya ba las dgag pa'i ltos /
analyzed: tshig ji lta bu dang phrad kyang de bzhin du shes par bya'o // ldog pa bsdus pa rab tu bstan pa zhes bya ba las dgag pa'i ltos /
translated: No matter what word one encounters, one should understand it in the same way.

original: pa bstan pa'i le'u ste gsum pa'o /
analyzed: pa bstan pa'i le'u ste gsum pa'o /
translated: This concludes the third chapter on the presentation of negation in the treatise called ‚ÄúThe Elucidation of the Compendium of Valid Cognition.‚Äù

original: // / da ni rab tu gsal bar bstan pa brjod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: // / da ni rab tu gsal bar bstan pa brjod pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to explain the presentation of the very clear, it is said:

original: dgag pa'i yul dang dgos pa dang // sgra dang dus dang gnas skabs dang // dgag bya ltos pa nges tshig gis //
analyzed: dgag pa'i yul dang dgos pa dang // sgra dang dus dang gnas skabs dang // dgag bya ltos pa nges tshig gis //
translated: and the negation that depends on the object of negation are

original: rab tu gsal bar brjod pa yin //
analyzed: rab tu gsal bar brjod pa yin //
translated: clearly stated by the definitions.

original: zhes smos so //
analyzed: zhes smos so //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: de rnams kyis dgag pa'i bye brag legs par 'gyur ro zhes pa yin no //
analyzed: de rnams kyis dgag pa'i bye brag legs par 'gyur ro zhes pa yin no //
translated: By these, the varieties of negation are well formed.

original: de yang mdor bsdu ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de yang mdor bsdu ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach that in brief,üîΩin brief, by the object, the dependence,

original: mdor ni yul dang ltos pa dang // sgra dang nges pa'i tshig gis so //
analyzed: mdor ni yul dang ltos pa dang // sgra dang nges pa'i tshig gis so //
translated: the words, and the definitions.

original: zhes smos so //
analyzed: zhes smos so //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: 'di dag tu 'dus te /
analyzed: 'di dag tu 'dus te /
translated: They are included in these.

original: 'di dag shes pas gong ma dag kyang shes par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di dag shes pas gong ma dag kyang shes par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: By knowing these, the higher ones will also be known.

original: dgag pa sgrub par byed pa'i dus nyid du dngos su mi brjod du rung ba du yod ce na /
analyzed: dgag pa sgrub par byed pa'i dus nyid du dngos su mi brjod du rung ba du yod ce na /
translated: How many are suitable to be directly stated at the time of establishing the negation?

original: de bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach that,

original: dngos su brjod pa'i dgos pa ni /
analyzed: dngos su brjod pa'i dgos pa ni /
translated: the purpose of direct statement isüîΩthe object of negation, the agent,üîΩand the distinctions of place and time,

original: dgag par bya dang byed pa dang // yul dang dus kyi khyad par dag / gcig gam gnyis sam yang na ni //
analyzed: dgag par bya dang byed pa dang // yul dang dus kyi khyad par dag / gcig gam gnyis sam yang na ni //
translated: either one, two, or all together.

original: spyi la ltos na med kyang rung //
analyzed: spyi la ltos na med kyang rung //
translated: It is not necessary to specify the universal.

original: gnyis sam gsum mam bzhi yin no //üîΩzhes smos te /
analyzed: gnyis sam gsum mam bzhi yin no // zhes smos te /
translated: It is either two, three, or four.üîΩIf the negation is not specific, it is either two, three, or four.üîΩIf it is specific, it is either two, three, or four.üîΩIf it is not specific, it is either two, three, or four.üîΩIf it is not specific, it is either two, three, or four.

original: nyung na ni dgag par bya ba dang 'gegs par byed pa gnyis dang ldan na yul dang dus spyi la ltos pas smos pa yang yod de /
analyzed: nyung na ni dgag par bya ba dang 'gegs par byed pa gnyis dang ldan na yul dang dus spyi la ltos pas smos pa yang yod de /
translated: If it is not specific, it is either two, three, or four.üîΩIf it is not specific, it is either two, three, or four.

original: la la ni yul gyi khyad par mi dgos la dus khyad par dang gsum brjod dgos pa yod de /üîΩbskal pa'i me 'bar ba'i tshe mngon par 'du byed pa'i gnas med do zhes bya ba lta bu'o //

translated: If it is not specific, it is either two, three, or

original: la la ni de dag bzhi char yang brjod dgos pa yod de /
analyzed: la la ni de dag bzhi char yang brjod dgos pa yod de /
translated: Some say: All four must be expressed.

original: phyogs 'di na sngon bum pa med do zhes brjod pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: phyogs 'di na sngon bum pa med do zhes brjod pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is said, ‚ÄúPreviously, there was no pot here.‚Äù

original: sgra dngos su mi brjod du mi rung ba ni skabs kyi tshul de ltar 'byung ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩda ni de ltar dgag pa'i yul bstan pa'i skabs su dgag pa med pa'am /
analyzed: sgra dngos su mi brjod du mi rung ba ni skabs kyi tshul de ltar 'byung ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to // da ni de ltar dgag pa'i yul bstan pa'i skabs su dgag pa med pa'am /
translated: It is not suitable to not directly express the term, because the context is like that.

original: ma yin pa gang la yod pa de bzhi'i yul yin no zhes bstan pa la /
analyzed: ma yin pa gang la yod pa de bzhi'i yul yin no zhes bstan pa la /
translated: Now, in the context of teaching the object of negation in that way, it is taught that the object of negation is that which does not exist, or that which is not.üîΩIn response to that, it is said:

original: 'di skad du dgag pa'i dus na da lta yin na gal te ngo bo'i tshig ma yin pa la sogs pa byed pa'i tshig dgag par byed pa'i dus na ni dgag par bya ba nyid yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad du dgag pa'i dus na da lta yin na gal te ngo bo'i tshig ma yin pa la sogs pa byed pa'i tshig dgag par byed pa'i dus na ni dgag par bya ba nyid yin te /
translated: When the time of negation is the present, if the word of the entity is not, the word of action is negated. At the time of negation, the object of negation is itself.üîΩIf it is not an entity, what is the basis of that object to be apprehended?

original: dngos po ma yin na de'i gzhi'i yul gang la gzung bar bya snyam du dogs pa bsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: dngos po ma yin na de'i gzhi'i yul gang la gzung bar bya snyam du dogs pa bsal ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to dispel that doubt, it is said:üîΩThe negation of action and so on

original: dgag bya dngos po ma yin pa'i //
analyzed: dgag bya dngos po ma yin pa'i //
translated: of that which is not the object of negation,

original: las la sogs pa dgag pa dag / dgag bya bya ba nyid yin na //
analyzed: las la sogs pa dgag pa dag / dgag bya bya ba nyid yin na //
translated: if the object of negation is action itself,

original: bya ba gang gi yin pa de'i //
analyzed: bya ba gang gi yin pa de'i //
translated: The object of the action is the basis of the action.
