original: gang la yod pa'i dngos po de 'dir bya ba dgag pa'i gzhi'i yul yang yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gang la yod pa'i dngos po de 'dir bya ba dgag pa'i gzhi'i yul yang yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The object of the action is the basis of the action, that is, the object of the prohibition.

original: de la bya ba ston pa ni tshig gi phrad yin te /
analyzed: de la bya ba ston pa ni tshig gi phrad yin te /
translated: The verbal prefix indicates the action.

original: de la re zhig las dgag pa ni dper na shing mi gcod ces bya ba lta bu yin te /
analyzed: de la re zhig las dgag pa ni dper na shing mi gcod ces bya ba lta bu yin te /
translated: The prohibition of action is like, for example, ‚ÄúDo not cut down the tree.‚Äù

original: las ni shing dang / skye bu dang / lag cha'i tshogs kyi 'du byed pa yin te /
analyzed: las ni shing dang / skye bu dang / lag cha'i tshogs kyi 'du byed pa yin te /
translated: The action is the activity of the collection of the tree, the person, and the axe.

original: 'du byed de ni shing dang skyes bu dang lag cha la yod kyi gzhan la ma yin no //
analyzed: 'du byed de ni shing dang skyes bu dang lag cha la yod kyi gzhan la ma yin no //
translated: That activity exists in the tree, the person, and the axe, but not elsewhere.

original: de yang shing la yod pa'i 'du byed la ni bya ba'i gzhi la yod pa'i las zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de yang shing la yod pa'i 'du byed la ni bya ba'i gzhi la yod pa'i las zhes bya'o //
translated: Moreover, the activity that exists in the tree is called the action that exists in the basis of the action.

original: skyes bu la yod pa la ni byed pa po la yod pa'i las zhes bya'o //
analyzed: skyes bu la yod pa la ni byed pa po la yod pa'i las zhes bya'o //
translated: That which exists in the person is called the action that exists in the agent.

original: lag cha la yod pa la ni byed pa la yod pa'i las zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lag cha la yod pa la ni byed pa la yod pa'i las zhes bya'o //
translated: That which exists in the axe is called the action that exists in the instrument.

original: las de dag dgag pa na yang gzhi'i yul ni de dag nyid yin no //
analyzed: las de dag dgag pa na yang gzhi'i yul ni de dag nyid yin no //
translated: When those actions are prohibited, the object of the basis is just those.

original: de bzhin du 'og ma kun la yang sbyor ba bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'og ma kun la yang sbyor ba bya'o //
translated: examples.üîΩThe refutation of activity is from ‚ÄúIt does not cut what is being cut‚Äù up to

original: byed pa dgag pa ni lta res mi gcod cis bya ba nas gcod pa ma yin zhes bya @272a * //üîΩba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: byed pa dgag pa ni lta res mi gcod cis bya ba nas gcod pa ma yin zhes bya @272a * // ba'i bar du'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIt does not cut.‚Äù

original: gzhan du yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: gzhan du yang de bzhin no //
translated: The same method of interpretation should be applied to all the otherüîΩexamples.üîΩThe refutation of the basis is as follows.

original: gzhi ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: gzhi ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The basis is as before.

original: ched dgag pa ni /
analyzed: ched dgag pa ni /
translated: The refutation of the purpose is as follows.

original: bde phyir mchod spyin mi byed pa //
analyzed: bde phyir mchod spyin mi byed pa //
translated: One should not make offerings for the sake of happiness,

original: 'jig rten dag na smad pa'i rgyu //üîΩzhes bya ba lta bu yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten dag na smad pa'i rgyu // zhes bya ba lta bu yin no //
translated: because it is the cause of being despised in the world.

original: 'byung khungs dgag pa ni /üîΩrgyu las kun du ma byung ba'i //
analyzed: 'byung khungs dgag pa ni / rgyu las kun du ma byung ba'i //
translated: The refutation of the source is as follows.

original: 'bras bu 'dod pa lta bar dman //üîΩzhes bya ba lta bu yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu 'dod pa lta bar dman // zhes bya ba lta bu yin no //
translated: The view that the effect is not produced from the cause is low.

original: 'brel pa dgag pa ni /
analyzed: 'brel pa dgag pa ni /
translated: The refutation of the relation is as follows.

original: 'di ltar 'gro ba'i sdug bsngal ni// yang dag lta ba'i 'bras bu yin// zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'gro ba'i sdug bsngal ni// yang dag lta ba'i 'bras bu yin// zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: Thus, the suffering of transmigrators is the effect of the correct view.

original: rten gnas dgag pa ni /
analyzed: rten gnas dgag pa ni /
translated: The refutation of the basis of the relation is as follows.

original: gang zhig bdag dang bcas 'dod pa //
analyzed: gang zhig bdag dang bcas 'dod pa //
translated: Those who desire to have a self

original: yang dag lta la de mi gnas //üîΩzhes bya ba lta bu yin no //
analyzed: yang dag lta la de mi gnas // zhes bya ba lta bu yin no //
translated: do not abide in the correct view.

original: bod pa dgag pa ni med de /
analyzed: bod pa dgag pa ni med de /
translated: The refutation of the conclusion is as follows.

original: gang brjod pa de thams cad la bod pas gzhi byed pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang brjod pa de thams cad la bod pas gzhi byed pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the Tibetan does not apply to all that is expressed.

original: dgag pa la bod pa ni yod de /
analyzed: dgag pa la bod pa ni yod de /
translated: The Tibetan does apply to negation,

original: gang brjod pa de thams cad la bod pa 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang brjod pa de thams cad la bod pa 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it applies to all that is expressed.

original: nges par gzung ba dgag pa ni lhas byin kho na'i bu dkar sham ma yin zhes bya ba dang / lhas byin gyi bu dkar sham kho na ma yin zhes bya ba dang / lhas byin gyi bu dkar sham bzang po kho na med ces bya ba lta bu yin no //
analyzed: nges par gzung ba dgag pa ni lhas byin kho na'i bu dkar sham ma yin zhes bya ba dang / lhas byin gyi bu dkar sham kho na ma yin zhes bya ba dang / lhas byin gyi bu dkar sham bzang po kho na med ces bya ba lta bu yin no //
translated: The negation of a particular is, for example, ‚ÄúThe son of Devadatta is not white,‚Äù ‚ÄúThe son of Devadatta is not just white,‚Äù and ‚ÄúThe son of Devadatta is not just a good white.‚Äù

original: de dag la yang nges par bzung ste dgag pa dang / nges par 'dzin pa dgag pa gnyis so //
analyzed: de dag la yang nges par bzung ste dgag pa dang / nges par 'dzin pa dgag pa gnyis so //
translated: In these, there are two types: the negation of a particular and the negation of a particular qualifier.

original: de la nges par bzung ste bkag na ni lha sbyin kho na'i bu dkar sham ma yin zhes gzhan la bu dkar sham med par ston pa dgag pa de yang lha spyin la bu dkar sham med par ston la /
analyzed: de la nges par bzung ste bkag na ni lha sbyin kho na'i bu dkar sham ma yin zhes gzhan la bu dkar sham med par ston pa dgag pa de yang lha spyin la bu dkar sham med par ston la /
translated: If the particular is negated, then ‚ÄúThe son of Devadatta is not white‚Äù shows that another does not have a white son. That negation also shows that Devadatta does not have a white son.

original: gzhan thams cad ni yod do bar ston to //
analyzed: gzhan thams cad ni yod do bar ston to //
translated: It shows that all others have a white son.

original: nges par 'dzin pa bkag na lha spyin dang gzhan kun la dkar sham thun mong du yod de /
analyzed: nges par 'dzin pa bkag na lha spyin dang gzhan kun la dkar sham thun mong du yod de /
translated: If the qualifier is refuted, then the commonality of whiteness in Devadatta and all others is refuted.

original: lha spyin gcig pu la yod pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba dang / gzhan la med pa yang ma yin zhes dgag pa yin te /
analyzed: lha spyin gcig pu la yod pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba dang / gzhan la med pa yang ma yin zhes dgag pa yin te /
translated: It is not that whiteness exists in Devadatta alone, nor that it does not exist in others.

original: de ni gzhan la mi ldan par nges par bzung ba'i dgag pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni gzhan la mi ldan par nges par bzung ba'i dgag pa yin no //
translated: This is a refutation that ascertains that whiteness does not exist in others.üîΩMoreover, if this ascertainment that whiteness does not exist in others is refuted, then it is ascertained and refuted.

original: gzhan yang lha spyin gyi bu dkar sham kho na ma yin zhes gzhan mi ldan pa nges par gzung ba'i 'di dgag pa na nges par bzung ste bkag na ni lha spyin gyi bu dkar sham ma yin pa gzhan sngo ba sangs la sogs pa ni yin noüîΩzhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang lha spyin gyi bu dkar sham kho na ma yin zhes gzhan mi ldan pa nges par gzung ba'i 'di dgag pa na nges par bzung ste bkag na ni lha spyin gyi bu dkar sham ma yin pa gzhan sngo ba sangs la sogs pa ni yin no zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is ascertained that whiteness does not exist in others, then it is ascertained that whiteness exists in others.

original: gal te nges bar 'dzin pa dgag na ni lha spyin gyi bu dkar sham dang sngo bsangs la sogs pa thun mong yin te /
analyzed: gal te nges bar 'dzin pa dgag na ni lha spyin gyi bu dkar sham dang sngo bsangs la sogs pa thun mong yin te /
translated: If the qualifier is refuted, then whiteness is common to Devadatta and all others.üîΩIt is not that whiteness exists in Devadatta alone.üîΩIf the qualifier is refuted, then whiteness is common to Devadatta and all others.

original: dkar sham gcig pu yin pa ni ma yin no zhes bya bar 'dir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dkar sham gcig pu yin pa ni ma yin no zhes bya bar 'dir 'gyur ro //
translated: It is not that whiteness exists in Devadatta alone.

original: gzhan yang lha spyin gyi bu @272b dkar sham bzang po kho na med ces ldan pa tsam du 'dzin pa dgag pa na nges par bzung ste bkag na ni lha sbyin gyi bu dkar sham ni med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang lha spyin gyi bu @272b dkar sham bzang po kho na med ces ldan pa tsam du 'dzin pa dgag pa na nges par bzung ste bkag na ni lha sbyin gyi bu dkar sham ni med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, when one refutes the apprehension of mere possession, ‚ÄúDevadatta‚Äôs son does not exist,‚Äù if one refutes it by ascertaining it, then ‚ÄúDevadatta‚Äôs son does not exist.‚Äù

original: gzhan gyi bu ni kun yod do ba 'dir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi bu ni kun yod do ba 'dir 'gyur ro //
translated: But the son of others exists.

original: gal te nges par bzung ste bkag na ni lha sbyin gyi bu dkar sham gcig pu ma yin gyi gzhan gyi bu dang yod pa thun mong du gnas so zhes bya ba 'dir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te nges par bzung ste bkag na ni lha sbyin gyi bu dkar sham gcig pu ma yin gyi gzhan gyi bu dang yod pa thun mong du gnas so zhes bya ba 'dir 'gyur ro //
translated: If one refutes it by ascertaining it, then ‚ÄúDevadatta‚Äôs son is not alone, but the son of others and existence exist in common.‚Äù

original: gzhan yang nges par 'dzin par gtogs pa rnams kyi dgag pa kun kyang tshul de lta bu dag tu 'gegs par byed de /
analyzed: gzhan yang nges par 'dzin par gtogs pa rnams kyi dgag pa kun kyang tshul de lta bu dag tu 'gegs par byed de /
translated: Moreover, all refutations that pertain to ascertainment are refuted in that way.

original: de la nges par bzung ste dgag pa'i phyogs ni tshig phrad dgag pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de la nges par bzung ste dgag pa'i phyogs ni tshig phrad dgag pa ma yin te /
translated: In that regard, the position of refuting by ascertaining is not a refutation of verbal connection.

original: phrad kyis khyad par du byas te dgag pa yin pas bya ba dgag par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: phrad kyis khyad par du byas te dgag pa yin pas bya ba dgag par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Since it is a refutation that is distinguished by connection, it is not a refutation of action.

original: de bzhin du las la sogs pa la yang nges par bzung ba dang bcas te bkag na de dag ji ltar de ltar brtag go //
analyzed: de bzhin du las la sogs pa la yang nges par bzung ba dang bcas te bkag na de dag ji ltar de ltar brtag go //
translated: Likewise, if action and so on are also negated with a specification, how could they be imagined in that way?

original: de ltar 'gyur ba de dag thams cad kyang dgag pas sbyor ba'i tshe na yin te /
analyzed: de ltar 'gyur ba de dag thams cad kyang dgag pas sbyor ba'i tshe na yin te /
translated: All of these transformations are also negated when the negation is applied,üîΩbut not when the negation is not applied.

original: dgag pa la sbyor ba'i tshe na ni ma yin no da ni rab tu gsal ba brjod pa'i dgag pa'i yul dang rang gi ngo bo la sogs pa rnam grangs de dag re re nas bshad par bya ba'i phyir re zhig dang por yul las brtsams nas /
analyzed: dgag pa la sbyor ba'i tshe na ni ma yin no da ni rab tu gsal ba brjod pa'i dgag pa'i yul dang rang gi ngo bo la sogs pa rnam grangs de dag re re nas bshad par bya ba'i phyir re zhig dang por yul las brtsams nas /
translated: Now, in order to explain individually the objects and natures of negation, and so on, which have been stated in a condensed form, first, beginning with the object,üîΩhe says:

original: med dang de yi tha snyad kyi //
analyzed: med dang de yi tha snyad kyi //
translated: The objects of nonexistence and its convention

original: yul ni bye brag so so ste //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: yul ni bye brag so so ste // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: are different in each case.

original: da la med pa'i tha snyad kyi yul zhes spyir brjod kyang med pa dang de'i tha snyad kyang tha dad la /
analyzed: da la med pa'i tha snyad kyi yul zhes spyir brjod kyang med pa dang de'i tha snyad kyang tha dad la /
translated: Here, although the object of the convention of nonexistence is stated generally, nonexistence and its convention are different,

original: de dag gi yul yang tha dad do zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de dag gi yul yang tha dad do zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: and their objects are also different.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: med pa ni gang na gang med pa de nyid yin la de'i tha snyad ni gsum ste /
analyzed: med pa ni gang na gang med pa de nyid yin la de'i tha snyad ni gsum ste /
translated: Nonexistence is the absence of something in a particular place. Its conventions are threefold:

original: med do snyam du rtogs pa dang / med do zhes brjod pa dang / med pas thogs pa med par 'jug pa'i bdag nyid shes pa dang / brjod pa dang / 'jug pa'i tha snyad rnam pa gsum mo /
analyzed: med do snyam du rtogs pa dang / med do zhes brjod pa dang / med pas thogs pa med par 'jug pa'i bdag nyid shes pa dang / brjod pa dang / 'jug pa'i tha snyad rnam pa gsum mo /
translated: the cognition that thinks ‚Äúit does not exist,‚Äù the expression ‚Äúit does not exist,‚Äù and the engagement in the absence of obstruction, which is the nature of the cognition, expression, and engagement of nonexistence.

original: de yang rnam par rtog pa nyid dang / de la snang ba'i rnam pa sgra la sogs pa brtag pa'i bdag nyid dang / lus ngag gi 'jug pa dang brjod pa thams cad yin te /
analyzed: de yang rnam par rtog pa nyid dang / de la snang ba'i rnam pa sgra la sogs pa brtag pa'i bdag nyid dang / lus ngag gi 'jug pa dang brjod pa thams cad yin te /
translated: Moreover, it is the nature of conceptualization itself, the aspect that appears to it, sound, and so on, and all the engagements and expressions of body and speech.

original: gang gi phyir thams cad kyang don rang gi ngo bo ma yin pa dang / de la yod pa yang ma yin bzhin du nan gyis rtog pa dang / brtag pa kho na yin pa'i phyir de dag med pa'i tha snyad ces bya'o /
analyzed: gang gi phyir thams cad kyang don rang gi ngo bo ma yin pa dang / de la yod pa yang ma yin bzhin du nan gyis rtog pa dang / brtag pa kho na yin pa'i phyir de dag med pa'i tha snyad ces bya'o /
translated: Because all of them are the nature of an object that does not exist and that is not present there, they are called the conventions of nonexistence because they are mere imputations and insistences.

original: thams cad du yang de bzhin du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: thams cad du yang de bzhin du shes par bya'o //
translated: This should be understood in the same way for everything.

original: de dag gi yul gyi bye brag gang zhe na /
analyzed: de dag gi yul gyi bye brag gang zhe na /
translated: What is the difference in their objects?üîΩIn order to demonstrate this,

original: 'di bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: he says,

original: med pa'i yul ni gcig @273a * //
analyzed: med pa'i yul ni gcig @273a * //
translated: The domain of non-existence is one,

original: yin te // gang la yod pa de yin no //üîΩzhes smos te /
analyzed: yin te // gang la yod pa de yin no // zhes smos te /
translated: where there is existence.

original: med pa nyid kyi yul ni gcig ste med pa gang la yod pa'i dngos po de kho na yin te /
analyzed: med pa nyid kyi yul ni gcig ste med pa gang la yod pa'i dngos po de kho na yin te /
translated: The domain of non-existence is one, where there is the entity of existence.

original: 'di ltar bum pa med pa gang la yod pa'i sa gzhi lta bu nyid do //
analyzed: 'di ltar bum pa med pa gang la yod pa'i sa gzhi lta bu nyid do //
translated: For example, it is just the ground where there is the non-existence of a pot.

original: de'i tha snyad kyi yul bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de'i tha snyad kyi yul bstan pa ni /
translated: The domain of conventional usage is taught:

original: tha snyad yul gyi bye brag dag /
analyzed: tha snyad yul gyi bye brag dag /
translated: The domain of conventional usage is of three kinds,

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: and so on.

original: tha snyad rnam pa gsum gyi bye brag las zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: tha snyad rnam pa gsum gyi bye brag las zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The domain of conventional usage is of three kinds, due to the difference of the three kinds of conventional usage.

original: de las re zhig brjod pa'i tha snyad kyi yul ston pa ni /
analyzed: de las re zhig brjod pa'i tha snyad kyi yul ston pa ni /
translated: Among them, first, the domain of verbal conventional usage is taught:

original: rjod pa'i yul ni gsum yin te //
analyzed: rjod pa'i yul ni gsum yin te //
translated: The domain of verbal expression is three-fold,

original: gzhi sogs bstan pa nyid yin no //üîΩzhes smos pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhi sogs bstan pa nyid yin no // zhes smos pa yin te /
translated: the basis and so on, as has been taught.üîΩThe basis, the action, and the purpose, as has been taught above.

original: gzhi dang / bya ba dang / dgos pa rnams gong du bstan pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzhi dang / bya ba dang / dgos pa rnams gong du bstan pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: de la gzhi ni sgra'i rten yin pa'i phyir gzhi'i yul lo /
analyzed: de la gzhi ni sgra'i rten yin pa'i phyir gzhi'i yul lo /
translated: Therein, the basis is the domain of the basis, because it is the support of the word.

original: bya ba ni sgras dgag par bya ba yin pas bya ba'i yul lo //
analyzed: bya ba ni sgras dgag par bya ba yin pas bya ba'i yul lo //
translated: Since the object is the object of the activity of negation, it is the object of the activity.

original: dgos pa ni sgra brjod pa'i dgos pa yin pas dgos pa'i yul lo //
analyzed: dgos pa ni sgra brjod pa'i dgos pa yin pas dgos pa'i yul lo //
translated: Since the purpose is the purpose of the expression of the word, it is the object of the purpose.

original: shes pa'i tha snyad kyi yul gang yin pa bstan pa'i phyir shes pa'i yul ni drug yin te //
analyzed: shes pa'i tha snyad kyi yul gang yin pa bstan pa'i phyir shes pa'i yul ni drug yin te //
translated: In order to demonstrate the object of the convention of cognition, he says, The object of cognition is sixfold.

original: med par rang gi ngo bo dang // de yi gzhi dang dgag bya dang // dgos ched sgra dang 'jug pa ni //üîΩshes pa'i yul du 'dod pa yin //
analyzed: med par rang gi ngo bo dang // de yi gzhi dang dgag bya dang // dgos ched sgra dang 'jug pa ni // shes pa'i yul du 'dod pa yin //
translated: The non-existent, its own nature, its basis, the object of negation, the purpose, and the word and engagement.

original: zhes smos te /
analyzed: zhes smos te /
translated: These are asserted to be the objects of cognition.

original: med pa nyid la sogs pa drug car yang shes pas dmigs par bya pa'i yul du byed pa'i phyir yul yin la /
analyzed: med pa nyid la sogs pa drug car yang shes pas dmigs par bya pa'i yul du byed pa'i phyir yul yin la /
translated: Since the six, the non-existent and so on, are the objects that are observed by cognition, they are objects.

original: 'di dag shes pas yul du byas pa ma yin na tha snyad gzhan yang 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di dag shes pas yul du byas pa ma yin na tha snyad gzhan yang 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If these were not made objects by cognition, other conventions would not occur.

original: da ni 'jug pa'i tha snyad kyi yul bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni 'jug pa'i tha snyad kyi yul bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate the object of engagement, he says,

original: 'jug pa'i yul ni gnyis yin te //üîΩde la 'jug dang ldog pa'o //
analyzed: 'jug pa'i yul ni gnyis yin te // de la 'jug dang ldog pa'o //
translated: The object of engagement is twofold.

original: zhes smos te /
analyzed: zhes smos te /
translated: Engagement and disengagement are with regard to that.

original: de la don dgos pa la 'jug pa'i byed pa dang / ldog pa'i byed pa ni 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: de la don dgos pa la 'jug pa'i byed pa dang / ldog pa'i byed pa ni 'jug pa ste /
translated: The function of engagement is the function of entering into the object, and the function of disengagement is the function of leaving the object.

original: bum pa med pa'i yul ni thogs pa med par 'gro ba dang / blang bar 'dod pa'i tshe ni ldog pa'i 'jug pa byed de /
analyzed: bum pa med pa'i yul ni thogs pa med par 'gro ba dang / blang bar 'dod pa'i tshe ni ldog pa'i 'jug pa byed de /
translated: The object of a pot is unobstructed space, and when one wishes to take up the pot, the function of engagement is to enter into the pot.

original: de'i phyir 'jug pa dang ldog pa ni byed pa'i yul yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'jug pa dang ldog pa ni byed pa'i yul yin no //
translated: Therefore, engagement and disengagement are the objects of the function.

original: byed pa yang gang gi zhe na /
analyzed: byed pa yang gang gi zhe na /
translated: What is the function?

original: sgra dang shes pa lus rnams kyi //
analyzed: sgra dang shes pa lus rnams kyi //
translated: The function of sound, consciousness, and the body

original: byed pa 'jug pa zhes 'dod do //
analyzed: byed pa 'jug pa zhes 'dod do //
translated: is asserted to be engagement.

original: zhes smos te 'dir sgra'i byed pa ni sgra'i las yin la /
analyzed: zhes smos te 'dir sgra'i byed pa ni sgra'i las yin la /
translated: Here, the function of sound is the action of sound.

original: las su bya ba ni med pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: las su bya ba ni med pa nyid yin te /
translated: The object of action is nonexistence.

original: med ces bya ba'i sgra'i rang gi ngo bo ni brjod pa'i tha snyad yin la /
analyzed: med ces bya ba'i sgra'i rang gi ngo bo ni brjod pa'i tha snyad yin la /
translated: The nature of the word ‚Äúnonexistent‚Äù is the expression of the word.

original: med pa nyid ston pa'i byed pa'i las ni ngag gi 'jug pa'i tha snyad ces bya'o //
analyzed: med pa nyid ston pa'i byed pa'i las ni ngag gi 'jug pa'i tha snyad ces bya'o //
translated: The object of the function that indicates nonexistence is called the engagement of speech.

original: shes pa yang 'di ltar med do snyam @273b du rtog pa ni shes pa'i tha snyad yin la /
analyzed: shes pa yang 'di ltar med do snyam @273b du rtog pa ni shes pa'i tha snyad yin la /
translated: The expression of consciousness is the thought ‚ÄúIt is like this, there is no consciousness.‚Äù

original: rnam rtog gi byed pa ni byed pa'i las yin te /
analyzed: rnam rtog gi byed pa ni byed pa'i las yin te /
translated: The function of conceptualization is the action of the agent.

original: rnam rtog gi 'jug pa'i tha snyad ces bya'o //
analyzed: rnam rtog gi 'jug pa'i tha snyad ces bya'o //
translated: It is called the convention of the engagement of conceptualization.

original: lus kyi 'jug pa la ni dbye ba med do //
analyzed: lus kyi 'jug pa la ni dbye ba med do //
translated: There is no division of the engagement of the body.

original: gnas skabs kha cig tu ni rnam par rtog pa'i byed pa ni dpyod pa yin zhing /
analyzed: gnas skabs kha cig tu ni rnam par rtog pa'i byed pa ni dpyod pa yin zhing /
translated: In some circumstances, the function of conceptualization is investigation.

original: sgra'i byed pa ni tshig gi sbyor ba yin la /
analyzed: sgra'i byed pa ni tshig gi sbyor ba yin la /
translated: The function of sound is the application of words.

original: lus kyi byed pa ni 'jug pa yin te /
analyzed: lus kyi byed pa ni 'jug pa yin te /
translated: The function of the body is engagement.

original: de'i phyir sgra dang shes pa byed ba dang bcas pa ni rjod pa dang shes pa'i tha snyad yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir sgra dang shes pa byed ba dang bcas pa ni rjod pa dang shes pa'i tha snyad yin la /
translated: Therefore, sound and consciousness, which have a function, are the conventions of expression and consciousness.

original: lus kyi 'jug pa ni 'jug pa'i tha snyad yin no zhes bya bar sgrub ste /
analyzed: lus kyi 'jug pa ni 'jug pa'i tha snyad yin no zhes bya bar sgrub ste /
translated: The engagement of the body is the convention of engagement.üîΩTherefore it is said:

original: de'i phyir / kha cig tu ni lus la'ang 'jug / de yang shes pa dang bcas pa'o //üîΩzhes smos pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir / kha cig tu ni lus la'ang 'jug / de yang shes pa dang bcas pa'o // zhes smos pa yin no //
translated: In some cases, the body engages, and that is associated with consciousness.

original: de la shes pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar sems gang g-yos na de'i mthus lus gzhan du g-yo ba'i nus pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: de la shes pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar sems gang g-yos na de'i mthus lus gzhan du g-yo ba'i nus pa 'byung ste /
translated: Here, ‚Äúassociated with consciousness‚Äù means that when the mind moves, the body has the power to move elsewhere through the force of that.

original: lus gang g-yo ba de ni shes pa dang bcas pa bzhin du'o //üîΩbcas pa des don gang bsgrub par bya la thogs med par 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i mtshan nyid ni byed pa 'di'i bya ba yin pa'i phyir yul yin no// gal te 'di skad du 'gro bar byed pa yang lus nyid yin la 'gro bar bya ba yang lus
analyzed: lus gang g-yo ba de ni shes pa dang bcas pa bzhin du'o // bcas pa des don gang bsgrub par bya la thogs med par 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i mtshan nyid ni byed pa 'di'i bya ba yin pa'i phyir yul yin no// gal te 'di skad du 'gro bar byed pa yang lus nyid yin la 'gro bar bya ba yang lus
translated: The body that moves is endowed with consciousness.üîΩThe object is that which is characterized by going and coming without obstruction in the accomplishment of the purpose by that which is endowed.

original: nyid yin na de lta na ni sta re ji ltar rno yang rang gcod par mi rigs la gal te gcod na yang bya bar 'gyur gyi byed par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: nyid yin na de lta na ni sta re ji ltar rno yang rang gcod par mi rigs la gal te gcod na yang bya bar 'gyur gyi byed par mi 'gyur te /
translated: If one says that the body itself is that which goes and the body itself is that which is to be gone over, then just as an axe is sharp, it is not reasonable that it should cut itself. But if it cuts itself, then it would be the action and not the instrument.üîΩIt is contradictory for something to act on itself.

original: rang la rang byed pa 'gal lo zhe na 'di ni 'gal ba med de ;
analyzed: rang la rang byed pa 'gal lo zhe na 'di ni 'gal ba med de ;
translated: There is no contradiction here.

original: ji ltar sra ba nyid ni mtshon par byed pa rang nyid yin la bya ba yang rang nyid de /
analyzed: ji ltar sra ba nyid ni mtshon par byed pa rang nyid yin la bya ba yang rang nyid de /
translated: Just as hardness is the instrument that cuts itself and the action is itself,

original: 'di la don gzhan byed pa ni med do //
analyzed: 'di la don gzhan byed pa ni med do //
translated: there is no other thing that is the instrument in this.

original: de bzhin du lha spyin grong du 'gro bar bya ba dang byed pa gnyi ga lha spyin nyid yin no zhes bya ba dang / dge slong dag sems bsrung bar bya ba dang byed pa yang sems nyid yin zhes gsungs pa dang / snang ba dag rang gis rang snang bar byed pa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du lha spyin grong du 'gro bar bya ba dang byed pa gnyi ga lha spyin nyid yin no zhes bya ba dang / dge slong dag sems bsrung bar bya ba dang byed pa yang sems nyid yin zhes gsungs pa dang / snang ba dag rang gis rang snang bar byed pa dang /
translated: Likewise, it is said that Devadatta himself is both the goer and the going, and that the monk himself is both the protector and the protected.

original: de bzhin du rang la rang byed pa yang thams cad du mi 'thad pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du rang la rang byed pa yang thams cad du mi 'thad pa ni ma yin no //
translated: And it is not untenable in all respects to say that light illuminates itself, and that an action performs itself.

original: sta re dang shing lta bu dngos po tha dad pa'i bya ba dang byed par sbyor ba gcod pa'i bya ba dang byed par 'gyur ba ni gcig tu mi rung ngo //
analyzed: sta re dang shing lta bu dngos po tha dad pa'i bya ba dang byed par sbyor ba gcod pa'i bya ba dang byed par 'gyur ba ni gcig tu mi rung ngo //
translated: But it is not tenable to apply the action and instrument of cutting to an axe and a tree, which are different substantial entities, because the action of cutting is not the same as the action of moving.

original: g-yo ba'i bya ba la ni sta re yang g-yo ba'i las sta re nyid la yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: g-yo ba'i bya ba la ni sta re yang g-yo ba'i las sta re nyid la yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And the axe is not the object of the action of moving, because the axe itself moves.

original: bya ba dang byed pa gnyi ga yang sta re de nyid las gud na med do //
analyzed: bya ba dang byed pa gnyi ga yang sta re de nyid las gud na med do //
translated: The action and the instrument are not different from the axe.

original: de bzhin du las kyi 'jug pa 'di yang 'jug par bya ba dang byed pa gnyi ga lus nyid yin mod kyi /
analyzed: de bzhin du las kyi 'jug pa 'di yang 'jug par bya ba dang byed pa gnyi ga lus nyid yin mod kyi /
translated: Likewise, in this engagement of action, both the engagement and the agent are the body.

original: 'on kyang thogs pa med par 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i mtshan nyid skyes bu'i 'dod pa @274a * //
analyzed: 'on kyang thogs pa med par 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i mtshan nyid skyes bu'i 'dod pa @274a * //
translated: However, from the perspective of the person‚Äôs desire to go and return without obstruction,

original: yin pa'i sgo nas ni bya bar bzhag la /
analyzed: yin pa'i sgo nas ni bya bar bzhag la /
translated: it is posited as action.

original: yan lag gi g-yo ba de nyid 'dod pa bsgrub pa yin pa'i sgo nas dbye bar gzhag pa yang yin no //üîΩde bzhin du rang la byed pa thams cad kyang tshul 'ga'i sgo nas ni byed pa yin la /
analyzed: yan lag gi g-yo ba de nyid 'dod pa bsgrub pa yin pa'i sgo nas dbye bar gzhag pa yang yin no // de bzhin du rang la byed pa thams cad kyang tshul 'ga'i sgo nas ni byed pa yin la /
translated: And from the perspective of accomplishing the desire, that very movement of the limbs is posited as the division.üîΩLikewise, in all actions for oneself, one should understand that from one perspective it is action,

original: tshul 'ga'i sgo nas ni bya bar gzhag pa yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: tshul 'ga'i sgo nas ni bya bar gzhag pa yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: and from another perspective it is posited as action.

original: de ltar dgag pa'i yul bshad nas /
analyzed: de ltar dgag pa'i yul bshad nas /
translated: Having explained the object of negation in that way,

original: da ni dgag pa rang gi ngo bo bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni dgag pa rang gi ngo bo bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: now, in order to teach the nature of negation itself,

original: rang gi ngo bo'i dbye ba ni /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo'i dbye ba ni /
translated: the division of its nature is taught:üîΩThe division of negation is taughtüîΩby the absence of intrinsic reality,

original: rang bzhin ji ltar med pa dang // ji ltar go bar byed pa dang // ji ltar go bar bya ba yis //üîΩdgag pa'i dbye ba bstan pa yin //
analyzed: rang bzhin ji ltar med pa dang // ji ltar go bar byed pa dang // ji ltar go bar bya ba yis //üîΩdgag pa'i dbye ba bstan pa yin //
translated: how it is understood, and how it is to be understood.

original: zhes smos te /
analyzed: zhes smos te /
translated: This is what is meant.üîΩüîΩ

original: dgag pa rang gi ngo bo'i dbye ba ni med pa'i rang bzhin ji ltar med pa'i tshul dang / tshul ji ltar go bar byed pa dang / tshul ji ltar go bar bya ba yis phye ba shes par bya ste /
analyzed: dgag pa rang gi ngo bo'i dbye ba ni med pa'i rang bzhin ji ltar med pa'i tshul dang / tshul ji ltar go bar byed pa dang / tshul ji ltar go bar bya ba yis phye ba shes par bya ste /
translated: The classification of the nature of negation should be understood as the classification of the way in which non-existence is, the way in which it is understood, and the way in which it is to be understood.

original: de yang ji ltar yin zhe na /
analyzed: de yang ji ltar yin zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: 'di ltar tshul 'di dag gis gzhag pa ste gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ltar tshul 'di dag gis gzhag pa ste gang zhe na /
translated: In this way, it is posited by these modes. What is it?

original: rang bzhin ji ltar med pa ni //
analyzed: rang bzhin ji ltar med pa ni //
translated: The non-existence of nature

original: med pa rnam pa bzhi yin te //
analyzed: med pa rnam pa bzhi yin te //
translated: is fourfold non-existence,

original: ngo bo nyid kyis gzhag pa yin //üîΩzhes smos te /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis gzhag pa yin // zhes smos te /
translated: posited by intrinsic reality.

original: de la tshul ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la tshul ni 'di yin te /
translated: The mode is as follows.

original: med pa tshul gcig kyang med pa'i lugs tha dad de /
analyzed: med pa tshul gcig kyang med pa'i lugs tha dad de /
translated: Non-existence is of one mode, but the systems of non-existence are different.

original: med pa la la ni snga na med /
analyzed: med pa la la ni snga na med /
translated: Some non-existences are non-existent before.

original: de bzhin du la la ni zhig nas /
analyzed: de bzhin du la la ni zhig nas /
translated: Similarly, some are destroyed.

original: la la ni dngos po phan tshun gcig la gcig / la la ni gtan du ste lugs kyi tshul tha dad do //
analyzed: la la ni dngos po phan tshun gcig la gcig / la la ni gtan du ste lugs kyi tshul tha dad do //
translated: Some are mutually dependent on things, and some are permanent. The systems of the modes are different.

original: de dag ni rang gi ngo bos gzhag pa zhes bya ba ste bya'am byed pa gang la yang ltos pa med kyi /
analyzed: de dag ni rang gi ngo bos gzhag pa zhes bya ba ste bya'am byed pa gang la yang ltos pa med kyi /
translated: These are called ‚Äúestablished by own nature‚Äù because they do not depend on anything else, such as an agent or action.

original: med pa rang gi ngo bo nyid de lta yin te /
analyzed: med pa rang gi ngo bo nyid de lta yin te /
translated: They are non-existent by own nature.

original: de'i phyir de dag la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: Therefore, they are called that.üîΩThe mode and the classification of how one understands

original: tshul ji ltar go bar byed pa'i dbye ba dang tshul ni /
analyzed: tshul ji ltar go bar byed pa'i dbye ba dang tshul ni /
translated: .üîΩHow one understands

original: ji ltar go bar byed pa ni //üîΩdon gyis go ba la sogs pa'i //
analyzed: ji ltar go bar byed pa ni // don gyis go ba la sogs pa'i //
translated: How is it to be understood?üîΩBy the meaning, by the generalüîΩmeaning, by the specific meaning, by the implied meaning, by the indirectüîΩmeaning, and by the hidden meaning.üîΩ

original: dgag pa rnam pa lnga yin te //
analyzed: dgag pa rnam pa lnga yin te //
translated: Is by way of the five kinds of negationüîΩ.

original: sgra dang skabs kyis gzhag pa yin //üîΩzhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: sgra dang skabs kyis gzhag pa yin // zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: Which are established by the word and the context.

original: don ji ltar ston pa byed pa'i skabs kyi sgras byed pa'i lugs 'di dag yin te /
analyzed: don ji ltar ston pa byed pa'i skabs kyi sgras byed pa'i lugs 'di dag yin te /
translated: This is the system of the agent of how one teaches the meaning.

original: la la ni dgag pa'i don stobs kyis /
analyzed: la la ni dgag pa'i don stobs kyis /
translated: Some are by the power of the meaning of the negation.

original: la la ni dgag pa'i tshig gis /
analyzed: la la ni dgag pa'i tshig gis /
translated: Some are by the word of the negation.

original: la la ni de gnyi ga dang ldan pas /üîΩla la ni gzhan gyi tshig gis /
analyzed: la la ni de gnyi ga dang ldan pas / la la ni gzhan gyi tshig gis /
translated: Some are by both of those.üîΩSome are by the word of another.

original: la la ni sgra dngos su byed pas sgrub par byed de /
analyzed: la la ni sgra dngos su byed pas sgrub par byed de /
translated: Some are by the word itself.

original: de'i phyir de dag ni sgra dang / skabs kyis gzhag pa ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag ni sgra dang / skabs kyis gzhag pa ste /
translated: Therefore, they are established by the word and the context.

original: ji ltar go bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar go bar byed pa yin no //
translated: How is it that which is to be understood?

original: go bar byed pa'i dbang gis 'di skad du /
analyzed: go bar byed pa'i dbang gis 'di skad du /
translated: It is said that it is that which is to be understood by the power of the means of understanding.

original: ji ltar go bar bya ba ni //
analyzed: ji ltar go bar bya ba ni //
translated: How is it that which is to be understood?üîΩIt is that which is to be understood

original: med dang ma yin dbye ba yi //
analyzed: med dang ma yin dbye ba yi //
translated: by the classification of non-existence and non-entityness.

original: dgag pa brgyad sogs dbye ba ste//
analyzed: dgag pa brgyad sogs dbye ba ste//
translated: The classification of the eight negations and so onüîΩis posited by the entity of that which is to be understood.

original: @274b go bar bya ba'i dngos pos gzhag / ces smos te/ sogs zhes bya ba'i bsdu ba ni de las rgyas pa dang bsdus pa dag gi rnam grangs dag ste/ kha cig med par go bar bya ba/ kha gcig gzhan par zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: @274b go bar bya ba'i dngos pos gzhag / ces smos te/ sogs zhes bya ba'i bsdu ba ni de las rgyas pa dang bsdus pa dag gi rnam grangs dag ste/ kha cig med par go bar bya ba/ kha gcig gzhan par zhes bya ba nas /
translated: The term ‚Äúand so on‚Äù includes the extensive and condensed enumerations, such as some are to be understood as non-existent, some as other, and so on,

original: bral bar go bar bya ba'i bar du sngar brjod pa lta bu ste/ de dag kun kyang ji ltar go bar bya ba sha stag yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: bral bar go bar bya ba'i bar du sngar brjod pa lta bu ste/ de dag kun kyang ji ltar go bar bya ba sha stag yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar 'gyur ro ;
translated: up to some are to be understood as free from attachment, as stated previously. All of these are that which is to be understood because they are exclusively that which is to be understood.

original: /'o na ni med pa rnam pa bzhi yang med pa rang gi ngo bor bshad la /
analyzed: /'o na ni med pa rnam pa bzhi yang med pa rang gi ngo bor bshad la /
translated: Well then, the four types of non-existence are also explained as the nature of non-existence,

original: ji ltar go bar bya ba yang go bar bya ba'i ngo bos gzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar go bar bya ba yang go bar bya ba'i ngo bos gzhag pa yin no //
translated: and that which is to be understood is also posited by the nature of that which is to be understood.

original: de lta na ni go bar bya ba'i ngo bo de yang rang gi ngo bo yin te /
analyzed: de lta na ni go bar bya ba'i ngo bo de yang rang gi ngo bo yin te /
translated: If that is so, then the nature of the object of understanding is also its own nature,üîΩand there would be no difference between them.

original: bye brag med par 'gyur ro zhe na de bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bye brag med par 'gyur ro zhe na de bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To explain that, it is said:

original: ngo bo gnyis kyi bye brag ni //
analyzed: ngo bo gnyis kyi bye brag ni //
translated: The difference between the two natures

original: med pa'i dngos po med pa ste //üîΩyul dang dus la brten pa yi //
analyzed: med pa'i dngos po med pa ste // yul dang dus la brten pa yi //
translated: is that one is a non-existent thing.üîΩThe basis is called the basis

original: bye brag gis ni gzhi zhes bya //üîΩzhes smos te /
analyzed: bye brag gis ni gzhi zhes bya // zhes smos te /
translated: because it is based on place and time.

original: ngo bo 'di ni med pa'i ngo bo kho na yin la /
analyzed: ngo bo 'di ni med pa'i ngo bo kho na yin la /
translated: This nature is only a non-existent nature.

original: de'i dbye ba yang yul dang dus kyi mtshan gzhi brten pas gzhi yin no //
analyzed: de'i dbye ba yang yul dang dus kyi mtshan gzhi brten pas gzhi yin no //
translated: And its division is the basis because it is based on the characteristics of place and time.

original: gzhan ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: gzhan ni 'di yin te /
translated: Another explanation is:

original: go bar bya ba'i dngos po ni //
analyzed: go bar bya ba'i dngos po ni //
translated: The object of understanding

original: med dam gal te yod kyang rung //üîΩskyes bu'i 'dod pa'i dbang byas pa'i //
analyzed: med dam gal te yod kyang rung // skyes bu'i 'dod pa'i dbang byas pa'i //
translated: is either non-existent or, if existent,üîΩit is the power of the thing itself

original: dngos po nyid kyi stobs yin no// zhes pa ste /
analyzed: dngos po nyid kyi stobs yin no// zhes pa ste /
translated: that is controlled by the speaker's wish.

original: 'di ni med kyang rung yod kyang rung ste /
analyzed: 'di ni med kyang rung yod kyang rung ste /
translated: This is either non-existent or existent,

original: smra ba po'i go bar 'dod pas yul du byas pa'i dngos po la ji lta ba'i stobs yod par 'dod pa yin te /
analyzed: smra ba po'i go bar 'dod pas yul du byas pa'i dngos po la ji lta ba'i stobs yod par 'dod pa yin te /
translated: but the object that is made the object by the speaker's wish to understand is the power of the thing itself.

original: de lta na snga ma ni med pa nyid yin zhing bye brag kyang dngos po'i yul dang dus la brten pa yin la /
analyzed: de lta na snga ma ni med pa nyid yin zhing bye brag kyang dngos po'i yul dang dus la brten pa yin la /
translated: Thus, the former is non-existence, and the particular is based on the object and time of an entity.

original: 'di ni dngos po yang thams cad yin la skyes bu'i 'dod pa la yang brten pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni dngos po yang thams cad yin la skyes bu'i 'dod pa la yang brten pa yin te /
translated: But this is an entity, and it is also based on the desire of a person.

original: de'i phyir bye brag med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir bye brag med pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not non-particular.

original: de lta ma yin na med pa rnam pa bzhi po dgag pa'i yul du yang ci la 'gyur /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na med pa rnam pa bzhi po dgag pa'i yul du yang ci la 'gyur /
translated: Otherwise, how could the four kinds of non-existence be the object of negation?

original: de'i bye brag yul du byas pa la go bar bya ba tshol bar yang ci la 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i bye brag yul du byas pa la go bar bya ba tshol bar yang ci la 'gyur te /
translated: And how could the particular be sought to be understood as the object of that?

original: 'di gnyis la ni bye brag yod pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'di gnyis la ni bye brag yod pa nyid do //
translated: These two do exist as particular.

original: da ni dgag pa'i dgos pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni dgag pa'i dgos pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to show the purpose of negation, he says:

original: dgos pa dgag bya bzlog pa ste //
analyzed: dgos pa dgag bya bzlog pa ste //
translated: The purpose of negation is the reversal of the object of negation,

original: byed dang byed po'i 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: byed dang byed po'i 'dod pa'o //
translated: The desire of the agent and the object.

original: phyogs 'ga' dgag pa'am gzhan sogs pas //
analyzed: phyogs 'ga' dgag pa'am gzhan sogs pas //
translated: By negating a part, or by adding another,

original: 'dod pa brgyud pa yin yang ngo //
analyzed: 'dod pa brgyud pa yin yang ngo //
translated: The desired meaning is transmitted.

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says:

original: dgag par bya ba bzlog pas byed pa po'i 'dod pa ji ltar sgrub par byed pa'i don ni byed pa dang byed pa po'i 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: dgag par bya ba bzlog pas byed pa po'i 'dod pa ji ltar sgrub par byed pa'i don ni byed pa dang byed pa po'i 'dod pa yin no //
translated: The meaning of how the proponent establishes his desired object by refuting the object of negation is the desired object of the agent.

original: phyogs dgag pa ni thams cad dgag pas don mi 'gyur bar byed pa'i med pa'i sgra yin te /
analyzed: phyogs dgag pa ni thams cad dgag pas don mi 'gyur bar byed pa'i med pa'i sgra yin te /
translated: The term negation is a negative term that does not change the meaning by negating everything.

original: de dang gzhan dgag pa lta bus bsgrub par 'dod pa'i don brgyud pas ston kyang rung ste /
analyzed: de dang gzhan dgag pa lta bus bsgrub par 'dod pa'i don brgyud pas ston kyang rung ste /
translated: It may also indicate the desired object of the probandum by way of negation and other negation.

original: de dag ni dgag pa'i dgos pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni dgag pa'i dgos pa yin no //
translated: These are the purposes of negation.

original: dgag pa'i sgra ston pa ni /
analyzed: dgag pa'i sgra ston pa ni /
translated: The teaching of the term negation is:

original: sgra ni byed pa'i bdag nyid de //
analyzed: sgra ni byed pa'i bdag nyid de //
translated: Sound is the nature of the agent.

original: zhes smos te /üîΩbyed pa ni 'gegs par @275a * //
analyzed: zhes smos te / byed pa ni 'gegs par @275a * //
translated: This is stated.

original: byed pa'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: byed pa'i bdag nyid do //
translated: The agent is the nature of the refuter.

original: dus ston pa ni /
analyzed: dus ston pa ni /
translated: The teaching of time is:

original: dus ni rgyun ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: dus ni rgyun ces bya ba'o //
translated: Time is called a continuum.

original: zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: This is stated.

original: dus ni skad cig mang du 'dus pa'i bdag nyid rgyun gyi dbang tsam la bya ste /
analyzed: dus ni skad cig mang du 'dus pa'i bdag nyid rgyun gyi dbang tsam la bya ste /
translated: Time is merely the power of the continuum that is the nature of the collection of many moments.

original: rang gi ngo bo ni gzhan 'dod pa ltar rdzas su med ro //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo ni gzhan 'dod pa ltar rdzas su med ro //
translated: Its own nature does not substantially exist, as others assert.

original: gnas skabs ni dgos pa ji ltar sgrub pa'i 'dus la bya ste de'i phyir /
analyzed: gnas skabs ni dgos pa ji ltar sgrub pa'i 'dus la bya ste de'i phyir /
translated: The occasion is the collection of causes that accomplish the purpose.

original: dgos pa'i dus la skabs shes bya// zhes 'byung ba yin no// dgag par bya ba ni /
analyzed: dgos pa'i dus la skabs shes bya// zhes 'byung ba yin no// dgag par bya ba ni /
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚ÄúThe occasion is known as the time of the purpose.‚ÄùüîΩThe object of negation isüîΩthe object of negation is what is to be negated.üîΩTherefore, the sound by which something is to be negated is the object of negation.

original: bzlog par bya ba dgag bya'o// zhes 'byung bas sgra gang gis gang bzlog par bya ba de ni dgag par bya ba yin no zhes bya ba yin no// dgag pa'i ltos pa zhes bya ba gang la bya ba gang la bya zhe na /
analyzed: bzlog par bya ba dgag bya'o// zhes 'byung bas sgra gang gis gang bzlog par bya ba de ni dgag par bya ba yin no zhes bya ba yin no// dgag pa'i ltos pa zhes bya ba gang la bya ba gang la bya zhe na /
translated: What is the basis of the designation of the term ‚Äúnegation‚Äù?üîΩIt is said, ‚ÄúThe basis of the designation of the term ‚Äònegation‚Äô is

original: gang gi dpang gis gzhag pa ni //
analyzed: gang gi dpang gis gzhag pa ni //
translated: that by the power of which something is posited.‚Äù

original: dgag pa'i ltos pa zhes bya'o// zhes smos te yul la sogs pa gang gi dbang gis dgag pa grub par byed pa de de'i ltos pa zhes bya bar 'gyur te dper na rgyal po la brten pa'i mi bzhin no //
analyzed: dgag pa'i ltos pa zhes bya'o// zhes smos te yul la sogs pa gang gi dbang gis dgag pa grub par byed pa de de'i ltos pa zhes bya bar 'gyur te dper na rgyal po la brten pa'i mi bzhin no //
translated: The power of the object and so on by which a negation is accomplished is the basis of the designation of the term ‚Äúnegation,‚Äù just as a person who is dependent on a king is called a ‚Äúking‚Äôs man.‚Äù

original: dgag pa'i nges tshig ni ldog pa nyid yin no zhes pa ste /
analyzed: dgag pa'i nges tshig ni ldog pa nyid yin no zhes pa ste /
translated: The definition of negation is ‚Äúthat which is an exclusion.‚Äù

original: gong du bshad zin to //
analyzed: gong du bshad zin to //
translated: This has already been explained above.

original: da ni rab tu gsal bar brjod pa bstan pa la dgag pa rang gi ngo bo bstan pa'i skabs su med pa rnam pa bzhi bstan pa la /üîΩde'i dbye ba ma bstan pas de bstan par 'dod nas dang po sngan med pa la brtsams nas 'di ltar /
analyzed: da ni rab tu gsal bar brjod pa bstan pa la dgag pa rang gi ngo bo bstan pa'i skabs su med pa rnam pa bzhi bstan pa la / de'i dbye ba ma bstan pas de bstan par 'dod nas dang po sngan med pa la brtsams nas 'di ltar /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate the refutation of the intrinsic reality of non-existence, having taught the four types of non-existence in the context of the refutation of the intrinsic reality of non-existence, since their divisions were not taught, in order to teach them, beginning with the non-existence of the prior, it is said:üîΩThe non-existence of the prior

original: snga na med pa'i bye brag ni //
analyzed: snga na med pa'i bye brag ni //
translated: Is the non-existence of the prior in the continuum,üîΩThe non-existence of the prior in the nature,üîΩThe non-existence of the prior in the state,

original: rgyun 'dra ba dang rang bzhin dang // skabs dang rten la med pa'o //üîΩzhes smos te /
analyzed: rgyun 'dra ba dang rang bzhin dang // skabs dang rten la med pa'o // zhes smos te /
translated: And the non-existence of the prior in the basis.üîΩThus, the non-existence of the prior is of four types: the non-existence of the prior in the continuum, the non-existence of the prior in the nature, the non-existence of the prior in the state, and the non-existence of the prior in the basis.

original: 'di ltar rgyun 'dra ba snga na med pa dang / rang bzhin snga na med ba dang / gnas skabs snga na med pa dang / rten la snga na med pa ste 'di rnams snga na med pa'i bye brag rnam pa bzhi'o //üîΩzhig nas med pa'i bye brag ni 'di skad du /
analyzed: 'di ltar rgyun 'dra ba snga na med pa dang / rang bzhin snga na med ba dang / gnas skabs snga na med pa dang / rten la snga na med pa ste 'di rnams snga na med pa'i bye brag rnam pa bzhi'o // zhig nas med pa'i bye brag ni 'di skad du /
translated: The four types of non-existence of the prior are taught in this way.üîΩThe non-existence of the prior in the continuum,üîΩThe non-existence of the prior in the nature,üîΩThe non-existence of the prior in the state,

original: rgyun zhig pa dang rang bzhin dang // skabs dang rten las bral pa yis //
analyzed: rgyun zhig pa dang rang bzhin dang // skabs dang rten las bral pa yis //
translated: And the non-existence of the prior in the basis.

original: zhig nas med pa bzhi yin no //üîΩzhes smos pa yin te /
analyzed: zhig nas med pa bzhi yin no //üîΩzhes smos pa yin te /
translated: The four types of non-existence of the prior are taught in this way.üîΩThe four types of non-existence of the prior are taught in this way.üîΩThe four types of non-existence of the prior are taught in this way.üîΩThe four types of non-existence of the prior are taught in this way.üîΩThe four types of non-existence of the prior are taught in this way.üîΩThe four types of non-existence of the prior are taught in this way.üîΩThe four types of non-existence of the prior are taught in this way.üîΩThe four types of non-existence of the prior are taught in this way.üîΩThe four types of non-existence of the prior are taught in this way.üîΩThe four types of non-existence of the prior are taught in this way.üîΩThe four types of non-existence of the prior are taught in this way.üîΩThe four types of non-existence of the prior are taught in this way.üîΩThe four types of non-existence of the prior are taught in this way.üîΩThe four types of non-existence of the prior are taught in this way.üîΩThe four types of non-existence of the prior are taught in this way.

original: 'di ltar rgyun zhig nas med pa dang / rang bzhin zhig nas med pa dang / gnas skabs zhig nas med pa dang / rten las bral te med pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar rgyun zhig nas med pa dang / rang bzhin zhig nas med pa dang / gnas skabs zhig nas med pa dang / rten las bral te med pa ste /
translated: Thus, non-existence through the destruction of a continuum, non-existence through the destruction of a nature, non-existence through the destruction of a state, and non-existence through the separation from a basis.

original: zhig nas med pa rnam pa bzhi yin no //
analyzed: zhig nas med pa rnam pa bzhi yin no //
translated: These are the four kinds of non-existence through destruction.üîΩNon-existence through mutual exclusion is the non-existence of one characteristic in another, the non-existence of one distinction in another, and the non-existence of one nature in another.

original: gcig la gcig med pa ni mtshan nyid gcig la gcig med pa dang / khyad par gcig la gcig med pa dang / rang bzhin gcig la gcig med pa'i dbye ba yod mod kyi rang bzhin gcig la gcig med par 'du ste /
analyzed: gcig la gcig med pa ni mtshan nyid gcig la gcig med pa dang / khyad par gcig la gcig med pa dang / rang bzhin gcig la gcig med pa'i dbye ba yod mod kyi rang bzhin gcig la gcig med par 'du ste /
translated: Although there are these distinctions, they are included in the non-existence of one nature in another.

original: gang gi phyir mtshan nyid dang khyad par ni mtshan gzhi dang khyad par can med par mi gnas la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir mtshan nyid dang khyad par ni mtshan gzhi dang khyad par can med par mi gnas la /
translated: Because a characteristic and a distinction do not remain without a basis of characteristics and a basis of distinctions.

original: mtshan gzhi dang khyad par can ni rang bzhin yin te /
analyzed: mtshan gzhi dang khyad par can ni rang bzhin yin te /
translated: The basis of characteristics and the basis of distinctions are natures.

original: de bas na gzhi tha dad pa na mtshan nyid tha mi dad kyang de dag 'dra ba zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na gzhi tha dad pa na mtshan nyid tha mi dad kyang de dag 'dra ba zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, when the bases are different, the characteristics are not different, but they are said to be similar.

original: de la rang bzhin gcig la gcig med pa ni shin tu mtshungs pa'i gser gyi gdub rgyan lta @275b bu'o //
analyzed: de la rang bzhin gcig la gcig med pa ni shin tu mtshungs pa'i gser gyi gdub rgyan lta @275b bu'o //
translated: In this regard, the absence of one nature in another is like a golden bracelet, for example.

original: mtshan nyid gcig la gcig med pa ni sra ba dang / gsher ba dang / tsha ba dang / grang ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid gcig la gcig med pa ni sra ba dang / gsher ba dang / tsha ba dang / grang ba lta bu'o //
translated: The absence of one characteristic in another is like solidity, fluidity, heat, and motility, for example.

original: khyad par gcig la gcig med pa ni ring po dang thung du lta bu'o //
analyzed: khyad par gcig la gcig med pa ni ring po dang thung du lta bu'o //
translated: The absence of one attribute in another is like long and short, for example.

original: gang rang las log pa de ni gzhan yin la /
analyzed: gang rang las log pa de ni gzhan yin la /
translated: That which is different from itself is different.

original: gzhan pa dang bdag tu ni gcig la gcig gis stong ste rang nyid las gzhan pa de yang gang bzhin dang / mtshan nyid dang / khyad par gsum yin te /
analyzed: gzhan pa dang bdag tu ni gcig la gcig gis stong ste rang nyid las gzhan pa de yang gang bzhin dang / mtshan nyid dang / khyad par gsum yin te /
translated: And that which is different from itself is empty of itself, for it is threefold: nature, characteristic, and attribute.

original: de ltar yang /
analyzed: de ltar yang /
translated: Thus it is said:

original: de la gzhan ni rnam gsum ste //
analyzed: de la gzhan ni rnam gsum ste //
translated: Difference is threefold:

original: ngo bo khyad par mtshan nyid dag /üîΩrang las log pa gzhan du 'dod //
analyzed: ngo bo khyad par mtshan nyid dag / rang las log pa gzhan du 'dod //
translated: Nature, attribute, and characteristic.

original: ces 'byung ba lta bu yin no //
analyzed: ces 'byung ba lta bu yin no //
translated: That which is different from itself is accepted as different.

original: de la shin tu mtshungs pa'i gser gyi gdub rgyan la ni rigs kyi mtshan nyid dang / sra ba dang / mnyan pa dang / sar bdag dbyibs dang ; bong tshod dag la khyad par cung zad kyang med cing mtshungs kyang rang bzhin tha dad do //
analyzed: de la shin tu mtshungs pa'i gser gyi gdub rgyan la ni rigs kyi mtshan nyid dang / sra ba dang / mnyan pa dang / sar bdag dbyibs dang ; bong tshod dag la khyad par cung zad kyang med cing mtshungs kyang rang bzhin tha dad do //
translated: In this case, the golden bracelets are similar in kind, in being hard, in being heavy, in being yellow, and in shape and size, and there is not the slightest difference between them. But they are different in nature.

original: tshogs pa gcig pa dag ni khyad par tha dad pa dang mtshan nyid tha dad par dbye ba yang yod de /
analyzed: tshogs pa gcig pa dag ni khyad par tha dad pa dang mtshan nyid tha dad par dbye ba yang yod de /
translated: In the case of a single collection, there is a difference in the individual characteristics and a difference in the individual natures.

original: tshogs pa tha dad na mtshan nyid gcig pa dag kyang yod do //
analyzed: tshogs pa tha dad na mtshan nyid gcig pa dag kyang yod do //
translated: In the case of different collections, there is a single characteristic.

original: de ltar dbye ba du ma yod kyang rang bzhin nyid du bsdus pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar dbye ba du ma yod kyang rang bzhin nyid du bsdus pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, although there are many different kinds of collections, they are all included in the nature of a collection.

original: phan tshun gcig la gcig med pa //
analyzed: phan tshun gcig la gcig med pa //
translated: They are not mutually exclusive.

original: mtshan nyid dbye ba yod mod kyi //
analyzed: mtshan nyid dbye ba yod mod kyi //
translated: Although there is a difference in the characteristics,

original: rang bzhin nyid du bsdu bya ste //
analyzed: rang bzhin nyid du bsdu bya ste //
translated: they are all included in the nature of a collection.

original: ji ltar gser gyi gdub rgyan dag / rigs dang bzo dang bong tshod dang // kha dog dbyibs rnams mtshungs mod kyi //
analyzed: ji ltar gser gyi gdub rgyan dag / rigs dang bzo dang bong tshod dang // kha dog dbyibs rnams mtshungs mod kyi //
translated: Just as the golden bracelets are similar in kind, in being hard, in being heavy, in being yellow, and in shape and size,

original: gcig gi rang bzhin gcig ma yin //
analyzed: gcig gi rang bzhin gcig ma yin //
translated: but the nature of one is not the nature of the other.

original: yin na cig car gzung bar 'gyur //üîΩzhes bya ba smos pa yin no// yin na cig car gzung bar 'gyur //
analyzed: yin na cig car gzung bar 'gyur // zhes bya ba smos pa yin no// yin na cig car gzung bar 'gyur //
translated: If they were, they would be apprehended simultaneously.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'di'i gtan tshigs yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'di'i gtan tshigs yin te /
translated: This is the argument.

original: 'di ltar gal te gcig par gyur cing gcig gis gcig stong pa ma yin na gzung bas thams cad gzung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar gal te gcig par gyur cing gcig gis gcig stong pa ma yin na gzung bas thams cad gzung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If they were not different from each other, then by apprehending one, all would be apprehended.

original: de lta na ni dngos po tha dad pa thams cad kyang gcig pa'i phyir sman zos na dug kyang zos par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na ni dngos po tha dad pa thams cad kyang gcig pa'i phyir sman zos na dug kyang zos par 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, since all different things would be one, by eating medicine, one would also be eating poison.

original: de'i phyir shin tu mtshungs pa dag kyang gcig gis gcig stong bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir shin tu mtshungs pa dag kyang gcig gis gcig stong bar shes par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, even though they are very similar, they should be understood as being different from each other.

original: ji ltar rang bzhin tha dad pa'i sgo nas rang bzhin gyis stong pa'i mtshan nyid tha dad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar rang bzhin tha dad pa'i sgo nas rang bzhin gyis stong pa'i mtshan nyid tha dad pa ma yin no //
translated: Just as, from the point of view of their different natures, they are not different in being empty of intrinsic reality.

original: 'di ltar 'dod chags rang bzhin gyis stong pa dang / ma chags pa rang bzhin gyis stong pa 'di la yang tha dad cung zad kyang mad do //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'dod chags rang bzhin gyis stong pa dang / ma chags pa rang bzhin gyis stong pa 'di la yang tha dad cung zad kyang mad do //
translated: Thus, there is not the slightest difference between the emptiness of intrinsic reality of attachment and the emptiness of intrinsic reality of non-attachment.

original: de'i phyir stong pa nyid kyi dbang du byas nas gcig gis gcig stong zhes bzhag pa ma yin te dngos po kho na'i dbang du byas pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir stong pa nyid kyi dbang du byas nas gcig gis gcig stong zhes bzhag pa ma yin te dngos po kho na'i dbang du byas pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not that they are empty of each other from the perspective of emptiness, but rather that they are empty of themselves.

original: da ni shin tu med pa'i bye brag bstan pa na /
analyzed: da ni shin tu med pa'i bye brag bstan pa na /
translated: Now, the distinction between complete non-existence is taught.

original: shin tu med pa'i bye brag ni //
analyzed: shin tu med pa'i bye brag ni //
translated: The distinction between complete non-existence

original: rgyu dang rang bzhin gnyis su shes //üîΩzhes bya ba yin te /üîΩ'di ltar rang bzhin shen tu med pa dang / rgyu @276a * //
analyzed: rgyu dang rang bzhin gnyis su shes // zhes bya ba yin te / 'di ltar rang bzhin shen tu med pa dang / rgyu @276a * //
translated: is known as twofold: cause and nature.

original: shin tu med pa gnyis so //
analyzed: shin tu med pa gnyis so //
translated: Thus, there are two types: complete non-existence of nature and complete non-existence of cause.

original: da ni bye brag de dag bshad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni bye brag de dag bshad pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to explain those distinctions,

original: sems can skye ba la sogs pa //
analyzed: sems can skye ba la sogs pa //
translated: the arising of sentient beings, etc.

original: rgyun dmigs pa yi rang bzhin ni //
analyzed: rgyun dmigs pa yi rang bzhin ni //
translated: The nature of the observed continuum

original: rgyun 'dra snga na med pa'o //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rgyun 'dra snga na med pa'o // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: is similar to the continuum, but not prior.

original: sems can skye ba ni ma byung ba las 'byung ba'i 'du byed de /
analyzed: sems can skye ba ni ma byung ba las 'byung ba'i 'du byed de /
translated: The arising of sentient beings is the formation that occurs from what was not.

original: skye ba'i tshe dmigs pa de'i rgyun nim dmigs te rgyun 'dra ba med pa yin no //
analyzed: skye ba'i tshe dmigs pa de'i rgyun nim dmigs te rgyun 'dra ba med pa yin no //
translated: When it arises, its continuum is not observed, because there is no similar continuum.

original: 'jig rten dag na yang 'chags pa'i tshe ma byung ba las byung ba ste gnas pa'i rgyun 'dra ba med do //
analyzed: 'jig rten dag na yang 'chags pa'i tshe ma byung ba las byung ba ste gnas pa'i rgyun 'dra ba med do //
translated: In the world, too, when things are created, they arise from what did not exist before, and there is no continuity of a similar type of duration.

original: de bzhin du shing la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi rgyu ma dmigs pa las rang bzhin mi dmigs pa dang / snga na med pa zhes rjod par byed de /
analyzed: de bzhin du shing la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi rgyu ma dmigs pa las rang bzhin mi dmigs pa dang / snga na med pa zhes rjod par byed de /
translated: In the same way, the nonapprehension of the cause of intrinsic reality in such things as a sprout is called the nonapprehension of intrinsic reality and the nonexistence of what was before.

original: de ni rgyun 'dra ba snga na med pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni rgyun 'dra ba snga na med pa yin no //
translated: This is the nonexistence of what was before in the continuity of a similar type.

original: rang bzhin snga na med pa ni //üîΩsa bon sa dang 'o ma la //
analyzed: rang bzhin snga na med pa ni // sa bon sa dang 'o ma la //
translated: The nonexistence of what was before in intrinsic reality isüîΩin the seed, the earth, and the milk,

original: myu gu bum pa mar rnams ni //üîΩrang bzhin snga na med pa'o //
analyzed: myu gu bum pa mar rnams ni // rang bzhin snga na med pa'o //
translated: the sprout, the pot, and the butter

original: zhes smos te /
analyzed: zhes smos te /
translated: are the nonexistence of what was before in intrinsic reality.

original: 'di ltar sa bon gyi dus na myu gu'i rang bzhin dang / de bzhin dus dang 'o ma'i dus na bum pa dang mar rnams kyi rang bzhin med de /
analyzed: 'di ltar sa bon gyi dus na myu gu'i rang bzhin dang / de bzhin dus dang 'o ma'i dus na bum pa dang mar rnams kyi rang bzhin med de /
translated: Thus, at the time of the seed, the intrinsic reality of the sprout does not exist, and in the same way, at the time of the earth and the milk, the intrinsic reality of the pot and the butter do not exist.

original: de lta bu dag ni rang bzhin snga na med pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bu dag ni rang bzhin snga na med pa yin no //
translated: Such are the nonexistence of what was before in intrinsic reality.

original: gnas skabs snga na med pa ni //
analyzed: gnas skabs snga na med pa ni //
translated: The nonexistence of what was before in the state is

original: ji ltar gser las rgyan sogs ni //
analyzed: ji ltar gser las rgyan sogs ni //
translated: like the ornaments, etc., made from gold.

original: gnas skabs snga na med pa'o //
analyzed: gnas skabs snga na med pa'o //
translated: They are the nonexistence of what was before in the state.

original: zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: This is the meaning.üîΩüîΩ

original: ji ltar gser dang rang bzhin gcig pa las gnas skabs bzo tha dad par byas pa lta bu dag go zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ji ltar gser dang rang bzhin gcig pa las gnas skabs bzo tha dad par byas pa lta bu dag go zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Just as gold and its various shapes are the same in nature, so too are the basic and derivative material elements.

original: rten la snga na med pa ni //
analyzed: rten la snga na med pa ni //
translated: Nonexistence prior to the basisüîΩCows were nonexistent on this spot

original: sa phyogs 'di na ba lang dag / sngon chad med pa rten la'o //üîΩzhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: sa phyogs 'di na ba lang dag / sngon chad med pa rten la'o // zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: prior to their being brought here.

original: phyogs gang na sngar ba lang gi stong pa las phyis ba lang dmigs na de snga na med pa'i ba lang zhes brjod do //
analyzed: phyogs gang na sngar ba lang gi stong pa las phyis ba lang dmigs na de snga na med pa'i ba lang zhes brjod do //
translated: When cows are seen on a spot where they were not seen before, one says, ‚ÄúCows were nonexistent here before.‚Äù

original: de ni rten la med pa yin te /
analyzed: de ni rten la med pa yin te /
translated: This is nonexistence prior to the basis.

original: snga na med ces thun mong du brjod pa thams cad kyang bye brag gis de ltar gnas pa sha stag ste /
analyzed: snga na med ces thun mong du brjod pa thams cad kyang bye brag gis de ltar gnas pa sha stag ste /
translated: All instances of nonexistence prior to the basis are to be understood in this way.

original: de la smra bar byed pas bye brag dbye bar bya'o //
analyzed: de la smra bar byed pas bye brag dbye bar bya'o //
translated: One should distinguish the various types of nonexistence prior to the basis.

original: de bzhin du 'og ma kun la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'og ma kun la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The same method applies to all the other types of nonexistence.

original: da ni zhig nas med pa'i bye brag bshad par 'dod nas /
analyzed: da ni zhig nas med pa'i bye brag bshad par 'dod nas /
translated: Now, in order to explain the various types of postdisintegration nonexistence,

original: ljon pa'am skyes bu la sogs pa //
analyzed: ljon pa'am skyes bu la sogs pa //
translated: trees, persons, and so on

original: tshig gam shi bar gyur pa dag / rgyun zhig gyur te med pa'o //üîΩzhes smos te /
analyzed: tshig gam shi bar gyur pa dag / rgyun zhig gyur te med pa'o // zhes smos te /
translated: The cessation of a continuum is like the burning of a tree or the death of a person.

original: 'di ltar shing ljon pa tshig ste shing gi bya ba mi byed pa dang / skyes bu shi nas skyes bu'i bya ba mi byed pa lta bu ni rgyun zhig nas med pa'o //üîΩmyu gu bum pa mar rnams la //üîΩsa bon sa dang 'o ma ni //
analyzed: 'di ltar shing ljon pa tshig ste shing gi bya ba mi byed pa dang / skyes bu shi nas skyes bu'i bya ba mi byed pa lta bu ni rgyun zhig nas med pa'o // myu gu bum pa mar rnams la // sa bon sa dang 'o ma ni //
translated: A tree is said to be burned when it no longer performs the function of a tree. A person is said to be dead when he no longer performs the function of a person.

original: rang bzhin zhig nas med pa'o //üîΩzhes smos te /
analyzed: rang bzhin zhig nas med pa'o // zhes smos te /
translated: The cessation of a nature is like the cessation of a seed, of earth, or of milk.

original: myu gu dang bum pa'i dus nas bon dang sa'i rang bzhin zhig nas med pa dang / de bzhin du 'bras bu @276b mar gyi dus na rgyu'i 'o ma rang bzhin zhig nas med pa ste /
analyzed: myu gu dang bum pa'i dus nas bon dang sa'i rang bzhin zhig nas med pa dang / de bzhin du 'bras bu @276b mar gyi dus na rgyu'i 'o ma rang bzhin zhig nas med pa ste /
translated: A seed is said to cease when it no longer has the nature of a seed. Earth is said to cease when it no longer has the nature of earth. Milk is said to cease when it no longer has the nature of milk.

original: de lta bu dag ni rang bzhin zhig nas med pa zhes bya'o //üîΩgnas skabs zhig nas med pa ni //
analyzed: de lta bu dag ni rang bzhin zhig nas med pa zhes bya'o // gnas skabs zhig nas med pa ni //
translated: These are said to be the cessation of a nature.

original: ji ltar gser gyi gdub rgyan las //üîΩrna cha dag ni skabs zhig pa //
analyzed: ji ltar gser gyi gdub rgyan las // rna cha dag ni skabs zhig pa //
translated: The cessation of a state is like the cessation of an earring.

original: zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: An earring is said to cease when it is removed from the ear.

original: sngar gdub rgyan dmigs nas de dag rna char byas pa dmigs pa las rna cha'i dus na gdub rgyan zhig nas med de /
analyzed: sngar gdub rgyan dmigs nas de dag rna char byas pa dmigs pa las rna cha'i dus na gdub rgyan zhig nas med de /
translated: Previously, when the bracelet was observed, it was made into earrings. When the earrings are observed, the bracelet is not observed to exist.

original: de lta bu dag ni gnas skabs zhig nas med pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bu dag ni gnas skabs zhig nas med pa yin no //
translated: Such things are not existent due to the disintegration of their state.

original: de la gser gyi gdub rgyan med ces brjod na med pa'i mtshan nyid de de ltar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de la gser gyi gdub rgyan med ces brjod na med pa'i mtshan nyid de de ltar shes par bya'o //
translated: If it is said that the golden bracelet does not exist, the characteristic of nonexistence should be understood in that way.

original: rten las bral te med pa ston pa ni /
analyzed: rten las bral te med pa ston pa ni /
translated: The teaching on nonexistence due to separation from a basis is:

original: sa phyogs 'di nas bum pa dag / gzhan du 'phos te med pa ni //
analyzed: sa phyogs 'di nas bum pa dag / gzhan du 'phos te med pa ni //
translated: The vase is not here, having moved to another place.

original: rten las bral te med pa'o //üîΩzhes smos te /
analyzed: rten las bral te med pa'o // zhes smos te /
translated: This is nonexistence due to separation from a basis.

original: phyogs 'di nas bum pa phyogs gzhan du 'phos te med pa ni rten las bral te med pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: phyogs 'di nas bum pa phyogs gzhan du 'phos te med pa ni rten las bral te med pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The vase is not here, having moved to another place. This is called nonexistence due to separation from a basis.

original: shin tu med pa las rang bzhin dang rgyu med pa gnyi ga / ri bong rnga mo bong bu la //
analyzed: shin tu med pa las rang bzhin dang rgyu med pa gnyi ga / ri bong rnga mo bong bu la //
translated: The teaching on both natural nonexistence and causeless nonexistence from utter nonexistence is:üîΩThe rabbit, camel, and donkey do not have horns.

original: rva dang rva yi rgyu med ces //
analyzed: rva dang rva yi rgyu med ces //
translated: There is no cause for horns.

original: rang bzhin dgag dang rgyu dgag pa'o //üîΩzhes bya bas bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: rang bzhin dgag dang rgyu dgag pa'o //üîΩzhes bya bas bstan pa yin te /
translated: This is the negation of nature and the negation of cause.

original: ri bong la rva med do //
analyzed: ri bong la rva med do //
translated: The horn of a rabbit does not exist.

original: de bzhin du ri bong la rva thams cad du thams cad med pa'i phyir rgyu yang med de /
analyzed: de bzhin du ri bong la rva thams cad du thams cad med pa'i phyir rgyu yang med de /
translated: Similarly, since the horn of a rabbit does not exist in any way, a cause also does not exist.

original: gal te rgyu yod na rkyen 'bras bu 'byung ba yang srid pa zhig na /
analyzed: gal te rgyu yod na rkyen 'bras bu 'byung ba yang srid pa zhig na /
translated: If a cause exists, then it is possible that conditions will produce an effect.

original: ri bong la rva mi srid pa'i phyir rgyu yang med do //
analyzed: ri bong la rva mi srid pa'i phyir rgyu yang med do //
translated: But since the horn of a rabbit is impossible, a cause also does not exist.

original: mdor na rgyu med pas 'bras bu mi skyed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mdor na rgyu med pas 'bras bu mi skyed pa'i phyir /
translated: In brief, since a cause that does not exist does not produce an effect,

original: rgyu med par shes na 'bras bu'ang med par brjod du rung ngo //
analyzed: rgyu med par shes na 'bras bu'ang med par brjod du rung ngo //
translated: if you understand that a cause does not exist, then it is appropriate to say that an effect also does not exist.

original: 'bras bu ni thams cad du thams cad med par shes na rgyu yang med par brjod du rung gi /'gas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu ni thams cad du thams cad med par shes na rgyu yang med par brjod du rung gi /'gas ni ma yin no //
translated: If you understand that an effect does not exist in any way, then it is appropriate to say that a cause also does not exist, but not if you do not understand that.

original: da ni dgag pa'i dus can bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni dgag pa'i dus can bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to teach that negation depends on time,üîΩhe says:

original: dgag pa dus la ltos pa ni //
analyzed: dgag pa dus la ltos pa ni //
translated: Negation depends on time,

original: dngos po'i dus la ltos pa ste //
analyzed: dngos po'i dus la ltos pa ste //
translated: because it depends on the time of an entity.

original: smra ba po yi dus la ni //
analyzed: smra ba po yi dus la ni //
translated: As for the time of the speaker,

original: nam yang khong du chud pa 'dzin //üîΩces smos pa yin te /
analyzed: nam yang khong du chud pa 'dzin //üîΩces smos pa yin te /
translated: it is always understood.

original: dus la ltos pa ni khyad par snga na med pa dang / zhig nas med pa yin la /
analyzed: dus la ltos pa ni khyad par snga na med pa dang / zhig nas med pa yin la /
translated: nonexistence and the post-disintegration nonexistence.

original: de ni dngos po nyid kyi dus yin te /
analyzed: de ni dngos po nyid kyi dus yin te /
translated: This is the time of the thing itself.

original: smra ba po'i dus ni 'di ltar 'di na bum pa med ce'am /
analyzed: smra ba po'i dus ni 'di ltar 'di na bum pa med ce'am /
translated: The time of the speaker is like the following: ‚ÄúHere, there is no pot,‚Äù

original: sngon chad ces bya ba ni khong du chud pa'i dus yin te /
analyzed: sngon chad ces bya ba ni khong du chud pa'i dus yin te /
translated: or ‚ÄúIt was like this in the past.‚Äù The time of understanding is like this.

original: de ma bzung bar ni grub par mi byed mod kyi /
analyzed: de ma bzung bar ni grub par mi byed mod kyi /
translated: Without grasping it, one does not perform the action.

original: smra ba po de yang dngos po'i dus la byed do //
analyzed: smra ba po de yang dngos po'i dus la byed do //
translated: However, the time of the speaker is the time of the thing itself.

original: de'i phyir nam yang zhes smos pa yin te /üîΩnam yang rung ste rtogs pa ji @277a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir nam yang zhes smos pa yin te / nam yang rung ste rtogs pa ji @277a * //
